original: tasya svābhāvikakāyena nirālambakaruṇātmakena saha savaram ekatvam /
analyzed: tasya svābhāvika kāyena nirālamba karuṇā ātmakena saha savaram ekatvam

analyzed: sūryaḥ dvādaśa śūnyatā ātmakaḥ iti

analyzed: evam ukta krameṇa

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus it is said.

original: iha pūrvokte śūnyadhātau sarvātmadharmiṇi sadā sarvasmin kāle 'tītānāgatavartamāne sthita utpādavināśadharmābhāvāt /

translated: Here, in the realm of emptiness stated before, which has the nature of all, always at all times, in the past, future, and present, because of the absence of the nature of arising and ceasing,

analyzed: sarva dūtī mayaḥ sattvaḥ iti
translated: The being consisting of all the messengers.

original: dūtyo ḍākinyas tā ākāśasamāḥ skandhadhātvāyatanāva raṇaprahīṇā ākāśacarāḥ /
analyzed: dūtyaḥ ḍākinyaḥ tāḥ ākāśa samāḥ skandha dhātu āyatana ava raṇa prahīṇāḥ ākāśa carāḥ
translated: The messengers are the Dakinis, who are equal to space, free from the afflictions of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, moving in the sky.

analyzed: vaihāyasa gamane iti dhātu pāṭhāt
translated: Dai means moving in the sky, according to the Dhatupatha.

analyzed: na sarva sattva apakāriṇyaḥ grāma daivatyaḥ pīṭha upapīṭha ādi āśritāḥ iti
translated: They are not those who harm all beings, who reside in villages, sacred sites, subsidiary sacred sites, and so forth.

analyzed: tāḥ saptatriśat bodhi pākṣika dharma svabhāva viśuddhāḥ
translated: They are purified by the nature of the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment.

original: tanmayaḥ sarvadūtīmayaḥ sattvas traidhātuka lakṣaṇadharmakāya iti /
analyzed: tad mayaḥ sarva dūtī mayaḥ sattvaḥ traidhātuka lakṣaṇa dharmakāyaḥ iti
translated: The being consisting of them, consisting of all the messengers, is the Dharma Body characterized by the three realms.

analyzed: vajra sattvaḥ sukham iti
translated: The Vajra Being is the highest bliss.

original: sahajakāyaś caturthaḥ para sukham akṣarasukham ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: sahaja kāyaḥ caturthaḥ sukham akṣara sukham iti arthaḥ
translated: The innate body is the fourth, meaning the bliss of others, the bliss of the imperishable.

original: anayor dharmakāyasahajakāyayor ekatva vajrasattva ity ucyate /
analyzed: anayoḥ dharmakāya sahaja kāyayoḥ vajrasattvaḥ iti ucyate
translated: These two, the Dharma body and the innate body, are called Vajrasattva when they are one.

analyzed: vajram iti dharmakāyaḥ śūnyatā prajñā
translated: Vajra means the Dharma body, emptiness, wisdom.

analyzed: sattvam iti sahaja kāyaḥ karuṇā upāyaḥ
translated: Sattva means the innate body, compassion, method.

analyzed: eva prajñā upāya ātmakaḥ heruka sayogaḥ vajra sattvaḥ bhidhīyate
translated: Thus, the yoga of Heruka, which is the essence of wisdom and method, is called Vajrasattva.

translated: Here, the self-existent one is Brahma, and he is the body vajra Vairocana, because it is said that Brahma, the bearer of the body vajra, is to be understood by another tantra.

analyzed: sa ca tat yathā

analyzed: vairocanaḥ mahā dīptiḥ jñāna jyotiḥ virocanaḥ

original: ītyādinā vajrāṅkūśo mahāpāśa itiparyantagāthābhir jñātavyaḥ svayambhūr vairocano nirmāṇakāyaḥ sarvākāravaropeta iti ḍākinījālasavaraniyamaḥ
analyzed: ītyādinā vajra aṅkūśaḥ mahā pāśaḥ iti paryanta gāthābhiḥ jñātavyaḥ svayambhūḥ vairocanaḥ nirmāṇa kāyaḥ sarva ākāra vara upetaḥ iti ḍākinī jāla sa vara niyamaḥ
translated: The self-arisen Vairocana, endowed with all supreme aspects, should be known by oneself through the verses beginning with vajra hook up to great noose, as stated in the Dākinījālasaṁvara:

original: Commentary on CS nādarūpā viniṣkrāntā samayācāragocarā //
analyzed: commentary on cs ab nāda rūpā viniṣkrāntā samayācāra gocarā
translated: The form of sound, arisen from the domain of conduct and observances.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

analyzed: atas sahaja dharma nirmāṇa kāya eka yogāt sa bhoga kāyaḥ nāda rūpī sarvajñāna ahata dhvani lakṣaṇaḥ
translated: Therefore, due to the unity of the innate and the emanation body, the body of enjoyment has the nature of sound, characterized by the sound of all knowledge-sounds.

original: tatsvarūpā mantramūrtiḥ samayācārair gocarā nādarūpā mantradevatā anāhatabhāṣā /
analyzed: tad sva rūpā mantra mūrtiḥ samayācāraiḥ gocarā nāda rūpā mantradevatā anāhata bhāṣā
translated: The form of that is the mantra deity, whose domain is the observances and conduct. The mantra deity has the form of sound, the language of the unstruck sound.

original: asau samayācāro vakṣyamāṇe vaktavyo yena sā gocarā gamyā bhavatīti /
analyzed: asau samayācāraḥ vakṣyamāṇe vaktavyaḥ yena sā gocarā gamyā bhavati iti
translated: That observance and conduct should be spoken of in what is to be spoken of, by which it becomes the domain, the object to be reached.

original: tathā ca bhagavān āha dharmaśaṅko mahāśabdo dharmagaṇḍī mahāraṇaḥ /
analyzed: tathā ca bhagavān āha dharma śaṅkaḥ mahā śabdaḥ dharma gaṇḍī mahā raṇaḥ
translated: And thus the Blessed One said: The great sound of the Dharma bell, the great sound of the Dharma drum,
The unestablished nirvāṇa, the Dharma drum of the ten directions.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

original: Commentary on CS durlabha triṣu lokeṣu ādimadhyāntasasthitam //
analyzed: commentary triṣu lokeṣu
translated: The Dākinījālasaṁvara says: Rare in the three worlds, abiding in the beginning, middle, and end.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

original: ida jñāna sahajadharmasabhoganirmāṇakāyātmaka jñānacittavākkāyaikalolībhūta triṣu lokeṣu svargamartyapātāleṣu sasthita sarvadharmeṣu
analyzed: ida jñāna sahaja dharma sabhoga nirmāṇa kāya ātmaka jñāna citta vāc kāya eka lolībhūta triṣu lokeṣu svarga martya pātāleṣu sasthita sarva dharmeṣu
translated: This is the knowledge that has become one with the innate Dharma, the enjoyment body, and the emanation body, the knowledge, mind, speech, and body, in the three worlds, in the heavens, the mortal world, and the underworld, in all dharmas,

analyzed: durlabha manda puṇyānām
translated: rare for those with little merit.

analyzed: ādi madhya antam iti
translated: Beginning, middle, and end.

analyzed: atīta anāgata pratyutpanna kāle sasthitam ādi madhya anta sasthitam iti
translated: Existing in the past, future, and present times, it is said to exist in the beginning, middle, and end.

original: Commentary on CS manthyamanthānasamyogān mantrajāpādibhir yutam //
analyzed: commentary on cs
translated: The union of the churned and the churning, endowed with mantra recitation and so on.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

original: iha tad eva jñāna manthyamanthānayogena dvīndriyasamāpattyā yoginā yathā bhavati tathā yoga caiva pūrvokta vidhijñāna ca laukika /
analyzed: iha tat eva jñāna manthya manthāna yogena dvi indriya samāpattyā yoginā yathā bhavati tathā yoga ca eva pūrva ukta vidhi jñāna ca laukika
translated: Here, that very knowledge, by the union of the churned and the churning, by the union of the two faculties, becomes as it is for the yogi, and the yoga itself, the knowledge according to the previously mentioned method, is worldly.

original: vidhinā jñāna siddhi mantrajāpena maṇḍala cakradhyānena siddham /
analyzed: vidhinā jñāna siddhi mantra jāpena maṇḍala cakra dhyānena siddham
translated: The knowledge accomplishment by worldly method, accomplished by mantra recitation, mandala circle meditation,

analyzed: ādi śabdena mantra homa ādibhiḥ yuta sādhyate
translated: and endowed with mantra oblations and so on by the word and is accomplished.

original: tad eva jñāna vidhijñāna laukikajñānam iti /
analyzed: tat eva iti
translated: That very knowledge, the knowledge according to the method, is worldly knowledge.

original: eva yoga caiva pūrvokta śūnyatākaruṇātmaka caivaśabdād vidhijñāna ca tantre nigaditam yal lakṣābhidhāne mayā tad alpatantre 'dhunā vajravārāhi
analyzed: eva yoga ca eva ca eva tantre nigaditam yat lakṣa abhidhāne mayā tat alpa tantre
translated: Thus, the yoga, which is the essence of emptiness and compassion as previously mentioned, and the knowledge of the procedure, which was taught by me in the Tantra of a Hundred Thousand Verses, is now being taught in this brief Tantra of Vajra Sow.

original: deśyamāna sārāt sāratara tantra śṛṇu iti /
analyzed: deśyamāna sārāt sāratara tantra śṛṇu iti
translated: Listen to the essence of the essence of the Tantra.

original: deśakādhyeṣakasabandho 'bhidheyābhidhānasabandhena sārdha ṭīkayā prakāśito neyanītārthābhyā bhagavato niyameneti //
analyzed: deśaka adhyeṣaka sabandhaḥ bhidheya abhidhāna sabandhena sārdha ṭīkayā prakāśitaḥ neya nīta arthābhyā bhagavataḥ niyamena iti
translated: The connection between the teacher and the one who requests is revealed along with the commentary, which has both the explicit and implicit meanings, by the Blessed One.

translated: Chapter III: The Worship of Kulīkā Now, the worship of Kulīkā is described beginning with by the middle and supreme breath.

original: iha madhyamā 'vadhūtī ālikālyor madhye 'gnirekhāpravāhiṇi /🔽tasyāḥ śvāsāḥ ṣaṭśatādhikaikaviśatisahasrāṇā madhye 'horātreṇa dvādaśalagnasakrāntiṣu pañcasaptatyadhikaṣaṭśatasakhyāḥ /
analyzed: iha madhyamā vadhūtī āli kālyoḥ madhye gni rekhā pravāhiṇi  tasyāḥ śvāsāḥ ṣaṣ śata adhika ekaviśati sahasrāṇām madhye horātreṇa dvādaśa lagna sa krāntiṣu pañca saptati adhika ṣaṣ śata sakhyāḥ
translated: Here, the middle is the channel of the wife, flowing between the two channels Alikāli.🔽Among its breaths, which are more than six hundred and twenty-one thousand, in the twelve ascendants of the zodiac during day and night, there are five hundred and seventy-two.

analyzed: śeṣāḥ sa pāda nava śata adhika viśati sahasra sakhyāḥ lalanā rasanā pravāhiṇaḥ dvāda sa lagneṣu

original: tathā rasanāpravāhiṇaḥ pratyeke vṛṣabhādau sama lagne /
analyzed: tathā rasanā pravāhiṇaḥ pratyeke vṛṣabha ādau
translated: Similarly, in each of the even signs beginning with Taurus, there are one thousand eight hundred breaths flowing through the rasana.

original: tayor ādyantaśvāsāḥ pratyekasakrāntikāle samaviṣamalagnayor madhye madhyamāyā avadhūtyāḥ sapādaṣaṭpañcaśatsakhyāḥ /

translated: The first and last breaths of those, in the middle of the even and uneven signs at the time of the equinoxes, are the middle of the avadhuti, with five hundred and six-tenths.

original: adhamāḥ prāṇinā mṛtyudāyakāḥ kulikākālasabhūtāḥ kṣarasvabhāvā ariṣṭamaraṇakārakāḥ kālāgnipravāhitvāt /
analyzed: adhamāḥ prāṇināḥ mṛtyu dāyakāḥ kulikā kāla sa bhūtāḥ kṣara svabhāvāḥ ariṣṭa maraṇa kārakāḥ kālāgni pravāhi tvāt
translated: The lower ones, which carry death for living beings, are like the time of the crow, of the nature of exhalation, and cause untimely death, because they flow like the fire of time.

analyzed: śeṣāḥ sa pāda ṣaṭpañcāśat ūnāḥ ṣṭādaśa śata śvāsāḥ
translated: The remaining ones, less by five hundred and six-tenths, flow through the five circles of the lalana and rasana, with one thousand eight hundred breaths.

original: teṣu pratyekamaṇḍala vāhinaḥ ṣaṣṭyuttaratriśata sakhyāḥ sapādaikādaśaśvāsonāḥ /
analyzed: teṣu pratyeka maṇḍala vāhinaḥ ṣaṣṭi uttara tri śata sakhyāḥ sapāda ekādaśa śvāsa ūnāḥ
translated: In those, the ones flowing through each circle are three hundred and sixty, less by eleven and six-tenths breaths.

analyzed: atra maṇḍalāni ākāśa ādīni pañca lalanāyāḥ
translated: Here, the circles are the five beginning with space for the lalana.

original: pṛthvyādīni pañca rasanāyā vāme dakṣiṇe ca iha nābhipadmadale yathāsakhya madhye pūrve savye vāme paścime śūnyavāyva gnitoyapṛthvīmaṇḍalāni
analyzed: pṛthvī ādīni pañca rasanāyāḥ vāme dakṣiṇe ca iha nābhi padma dale madhye pūrve savye vāme paścime śūnya vāyu agni toya pṛthvī maṇḍalāni
translated: The five beginning with earth for the rasana, on the left and right, in the petals of the navel lotus, in the middle, east, right, left, and west, are the circles of space, air, fire, water, and earth.

analyzed: karṇikāyā
translated: In the pericarp,

analyzed: viṣuva
translated: equinox,

analyzed: ṣaṣṭha jñāna maṇḍalam
translated: The sixth is the circle of knowledge.

original: ūrddhve nāsārandhrayor yathā madhye ūrddhve savye vāme 'dho yathākrameṇa vāme śūnyādika dakṣiṇe bhūmyādikam /
analyzed: ūrddhve nāsā randhrayoḥ yathā madhye ūrddhve savye vāme yathākrameṇa vāme dakṣiṇe bhūmi ādikam
translated: Above, in the middle of the two nostrils, above, on the right, on the left, below, in order, on the left, the empty one, etc., on the right, the earth one, etc.

original: ṣaṣṭhamam nāsārandhrayor yaugapadyena sapādaṣaṭpañcāśatśvāsātmakam iti /🔽eṣā maṇḍalāna vāmadakṣiṇapravāhinaḥ śvāsā nāḍīsacārabalena prāṇāyāmabalena vā madhyamāyām avadhūtyā praveśitāḥ santaḥ sādhāraṇā ariṣṭamaraṇavañcakā
analyzed: ṣaṣṭhamam nāsā randhrayoḥ yaugapadyena sapāda ṣaṭpañcāśat śvāsa ātmakam iti  vāma dakṣiṇa pravāhinaḥ śvāsāḥ nāḍī sacāra balena prāṇāyāma balena vā madhyamāyām avadhūtyā praveśitāḥ santaḥ sādhāraṇāḥ ariṣṭa maraṇa vañcakā
translated: The sixth is in the two nostrils simultaneously, consisting of fifty-six and a quarter breaths.🔽These circles, flowing on the left and right, are common, deceiving death,

analyzed: bhavanti yoga balena madhyamāyāḥ pravāhi tvāt
translated: when, by the power of the movement of the channels or the power of breath control, they are brought into the middle by exhalation.

original: iha uttamā mahāprāṇasabhūtā adhamasādhāraṇānā vidhvasakāḥ paramākṣarasukhadāyakā yogijñānasvasavedyā bāhyendriyaviṣayakṣa rasukhasvabhāvarahitā
analyzed: iha uttamāḥ mahā prāṇasa bhūtāḥ vidhvasakāḥ parama akṣara sukha dāyakāḥ yogi jñāna sva sa vedyāḥ bāhya indriya viṣaya kṣa ra sukha svabhāva rahitā
translated: Here, the supreme ones, having the nature of great life-force, destroy the common inferior ones and bestow the bliss of the supreme syllable. They are to be known by the knowledge of the yogi himself, devoid of the nature of external sense objects and pleasures,

analyzed: divya indriya gamyāḥ śvāsa cakra sakhyāḥ sahaja ānanda rūpiṇaḥ mahā sukha acyuta tvāt iti
translated: to be known by the divine senses, friends of the wheel of breath, having the form of innate bliss, not slipping from great bliss.

original: teṣu pratyeka paramākṣarasukhaśvāsa uttamo madhyamottamaśvāsa iti tena madhyamottamaśvāsena /
analyzed: teṣu parama akṣara sukha śvāsaḥ uttamaḥ madhyama uttama śvāsaḥ iti tena madhyama uttama śvāsena
translated: Among them, the supreme syllable bliss breath is the best, the medium-best breath. By that medium-best breath,

analyzed: gandha udaka sahitena tu iti
translated: together with fragrant water, it is said.

original: iha gandha iti vairocanacandraśvāsapravāhinī adha ūrddhve lalanā /
analyzed: iha gandhaḥ iti vairocana candra śvāsa pravāhinī adhas ūrddhve lalanā
translated: Here, fragrance refers to the upward and downward channels of the breath of Vairocana and Candra.

original: udakam iti mūtrasūryaśvā sapravāhinī adha ūrddhve rasanā /
analyzed: udakam iti mūtra sūryaśvā sa pravāhinī adhas ūrddhve rasanā
translated: Water refers to the upward and downward channels of the breath of urine and Surya.

analyzed: madhyamā iti śukra rajaḥ rāhu kālāgni śvāpravāhinī adhas ūrddhve vadhūtī
translated: The middle refers to the upward and downward channel of the breath of semen, menstrual blood, Rahu, and Kala Agni, which is Avadhuti.🔽The lowest exhalation of breath in this middle Avadhuti channel causes death for living beings.

original: asyā madhyamāyā avadhūtyā adhamaḥ kṣaraḥ śvāsaḥ prāṇinā mṛtyudāyakaḥ /🔽sādhāraṇo 'riṣṭamaraṇavañcakaḥ madhyamaḥ /
analyzed: asyāḥ madhyamāyāḥ avadhūtyāḥ adhamaḥ kṣaraḥ śvāsaḥ prāṇinā mṛtyu dāyakaḥ  sādhāraṇaḥ riṣṭa maraṇa vañcakaḥ madhyamaḥ
translated: The medium one deceives the untimely death.

original: uttamaḥ paramākṣara sukho mahāmudrāsiddhidāyako 'to madhyamottamaśvāsa ity ucyate /
analyzed: uttamaḥ madhyama uttama śvāsaḥ iti ucyate
translated: The best one is the supreme syllable bliss, which grants the accomplishment of the great mudra. Therefore, it is called the medium-best breath.

original: sa evādha ūrddhve viṇmūtracandrārkanāḍībhir yuktaḥ śukrarajorāhukālāgnināḍīsamarasībhūto bodhicittacaturbindudhṛk kāya vākcittasamarasībhūta
analyzed: saḥ eva adhas ūrddhve viṣ mūtra candra arka nāḍībhiḥ yuktaḥ śukra rajaḥ rāhu kālāgni nāḍī samarasībhūtaḥ bodhi citta catur bindu dhṛk kāya vāc citta samarasībhūta
translated: That very breath, together with the channels of feces, urine, moon, and sun, upward and downward, merged with the channels of semen, menstrual blood, Rahu, and Kala Agni, holding the four drops of bodhicitta, merged with body, speech, and mind,

analyzed: ūrdhva retāḥ eka śūka vajram iti
translated: is the one-pointed vajra with upward semen.

original: tena madhya mottamaśvāsena gandhodakasahitena sahajānandasvabhāvena grāhyagrāhakavarjitena vajradharīyamahāśvāsena karmamudrājñānamu drāheturahitena
analyzed: tena madhya ma uttama śvāsena gandha udaka sahitena sahaja ānanda svabhāvena grāhya grāhaka varjitena vajradharīya mahāśvāsena karma mudrā jñāna mu drā hetu rahitena
translated: With that supreme breath in the middle, accompanied by fragrant water, having the nature of innate bliss, free from grasped and grasper, with the great breath of the vajra-holder, free from the knowledge of action mudras,

analyzed: mahāmudrā hetu sa bhūtena yogi jñāna sva sa vedyena
translated: having the cause of the great mudra, known by the wisdom of the yogi, with the poisons

original: yendriyaikalolībhūtena nābhau caṇḍālyā jvalitayā skandhadhātvāyatana dagdhalalāṭacandradrutāmṛtenācyutenordhvagāminā paramākṣarodbhūta sahajakāyenālikālihūphaṭkārarahitena
analyzed: ya indriya eka lolībhūtena nābhau caṇḍālyā jvalitayā skandha dhātu āyatana dagdha lalāṭa candra druta amṛtena acyutena ūrdhva gāminā parama akṣara udbhūta sahaja kāyena alikā lihū phaṭkāra rahitena
translated: and senses becoming one, with the flame of Caṇḍālī burning at the navel, the nectar melted by the moon on the forehead, burnt by the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, ascending upwards, with the innate body arisen from the supreme syllable, free from the sucking and sucking sound,

original: maṇḍalacakrabhāvanā ra hitena mantrajāpamudrādhiṣṭhānagurvājñāsacāradharmabāhyabhūtena bhavanirvāṇāpratiṣṭhitena karuṇāśūnyatābhinnena lalāṭād
analyzed: maṇḍala cakra bhāvanā hitena mantra jāpa mudrā adhiṣṭhāna guru ājñā sacāra dharma bāhya bhūtena bhava nirvāṇa a pratiṣṭhitena karuṇā śūnyatā bhinnena lalāṭāt
translated: free from the meditation on the mandala circle, free from the mantra recitation, mudra consecration, and the guru's command, external to the Dharma of conduct, not established in existence or nirvana, indivisible compassion and emptiness, from the forehead,

analyzed: vajramaṇi mahā cyuta rāgeṇa
translated: up to the vajra jewel, in the form of the uninterrupted bindu of bodhicitta, with great flowing passion, with the supreme breath in the middle.

analyzed: anena kulikā pūjayet nityam iti
translated: With this, the Kulaka should always worship.

original: iha kulikā madhya mā 'vadhūtī vajravārāhī nirāvaraṇā grāhyagrāhakavarjitā yoginā mārasamūhasya kṣayakāriṇī ajñāninā skandhadhātvāyata nasamūhasya
analyzed: iha vadhūtī vajravārāhī nirāvaraṇā grāhya grāhaka varjitā yoginā māra samūhasya kṣaya kāriṇī ajñāninā
translated: Here, the Kulaka, the middle-length, the Avadhuti, the Vajra Sow, free from obscurations, free from grasped and grasper, the destroyer of the host of Maras by the yogi, the destroyer of the host of aggregates, elements, and sense bases by the ignorant,

analyzed: bodhi cittasya ca kṣaya kāriṇī bodhi citta cyavanāt mṛtyu dāyikā
translated: the destroyer of the mind of enlightenment. By the falling away of the mind of enlightenment, she is the bringer of death.

original: sā vajrayoginī svacittapratibhāsamātrā mahāmudrā sarvākā ravaropetā prajñāpāramitā śūnyatā tathatā kulikā padmam ity ucyate /
analyzed: sā vajra yoginī sva citta pratibhāsa mātrā mahāmudrā sarvākāḥ ravara upetā prajñāpāramitā śūnyatā tathatā kulikā padmam iti ucyate
translated: That Vajra Yogini, the mere reflection of one's own mind, the great seal endowed with all forms and aspects, the perfection of wisdom, emptiness, thusness, is called the Kulaka, the lotus.

original: tā kulikā paramākṣarasukhenācyutabodhicittabindunā candradrutena mahārāgeṇa madhyamottamaśvāsena gandhodakasahitena kulikāsabhūtena /
analyzed: tā kulikā parama akṣara sukhena acyuta bodhi citta bindunā candra drutena mahārāgeṇa madhyama uttama śvāsena gandha udaka sahitena
translated: That Kulaka, by the supreme syllable, the bliss of the indestructible drop of the mind of enlightenment, the melted moon, the great passion, the breath of the middle and supreme horse, together with fragrant water, becomes the Kulaka.

original: tenopāyena tām eva svaprajñā pūjayed iti /
analyzed: tena upāyena tām eva sva prajñā pūjayet iti
translated: By that means, one should worship one's own wisdom in that way.

original: grāhyagrāhakacittayor jñeyajñānayoḥ śūnyatākaruṇayor ekatva yogī kārayed iti nītārthaḥ /
analyzed: grāhya grāhaka cittayoḥ jñeya jñānayoḥ śūnyatā karuṇayoḥ yogī kārayet iti nītārthaḥ
translated: The yogi should make one with the mind of grasped and grasper, the knower and the known, emptiness and compassion, this is the definitive meaning.

original: pūjayen nityam iti sarvakālam aśuciḥ śucir vā utthito vā niṣaṇṇo vā supto vā kāyavākcittakṛtye sthito vā paramākṣarasukhānuraktaḥ sarvakāmopabhogavigataspṛho
analyzed: pūjayet nityam iti sarvakālam aśuciḥ śuciḥ vā utthitaḥ vā niṣaṇṇaḥ vā suptaḥ vā kāya vāc citta kṛtye sthitaḥ vā parama akṣara sukha anuraktaḥ sarva kāma upabhoga vigata spṛhaḥ
translated: One should always worship, at all times, whether impure or pure, arisen or seated, sleeping or standing in bodily, verbal, or mental activities, attached to the bliss of the supreme syllable, free from desire for the enjoyment of all sensual pleasures,

analyzed: bāhye divya indriyaiḥ dṛṣṭa viṣaya upabhogā saktaḥ
translated: attached to the enjoyment of objects seen with external divine senses.🔽Thus, by the middle and supreme breath, the method of worshiping the Kulaka is stated by the Blessed One for the sake of accomplishing the great mudra with the supramundane truth.

original: iti madhyamottamaśvāsena kulikāpūjāvidhir lokottarasatyena mahāmudrāsiddhyartha bhagavatokta iti //🔽Chapter IV The Worship of dūtikās Commentary on CS idānī laukikasiddhisādhanāya dūtīsacāracakramelāpake pañ cāmṛtagulikayā sagrāme 🔽śastrahatair niravadyair vyāpātena mṛtair vā kukarmaṇi hatair vā gokudahanādibhir mahāsamayaiḥ pañcopacārā dibhir dūtikāpūjāvidhir bāhye 'dhyātmany 🔽ucyate kālaviśeṣeṇetyādinā /

original: Apt Moments for the Performance of a Rite atra kālas tāvad dvidhā bāhye 'dhyātmani ca /
analyzed: apt moments for the performance of a rite atra kālaḥ tāvat dvidhā bāhye ca
translated: The moments for the performance of a rite are twofold: external and internal.

analyzed: prativarṣa pratidina ca yathāsakhyam
translated: According to the year and the day, as appropriate.

analyzed: asya viśeṣaḥ kāla viśeṣaḥ bāhye dhī ātmani
translated: Its particularity is the particular time, external and internal.

analyzed: rāśi cakra dvādaśa lagna ātmakam iti kāla viśeṣaḥ
translated: The zodiac is of the nature of the twelve ascendants, thus it is the particular time.

original: atra bāhye prativarṣasya kālaviśeṣaḥ punaḥ dināni pakṣā māsā ṛtavo yugāḥ kālā ayane iti /
analyzed: atra bāhye prativarṣasya kāla viśeṣaḥ punar dināni pakṣāḥ māsāḥ ṛtavaḥ yugāḥ kālāḥ ayane iti
translated: Here, the particular time of the external year is again the days, fortnights, months, seasons, yugas, kalpas, and the two ayanas.

original: adhyātmani pratidinasya kālaviśeṣaḥ punaḥ śvāsāḥ pānīyapalāni ghaṭikā muhūrtā ardhapraharā lagnāni praharā sadhyā ahorātram iti kālaviśeṣaḥ
analyzed: adhyātmani prati dinasya kāla viśeṣaḥ punar śvāsāḥ pānīya palāni ghaṭikāḥ muhūrtāḥ ardha praharāḥ lagnāni praharā sadhyāḥ ahar rātram iti kāla viśeṣaḥ
translated: The particular time of the internal day is again the breaths, mouthfuls of water, ghatikas, muhurtas, half praharas, ascendants, praharas, sandhya, and day and night.

original: bāhye prativarṣe kālaviśeṣaḥ ṣaṣṭyuttaratriśatadināni caturviśatipakṣā dvādaśamāsāḥ ṣaḍṛtavas trimāsātmakāś catvāro yugāś caturmāsātmakās
analyzed: bāhye prativarṣe kāla viśeṣaḥ ṣaṣṭi uttara triśata dināni caturviśati pakṣāḥ dvādaśa māsāḥ ṣaṭ ṛtavaḥ tri māsa ātmakāḥ catvāraḥ yugāḥ catur māsa ātmakāḥ
translated: The particular time of the external year is 360 days, 24 fortnights, 12 months, 6 seasons consisting of three months each, 4 yugas consisting of four months each,

analyzed: trayaḥ kālāḥ ṣaṣ māsa ātmake dve yane
translated: 3 kalpas consisting of six months each, and 2 ayanas.

original: eṣā samūho varṣam eka kāla iti adhyātmani pratidina kāla iti /
analyzed: eṣā samūhaḥ varṣam eka kāla iti adhyātmani pratidina kāla iti
translated: This collection is one year, the internal time is for each day.

original: ṣaṭśatādhikaikaviśatisahasraśvā saniśvāsāḥ ṣaṭśatādhikatrisahasra pānīyapalāni ṣaṣṭighaṭikās triśanmuhūrtāḥ ṣoḍaśārdhapraharā dvādaśalagnāny
analyzed: ṣaṣ śata adhika ekaviśati sahasra śvā sa niśvāsāḥ pānīya palāni ṣaṣṭi ghaṭikāḥ triśat muhūrtāḥ ṣoḍaśa ardha praharāḥ dvādaśa lagnāni
translated: 21,600 breaths plus 600, 3,600 palas of water plus 600, 60 ghatikas, 3 muhurtas, 16 ardha-praharas, 12 lagna-s,

analyzed: aṣṭa praharāḥ catasraḥ
translated: 8 praharas, 4

original: sadhyā ahorātram ity eṣā samūho dinam eka kāla iti /
analyzed: sadhyāḥ ahar rātram iti eṣā samūhaḥ dinam kālaḥ iti
translated: sandhya-s, day and night - this is the collection, one time of day.

original: eva yathā bāhye sūryapracāreṇa kālaviśeṣas tathā 'dhyātmani prāṇapracāreṇa kālaviśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: eva yathā bāhye sūrya pracāreṇa kāla viśeṣaḥ tathā dhi ātmani prāṇa pracāreṇa kāla viśeṣaḥ
translated: Just as time is distinguished externally by the movement of the sun, so time is distinguished internally by the movement of the breath.

original: tena kālaviśeṣeṇa prativarṣe pratidine dūtikāḥ pūjayed iti /
analyzed: tena kāla viśeṣeṇa prativarṣe pratidine dūtikāḥ pūjayet iti
translated: By that distinction of time, one should worship the messengers every year, every day.

original: dūtikā vajraḍākinyādayo yamamathanyantāḥ ṣaṭtriśadyoginyas tāḥ pūjayed iti //
analyzed: dūtikāḥ vajra ḍākinī ādayaḥ yamamathanī antāḥ ṣaṭtriśat yoginyaḥ tāḥ pūjayet iti
translated: The messengers are Vajra Dakini and so on up to Yamamathani, the 36 yoginis. One should worship them.

original: iha yathā dūtikāḥ pūjyās tathā sahajāḥ siddhā vilomena vajrasattvādayaś caturviśatir adhamamadhyamottamāḥ kāyavākcittaca kreṣu pātālamartyakhecarasiddhidāyakatvād
analyzed: iha yathā dūtikāḥ pūjyāḥ tathā sahajāḥ siddhāḥ vilomena vajra sattva ādayaḥ caturviśatiḥ adhama madhyama uttamāḥ kāya vāc citta ca kreṣu pātāla martya khecara siddhi dāyaka tvāt
translated: Here, just as the messengers are to be worshipped, so are the innate siddhas, Vajrasattva and so on, in reverse order, the 24 of low, medium and high, because they bestow the siddhis of the netherworld, mortal world and sky-wanderers in the body, speech, mind and creative arts.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

original: te 'pi kālaviśeṣe ṇa pūjyā iti tathāgataniyamaḥ /
analyzed: te pi kāla viśeṣe na pūjyāḥ iti tathāgata niyamaḥ
translated: They too are to be worshipped by the distinction of time, such is the rule of the Tathagata.

original: eva dūtikāḥ sahajāḥ siddhāś ca pūjayet pañcāmṛtagulikayā gokudahanādibhir māsair niravadyaiḥ samayaiḥ pañcopacārādibhir bāhye gaṇacakre /
analyzed: eva dūtikāḥ sahajāḥ siddhāḥ ca pūjayet pañcāmṛta gulikayā go ku dahana ādibhiḥ māsaiḥ niravadyaiḥ samayaiḥ pañca upacāra ādibhiḥ bāhye gaṇacakre
translated: Thus, one should worship the messengers, the innate ones and the accomplished ones, with the five nectars, pills, cow's urine, fire and so on, with the faultless observances, with the five offerings and so on, in the external wheel of the assembly.

original: adhyātmani jñāna cittavākkāyacakre sūryasacāreṇa prāṇasacāreṇa kālaviśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: adhyātmani sūrya sacāreṇa prāṇa sacāreṇa kāla viśeṣaḥ
translated: In the internal wheel of knowledge, mind, speech and body, the special time is by the movement of the sun and the movement of the breath.

analyzed: tena kāla viśeṣeṇa dūtī sacāraḥ
translated: By that special time, the movement of the messengers.

original: dūtīsacāreṇa bhogalayādhikārāḥ prabhutva ca kulikāyāḥ ṣaṭtriśaddūtikānā ca /
analyzed: dūtī sacāreṇa bhoga laya adhikārāḥ ca kulikāyāḥ ṣaṭtriśat dūtikānā ca
translated: By the movement of the messengers, the enjoyments, the authority in the dissolution and the sovereignty of the Kula and the thirty-six messengers.

original: yathānukrameṇa vartamānakāle bhogaḥ /🔽anāgatakāle layaḥ prabhutva ca /
analyzed: yathā anukrameṇa vartamāna kāle bhogaḥ  anāgata kāle layaḥ prabhu tva ca
translated: The enjoyment is in the present time according to the sequence.🔽In the future time, there is dissolution and sovereignty.

analyzed: atīta kāle dhikāraḥ
translated: In the past time, there is authority.

analyzed: udaye bhogaḥ
translated: At sunrise, there is enjoyment.

analyzed: madhyāhne dhikāraḥ
translated: At midday, there is authority.

analyzed: astaṅgata sthāne prabhu tvam
translated: In the place of sunset, there is sovereignty.

analyzed: ardharātre laye iti nyāyaḥ
translated: At midnight, there is dissolution - this is the rule.

analyzed: eva bāhye bhoga dine dhī ātmani bhoga velāyāḥ yoginī sacāraḥ
translated: Thus, in the external enjoyment of the day, in the internal, at the time of enjoyment, there is the movement of the yoginīs.
And by the movement of the yoginīs, there is the meeting of the wheel.

analyzed: cakramelāpake dina bhoginī velā bhoginī pūjayet iti
translated: At the meeting of the wheel, one should worship the day-enjoying time and the enjoyment-time.

analyzed: bāla kāle bhogaḥ
translated: In childhood, there is enjoyment.

analyzed: yuvā kāle dhikāraḥ
translated: In youth, there is authority.

analyzed: vṛddha kāle prabhu tvam
translated: In old age, there is mastery.

analyzed: maraṇe ṛdharātra kāle layaḥ
translated: At the time of death, at midnight, there is dissolution.

original: layāt punar utpādo bāla ity ucyate /
analyzed: layāt punar utpādaḥ bālaḥ iti ucyate
translated: From dissolution, there is again production, which is called childhood.

original: eva kālaviśeṣeṇa catuḥsadhyābhedenāṣṭapraharabhedena caturviśatipakṣabhedena ṣaṭtriśadyoginīnā kālaviśeṣeṇa bhogalayādhikārā ādhipatya
analyzed: eva kāla viśeṣeṇa catur sadhyā bhedena aṣṭa prahara bhedena caturviśati pakṣa bhedena ṣaṭtriśat yoginīnā kāla viśeṣeṇa bhoga laya adhikārāḥ
translated: Thus, by the distinction of four seasons, by the distinction of eight watches, by the distinction of twenty-four fortnights, by the distinction of thirty-six yoginīs, by the distinction of time, there is the authority of enjoyment and dissolution, and sovereignty

analyzed: ca iti sarvatra niyamaḥ
translated: everywhere, it is a rule.

original: The Worship of the Four jñānacakraḍākinīs idānī pūjāvidhir ucyate /
analyzed: the worship of the four jñānacakra ḍākinīs idānī pūjā vidhiḥ ucyate
translated: Now, the method of worship is stated.

original: iha bāhye 'dhyātmani vā kulikā vajravārāhī mahākṣarasukhalakṣaṇena madhyamottamaśvāsena sarvakāla pūjayen mahāmudrāsiddhyartha mantrī /
analyzed: iha bāhye dhī ātmani vā kulikā vajravārāhī mahā akṣara sukha lakṣaṇena madhyama uttama śvāsena sarvakāla pūjayet mahāmudrā siddhi artha mantrī
translated: Here, the Kula woman, the Vajra Sow, should worship with the great syllable, the sign of bliss, with the middle and supreme breath, at all times, for the sake of accomplishing the great seal, the mantra practitioner.

analyzed: laukika siddhi artha vajra ḍākinī ādayaḥ yathā anukrameṇa kāla viśeṣeṇa
translated: For the sake of worldly accomplishments, the Vajra Ḍākinīs and so forth should be worshipped by the distinction of time, in the proper sequence.

original: pūjayed iti /🔽atra bāhye makarasakrāntau pūrvavaktrodaye vajraḍākinī pūjayen māraṇakarmasādhanārtham /
analyzed: pūjayet iti  atra bāhye makara sakrāntau pūrva vaktra udaye vajra ḍākinī pūjayet māraṇa karma sādhana artham
translated: Thus,🔽here, in the external, at the entrance of Capricorn, at the rising of the eastern face, one should worship the Vajra Ḍākinī for the sake of accomplishing the rite of killing.
At the entrance of Aries, at the rising of the southern face, one should worship the Lāmā for the sake of accomplishing the rite of enthrallment.

original: karkaṭasakrāntau paścima vaktrodaye kaṇḍarohā pūjayet stambhanārtham /
analyzed: karkaṭasakrāntau vaktra udaye kaṇḍarohā pūjayet stambhana artham
translated: At the entrance of Cancer, the western face, the worshipper should worship Kandarohā for the purpose of stupefying.

original: tulāsakrāntav uttaravaktrodaye rūpiṇī śāntikārtha pūjayen mantrīti /
analyzed: rūpiṇī śāntika artha pūjayet mantrī iti
translated: At the entrance of Libra, the northern face, the reciter of mantras should worship Rūpiṇī for the purpose of pacification.

analyzed: tri sa krānti tri māsa ante ravikā dhana ṛṇa vṛddhi hāni bhedena varṣa catur yuga sadhyāḥ
translated: At the end of the three entrances and three months, the four yugas of the year are calculated based on the increase and decrease of the sun's debt and wealth.

original: tāsā sakrāntidineṣu yathoktakrameṇa catasro ḍākinyo bhoginyaś cittavākjñānakāyavaktrabhedena bhagavataḥ pūrvadakṣiṇapaścimottaradigdevyo
analyzed: tāsā sa krānti dineṣu yathā ukta krameṇa catasraḥ ḍākinyaḥ bhoginyaḥ citta vāc jñāna kāya vaktra bhedena bhagavataḥ pūrva dakṣiṇa paścima uttara diś devyoḥ
translated: On the days of those entrances, in the mentioned order, the four ḍākinīs and bhūmiṇīs, by the division of mind, speech, knowledge, body, and face, are the goddesses of the east, south, west, and north of the Blessed One.

analyzed: māraṇa ādi karma sādhanāya na pṛthvī ādi dhātu bhendena iti niyamaḥ
translated: There is no restriction that they are the goddesses of the earth, etc., for the accomplishment of the rites such as killing, etc.

original: eva sarvatra vakṣyamāṇe vaktrabhedena karmaprasarasādhane pūjāniyamaḥ //
analyzed: eva sarvatra vakṣyamāṇe vaktra bhedena karma prasara sādhane pūjā niyamaḥ
translated: Thus, in all that is to be said, the restriction of worship is for the accomplishment of the spreading of rites by the division of faces.

original: The Worship of the Eight śmaśānadevīs idānī śmaśānadevīnā pūjocyate /
analyzed: the worship of the eight śmaśānadevīs idānī śmaśānadevīnā pūjā ucyate
translated: Now, the worship of the cremation ground goddesses is mentioned.

original: iha makarasakrāntidine kākā syām uccāṭanārtham /🔽kumbhārdhadine ulūkāsyām ākṛṣṭyartham /
analyzed: iha makara sakrānti dine kākā syām uccāṭana artham  kumbha ardha dine ulūka āsyām ākṛṣṭi artham
translated: Here, on the day of the entrance of Capricorn, Kākāsya for the purpose of expulsion.🔽On the day of the half-entrance of Aquarius, Ulūkāsya for the purpose of attraction.

analyzed: meṣa sa krānti dine śvānāsyā kīlana artham
translated: On the day of the entrance of Aries, Śvāṇāsya for the purpose of immobilization.

original: vṛṣabhārdhadine śūkarāsyā puṣṭyartham /🔽karkaṭasakrāntidine yamadāḍhī nirviṣārtham /🔽sihārdhadine yamādūtī mohanārtham /
analyzed: vṛṣabha ardha dine śūkara āsyā puṣṭi artham              siha ardha dine yamādūtī mohana artham
translated: On the half-day of Taurus, the boar-faced one for nourishment.🔽On the day of the Cancer solstice, Yamadanti for the sake of freedom from poison.🔽On the half-day of Leo, Yamadūti for the sake of bewitching.

analyzed: tulā sa krānti dine stobhana artham
translated: On the day of the Libra solstice, Yamagṛdhrinī for the sake of paralysis.

original: vṛścikārdhadine yamamathanī vidveṣaṇārtha pūjayed yogīti varṣasya sārdhasārdhamāsātmakā aṣṭapraharāḥ /
analyzed: vṛścika ardha dine yama mathanī vidveṣaṇa artha pūjayet yogī iti varṣasya sa ardha sa ardha māsa ātmakāḥ aṣṭa praharāḥ
translated: On the half-day of Scorpio, Yamamathani for the sake of enmity - the yogi should worship. Thus, the year has eight watches consisting of half-months and half-months.

original: teṣv ādidineṣu yathoktakrameṇāṣṭayoginyo bhoginyaḥ sārdhasārdhamāsa yāvad iti niyamaḥ //
analyzed: teṣu ādi dineṣu yathā ukta krameṇa aṣṭa yoginyaḥ bhoginyaḥ sa ardha sārdha māsa yāvat iti niyamaḥ
translated: On those first days, in the sequence mentioned, the eight yoginis are to be enjoyed for half-months and half-months - this is the rule.

original: The Worship of the TwentyFour vīras and vireśvarīs of cittavākkāyacakras idānī cittavākkāyacakradevīpūjocyate /
analyzed: the worship of the tventyfour vīras and vira īśvarīs of citta vāc kāya cakras idānī citta vāc kāya cakra devī pūjā ucyate
translated: Now the worship of the goddesses of the mind, speech, and body cakras is described.

original: iha mārgaśīrṣāmāvāsyā pracaṇḍā kaṇḍakapālina māraṇakarmasādhanārtham /🔽pūrṇimāyā caṇḍākṣī mahākaṅkāla viśyārtham /
analyzed: iha mārgaśīrṣa amāvāsyā pracaṇḍā māraṇa karma sādhana artham  caṇḍākṣī mahākaṅkāla viśyārtham
translated: Here, the new moon of Mārgaśīrṣa is Pracandā, Kaṇḍaka-kapālinī, for the sake of accomplishing the act of killing.🔽On the full moon, Caṇḍākṣī, Mahākaṅkāla, for the sake of wealth.

analyzed: puṣya amāvāsyā prabhāvatī kaṅkāla stambhana artham
translated: The new moon of Puṣya is Prabhāvatī, Kaṅkāla, for the sake of paralysis.

analyzed: pūrṇamāsyāḥ mahānāsāḥ puṣṭika artham
translated: On the full moon, Mahānāsā, Vikata-daṣṭrinī, for the sake of nourishment.

analyzed: māgha amāvasyā vīramatī śānti artham
translated: The new moon of Magha, Vīramati, for the sake of pacifying the enemies of Sura.

original: pūrṇamāsyā kharvarīm amitābha mohanārtham phālgunāmā vasyā laṅkeśvarī vajraprabham ākṛṣtyartham /
analyzed: kharvarīm amitābha mohana artham vasyā laṅkeśvarī vajraprabham ākṛṣti artham
translated: The full moon of Phālguna, Kharvarī, for the sake of deluding Amitābha. The new moon of Phālguna, Laṅkeśvarī, for the sake of attracting Vajraprabha.

analyzed: pūrṇamāsyāḥ druma chāyā vajra deha vidveṣa artham iti
translated: The full moon of Caitra, Drumacchāyā, for the sake of creating enmity between Vajradeha and Vidyā.

Thus, the eight Vīras and Vīreśvarīs, along with the Bhoginīs, should be worshipped in the mind-wheel on the eighth days of the bright and dark fortnights of the four months beginning with Mārgaśīrṣa, in the sequence mentioned.

analyzed: idānī vāc cakra pūjā ucyate
translated: Now, the worship of the speech-wheel is described.

analyzed: iha caitra amāvāsyām airāvatīm aṅkurikam uccāṭana artham
translated: Here, on the new moon of Caitra, Airavatī, Aṅkarikā, for the sake of expulsion.

analyzed: pūrṇamāsyā mahābhairavāḥ
translated: On the full moon, Mahābhairava, Vajra, for the sake of tormenting.

analyzed: vaiśākha amāvāsyāḥ vāyu vegāḥ mahāvīra sainya stambhana artham
translated: On the new moon of Vaiśākha, Vāyuvegā, Mahāvīra, for the sake of paralyzing the army.

analyzed: pūrṇamāsyā surā bhakṣī megha varṣaṇa artham
translated: On the full moon, Surābhaksī, Vajrahuṃkāra, for the sake of causing rain from clouds.

analyzed: jyeṣṭhā amāvāsyā śyāma devī su bhadra jvara upaśama artham
translated: On the new moon of Jyeṣṭha, Śyāmadevī, Subhadra, for the sake of alleviating fever.

analyzed: pūrṇamāsyā su bhadrā vajra bhadra pātālabheda na artham
translated: On the full moon, Subhadrā, Vajrabhadra, for the sake of splitting the netherworld.

analyzed: āṣāḍha amāvāsyā hayakarṇā mahābhairavam āveśana artham
translated: On the new moon of Āṣāḍha, Hayakarṇā, Mahābhairava, for the sake of possession.

analyzed: pūrṇamāsyā khaga ānanā megha vidāraṇa artham iti
translated: On the full moon day, the bird-faced Virupaksha, for the purpose of splitting the clouds.

analyzed: caitra ādi cutur māsa pakṣa aṣṭa dineṣu yathā ukta krameṇa aṣṭa vīra vīra īśvaryaḥ bhogi vāc cakre
translated: In the four months beginning with Chaitra, on the eighth day of each fortnight, in the sequence mentioned, the eight heroes and the lords of heroes, or the serpent-born ones, in the speech wheel.

analyzed: idāṇī kāya cakra pūjā ucyate
translated: Now the worship of the body wheel is described.

original: iha śrāvaṇāmāvāsyā cakravegā mahābala mahākhaḍgasādhanārtham /🔽pūrṇamāsyā khaṇḍarohā ratnavajra nāgakanyāvaśyārtham /
analyzed: iha śrāvaṇa amāvāsyā cakravegā mahā bala mahā khaḍga sādhana artham  khaṇḍarohā ratna vajra nāga kanyā vaśyā artham
translated: Here, on the new moon day of Sravana, Chakraweaga, for the purpose of accomplishing the great sword of great strength.🔽On the full moon day, Khandaroha, for the purpose of summoning Ratnavjra Naga maiden.

analyzed: bhādrapada amāvāsyā śauṇḍinī hayagrīva nāga rāja stambhana artham
translated: On the new moon day of Bhadrapada, Soundini, for the purpose of paralyzing Hayagriva Naga king.

analyzed: pūrṇamāsyām cakravarmiṇīm ākāśagarbha mahārasa sādhana artham
translated: On the full moon day, Chakrawarmni, for the purpose of accomplishing the great elixir of Akashagarbha.

analyzed: aśvinā amāvāsyā suvīrā herukam amṛta phala sādhana artham
translated: On the new moon day of Asvina, Suvira, for the purpose of accomplishing the nectar fruit of Heruka.

analyzed: pūrṇa māsyā mahā balā dravya sādhana artham
translated: On the full moon day, Mahabala, for the purpose of accomplishing the substance of Padmanarteश्वर.

analyzed: kārtikā amā vāsyā cakravartinī vairocana ratna sādhana artham
translated: On the new moon day of Kartika, Chakrawartin, for the purpose of accomplishing the jewel of Vairocana.

original: pūrṇa māsyā mahāvīryā vajrasattva trailokyaprakampanār tham iti śrāvaṇādicaturmāsapakṣāṣṭadineṣu yathoktakrame ṇāṣṭavīravīreśvaryo bhoginyaḥ
analyzed: mahāvīryāḥ vajra sattva trailokya prakampana ar tham iti śrāvaṇa ādi catur māsa pakṣa aṣṭa dineṣu yathā ukta krame ṇa aṣṭa vīra vīra īśvaryaḥ bhoginyaḥ
translated: The greatly powerful ones of the full moon, for the sake of shaking the three worlds with vajra-sattva, thus on the eighth days of the four months beginning with Śrāvaṇa, the eight heroes and heroines of the enjoyers,

analyzed: kāya cakre
translated: in the body wheel.

analyzed: athavā vṛścika sakrānti dine vṛśika ardha dine
translated: Or else, on the day of the entrance of Scorpio, in the half-day of Scorpio,

analyzed: dhanuḥ sa krānti dine dhanu ardhe
translated: on the day of the entrance of Sagittarius, in the half-day of Sagittarius,
on the day of the entrance of Capricorn, in the half-day of Capricorn,

analyzed: kumbha sakrāntau kumbha ardha dineṣu aṣṭa vīra vīra īśvaryaḥ bhoginyaḥ citta cakre
translated: in the entrances of Aquarius, in the half-days of Aquarius, the eight heroes, heroines, and enjoyers in the mind wheel.

analyzed: eva mīna sa krāntau mīna ardhe
translated: Likewise, in the entrance of Pisces, in the half-day of Pisces,

analyzed: meṣa sakrāntau meṣa ardhe vṛṣa sakrāntau vṛṣa ardhe
translated: in the entrance of Aries, in the half-day of Aries, in the entrance of Taurus, in the half-day of Taurus,

analyzed: mithuna sakrāntau mithuna ardhe dine
translated: in the entrance of Gemini, in the half-day of Gemini,

analyzed: eṣu aṣṭa dineṣu yathā ukta krameṇa aṣṭa vīra vīra īśvaryaḥ bhoginyaḥ vākcakre
translated: on these eight days, in the stated sequence, the eight heroes, heroines, and enjoyers in the speech wheel.

analyzed: tathā karkaṭa sa krāntau karkaṭa ardhe
translated: Similarly, in the entrance of Cancer, in the half-day of Cancer,

analyzed: siha sa krāntau siha ardhe  kanyā sa krāntau kanyā ardhe
translated: in the entrance of Leo, in the half-day of Leo,🔽in the entrance of Virgo, in the half-day of Virgo,

analyzed: tulā sakrāntau tulā ardhe
translated: in the entrance of Libra, in the half-day of Libra,

original: eṣv aṣṭadineṣu yathākrameṇāṣṭavī ravireśvaryo bhoginyaḥ kāyacakre /
analyzed: eṣu aṣṭa dineṣu yathākrameṇa aṣṭavīḥ raviḥ īśvaryaḥ bhoginyaḥ kāya cakre
translated: on these eight days, in the stated sequence, the eight heroes, heroines, and enjoyers in the body wheel.

original: iha prabhavāditrivarṣatrivar ṣaprabhedena vartamāna prathamavarṣa grāhyam tadyathā /
analyzed: iha prabhava ādi tri varṣa tri var ṣa prabhedena vartamāna prathama varṣa grāhyam tat yathā
translated: Here, the first year, which is divided into three years beginning with Prabhava, should be taken. As follows:

analyzed: prabhavaḥ vibhavaḥ śuklaḥ pramādaḥ tha prajāpatiḥ
translated: Prabhava, Vibhava, Shukla, Pramoda, Prajapati,

original: aṅgirā śrīmukho bhāvo yuvā dhātā tathaiva ca //
analyzed: aṅgirāḥ śrīmukhaḥ bhāvaḥ yuvā dhātā tathā eva ca
translated: Angiras, Shrimukha, Bhava, Yuva, Dhata, and likewise,

original: īśvaro bahudhānyaś ca pramādī vikramo vṛṣaḥ /
analyzed: īśvaraḥ bahudhānyaḥ ca pramādī vikramaḥ vṛṣaḥ
translated: Ishvara, Bahudhannya, Pramada, Vikrama, Vrisha,

analyzed: citrabhānuḥ subhānuḥ ca tāraṇaḥ pārthivaḥ vyavyaḥ
translated: Chitrabhanu, Subhanu, Tarana, Parthiva, Avyaya,

original: sarvajit sarvadhārī ca virodhī vikṛtaḥ kharaḥ /
analyzed: sarva jit sarva dhārī ca virodhī vikṛtaḥ kharaḥ
translated: Sarvajit, Sarvadhari, Virodhi, Vikrita, Khara,

analyzed: nandanaḥ vijayaḥ ca eva jayaḥ manmatha durmukhau
translated: Nandana, Vijaya, Jaya, Manmatha, Durmukha,

original: hemalambo vilambī ca vikārī śārvarī plavaḥ /
translated: Hemalamba, Vilambi, Vikari, Sharvari, Plava,
Shubhakarin, Shobhan, Krodhin, Vishvavasu, Parabhava,
Pravang, Kilaka, Saumya, Samadhana, Virodhakrit,

analyzed: paridhāvī pramādī ca ānandaḥ rākṣasaḥ nalaḥ
translated: Parilava, Pramada, Ananda, Rakshasa, Anala,
Pingala, Kaladuti, Siddha, Raudra, Durmati,
Dundubhi, Rudhirodgari, Raktakshi, Krodhana, Kshaya,

analyzed: iti ṣaṣthisavatsarāḥ
translated: Thus, the sixty years.

original: trivarṣānte punar ādivarṣatraya guṇatrayabhedena grāhyam iti tatra /
analyzed: tri varṣa ante punar ādi varṣa traya guṇa traya bhedena grāhyam iti tatra
translated: At the end of three years, again, beginning with the three years, it should be taken with the division of the three qualities. There,

analyzed: prathama varṣe catur devī nāma sahita caturvaktra mantra tri māsa tri māsa bhedena japet
translated: in the first year, one should recite the mantra of the four-faced deity along with the four goddesses, dividing it into three months each.

analyzed: tatas dvitīye varṣe
translated: Then in the second year,

analyzed: ṣṭa yoginī nāma sahitam sa ardha māsa bhedena japet
translated: one should recite the eight-syllable mantra along with the eight yoginis, dividing it into half months.

original: tatas tṛtīye varṣe caturviśatidevīnāmasahita pratyaṅga mālāmantra japet purvoktakarmaprasarasādhanārtham /
analyzed: tatas tṛtīye varṣe caturviśati devī nāma sahita pratyaṅga mālāmantra japet purva ukta karma prasara sādhana artham
translated: Then in the third year, one should recite the garland mantra of the twenty-four parts along with the twenty-four goddesses for the sake of accomplishing the spreading of all actions as previously mentioned.

original: eva trivarṣaiḥ ṣadvarṣair navavarṣair dvādaśavarṣaiḥ ṣaṭtriśaḍḍākinyaḥ sādhayitvā tataḥ sarvakarmaprasara laukikasiddhisādhana karoti mantrīti
analyzed: eva tri varṣaiḥ ṣad varṣaiḥ nava varṣaiḥ dvādaśa varṣaiḥ ṣaṣ triśat ḍākinyaḥ sādhayitvā tatas sarva karma prasara laukika siddhi sādhana karoti mantrī iti
translated: In this way, with three years, six years, nine years, or twelve years, having accomplished the thirty-six dakinis, then the mantra practitioner performs the accomplishment of the spreading of all actions and worldly accomplishments.

analyzed: tathāgata niyamaḥ
translated: This is the rule of the Tathagata.

original: evam adhyātmani catasraḥ sadhyā aṣṭapraharāḥ sārdhadvidaṇḍātmakāś caturviśatilagnapakṣāḥ /

translated: In the same way, internally, there are four sadhyas, eight praharas, twenty-four lagna pakshas consisting of one and a half dandas.

original: etāsu velāsu pratidine vajraḍākinyādikāḥ pūjayet pūrvoktasiddhi sādhanāyeti /

translated: At these times, every day, one should worship Vajra Dakini and others for the sake of accomplishing the previously mentioned accomplishments.

analyzed: iha kāla viśeṣaḥ bhagavatā tantra tantra antareṣu uktaḥ

analyzed: asmin uddeśa mātreṇa uktaḥ

analyzed: sa ca tena

analyzed: anya

analyzed: tatra ukta abhiprāyena atra avagantavyaḥ tantra tantra antareṇa boddhavyam iti tathāgata vacanāt
translated: Tantras. It should be understood here with the intention stated there. It should be known by the Tantras and other Tantras, as stated by the Tathagata.

analyzed: evam asau kāla viśeṣaḥ

translated: First of all, in the Catuspitha, the Lagnas beginning with Makara are the twelve Nadis beginning with Rohini.

original: ye puṣyādayo dvādaśamāsās tāny avidyādīni dvādaśāṅgāni /
analyzed: ye puṣya ādayaḥ dvādaśa māsāḥ tāni avidyā ādīni dvādaśa aṅgāni
translated: The twelve months beginning with Pushya are the twelve limbs beginning with ignorance.

analyzed: eva bāhye dhī ātmani prativarṣe pratidine dvādaśa lagnāni
translated: Thus, externally and internally, there are twelve Lagnas in each year and day.

analyzed: daṇḍa ṣaṣṭi pānīya pala ātmakam
translated: Each Lagna consists of five Panchadasas.🔽A Panchadasa consists of sixty Paniyas.

analyzed: ṣaṣ śvāsa ātmakam
translated: A Paniya consists of six breaths.

original: evam ahorātreṇa ṣaṭśatādhikaikaviśatisahaśvāsaniśvāsā bāhye sūryasya daṇḍā adhyātmani śvāsāḥ /
analyzed: evam ahar rātreṇa ṣaṣ śata adhika ekaviśati saha śvāsa niśvāsāḥ bāhye sūryasya daṇḍāḥ adhyātmani śvāsāḥ
translated: Thus, in a day and night, there are twenty-one thousand six hundred external breaths and exhalations of the sun, and internally, breaths.

analyzed: evam ahar rātreṇa iti
translated: Thus, in a day and night.

original: tathā hevajre bhaga vatokta sapādaṣaṭpañcaśatpānīyapalātmakāś catuḥṣaṣtidaṇḍā nirmāṇacakre /

translated: Thus, in the Hevajra Tantra, the Blessed One said that the sixty-four finger-breadths in the creation wheel are equivalent to one hundred and twenty-five palas of water.

analyzed: dvi daṇḍa ātmakā dvātriśat ghaṭikā mahāsukhacakre
translated: The thirty-two finger-breadths in the great bliss wheel are equivalent to two finger-breadths.

analyzed: ṣoḍaśa sakrāntayaḥ dvi ghaṭikā ātmakāḥ sa bhoga cakre
translated: The sixteen transits, each equivalent to two finger-breadths, are in the enjoyment wheel.

analyzed: aṣṭau praharāḥ catuḥ ghaṭikā ātmikāḥ dharmacakre

original: atra gurūpadeśaḥ sabhogasya mahāsu khacakre vilomaḥ /

analyzed: tat yathā

original: tatra bāhye sūryasya prativarṣa dinam eva /
analyzed: tatra bāhye sūryasya prativarṣa dinam eva

analyzed: tasmin dine kāla viśeṣaḥ

analyzed: ṣaṣ śata adhika ekaviśat sahasra daṇḍāḥ te ca sūrya śvāsāḥ
translated: Those twenty-one thousand six hundred finger-breadths are the breaths of the sun.

original: te cādhyātmani pratidine śvāsā dehinām iti /

translated: And those are the breaths of embodied beings internally, each day.

original: eva ṣaṣṭiṣaṣṭi daṇḍātmakāni ṣaṣṭyuttaratriśatadināni adhyātmani ṣaṣṭiṣaṣṭiśvā sātmakānīti /

translated: Thus, there are 360 days consisting of 60 times 60 breaths externally, and 360 times 60 breaths internally.

analyzed: sarveṣu yoginī tantreṣu dūtīnā sa cāraḥ
translated: In all the Yoginī Tantras, the movement of the messengers is by the movement.

original: sacāravaśena bhogalayādhikārāḥ prabhutva ceti sarvatrāva gantavya //

original: Chapter VIII The movement of yoginīs in the gaṇacakra The jñānacakrasacāra Day idānī gaṇacakre kulikāyā dūtīnā ca sthānāt sthānasacāra 🔽ucyate /
analyzed: chapter viii the movement of yoginī in the gaṇa cakra the jñāna cakra sacāra idānī gaṇa cakre kulikāyāḥ dūtīnā ca sthānāt sthāna sacāra  ucyate
translated: Now, the movement from place to place of the Kula woman and the messenger in the Gaṇa Cakra is being told.

analyzed: yama daṣṭriṇyāḥ yama mathanyāḥ madhye
translated: In the middle of Yamadāṣṭrī and Yamamathanī.

original: tataḥ svasthānavaśād yamadaṣṭriṇī kulikādīn bhūtvā punar yamadaṣṭriṇī bhavati /
analyzed: tatas sva sthāna vaśāt yama daṣṭriṇī kulika ādīn bhūtvā punar yama daṣṭriṇī bhavati
translated: Then, by the power of her own place, Yamadāṣṭrī becomes Kulika and so on, and again becomes Yamadāṣṭrī.

analyzed: yama mathanī yama daṣṭriṇī yā sā kulikā bhavati
translated: Yamamathanī and Yamadāṣṭrī become Kulika.

original: tataś caturtha prahare yamamathanīkulikāyā āgneyamahāśmaśāne sacāraḥ /
analyzed: tatas caturthe prahare yamamathanī kulikāyāḥ āgneya mahāśmaśāne sacāraḥ
translated: Then, in the fourth watch, Kulika of Yamamathanī moves in the southeast great cremation ground.

analyzed: vajra vārāhyāḥ yamamathanyāḥ madhye
translated: In the middle of Vajravārāhī and Yamamathanī.

original: tataḥ svasthānavaśād yamamathanī kulikādīn bhūtvā punar yamamathāni bhavati /
analyzed: tatas sva sthāna vaśāt yamamathanī kulika ādīn bhūtvā punar yamamathāni bhavati
translated: Then, by the power of her own place, Yamamathanī becomes Kulika and so on, and again becomes Yamamathanī.

original: yā vajravārāhi sā kākāsyādīn bhūtvā punaḥ svasthānavaśāt kulikā bhavati /
analyzed: yā vajra vārāhi sā kāka āsya ādīn bhūtvā punar sva sthāna vaśāt kulikā bhavati
translated: Vajravārāhī becomes Kākāsya and so on, and again by the power of her own place becomes Kulika.

analyzed: iti yoginī sacāraḥ candra āśe yoginā avagantavyaḥ
translated: Thus, the movement of the yoginīs should be understood by the yoginīs in the lunar abode by the yoga of the left and right rotation of the ear-rings.

original: iti mahāṣṭaśmāśāneṣu kālaviśeṣeṇa yoginīsacāro navamadine svasva sthānāgamanena sacāraparicchedaḥ /
analyzed: iti mahā aṣṭa śma āśāneṣu kāla viśeṣeṇa yoginī sacāraḥ navama dine sva sva sthāna āgamanena sacāra paricchedaḥ
translated: Thus, in the great eight cremation grounds, the movement of the Yoginis at specific times, coming to their own places on the ninth day, is the section on the moving and unmoving.

original: tata udārā pūjā kṛtvā punar daśame dine sacāro yathā pratipaddine /
analyzed: tatas udārā pūjā kṛtvā punar daśame dine sa cāraḥ yathā pratipad dine
translated: Then, having made extensive worship, again on the tenth day, the movement is as on the first day.

analyzed: ekādaśyāḥ  dvādaśī ā tṛtīyā vat
translated: On the eleventh, as on the second.🔽On the twelfth, as on the third.

analyzed: trayodaśyā caturthā vat
translated: On the thirteenth, as on the fourth.

analyzed: caturdaśyā pañcamī vat
translated: On the fourteenth, as on the fifth.

analyzed: amāvā syām ṣaṣṭhīvat
translated: On the new moon day, as on the sixth.

analyzed: śukla pratipad dine saptamī vat
translated: On the first day of the bright fortnight, as on the seventh.

analyzed: dvitīyāyāḥ aṣṭamī vat
translated: On the second, as on the eighth.

analyzed: tṛtīyāyāḥ navamī vat sa cāraḥ
translated: On the third, as on the ninth, is the movement.

original: tataḥ svasvasthānāgamanava śād vajravārāhyādīnā punaḥ svasvabhāvaḥ /
analyzed: tatas sva sva sthāna āgamana va śāt punar sva svabhāvaḥ
translated: Then, by coming to their own places, Vajravarahi and others again have their own nature.

original: tataḥ pūjā kṛtvā punaś caturthyā sacaro yathā daśamyā pañcamyām ekādaśīvat /
analyzed: tatas pūjā kṛtvā punar caturthyā sacaraḥ yathā daśamyā pañcamyām ekādaśī vat
translated: Then, having made worship, again on the fourth, the movement is as on the tenth, on the fifth, as on the eleventh.

analyzed: ṣaṣṭhyā dvādaśī vat
translated: On the sixth, as on the twelfth.

analyzed: saptamyā trayodaśī vat
translated: On the seventh, as on the thirteenth.

analyzed: aṣṭamyā caturdaśī vat
translated: On the eighth, as on the fourteenth.

analyzed: navamyāḥ amārāsyā vat
translated: On the ninth, as on the new moon day.

analyzed: daśamyā śukla pratipad vat
translated: On the tenth, as on the first day of the bright fortnight.

analyzed: ekādaśyāḥ dvitīyā vat
translated: On the eleventh, as on the second.

original: dvādaśyā tṛtīyavat sacāraḥ śmaśānavāsinīnā cittavākkā yabhedena /
analyzed: dvādaśyā tṛtīya vat sa cāraḥ śmaśānavāsinīnām
translated: The twelve-day movement of the Dākinī and others is by the division of mind, speech, and body.

original: tato navanavadinair navanavanakṣatrayogena saptaviśati nakṣatrāṇi yāvac candrasya dvādaśarāśiparyantam /
analyzed: tatas nava nava dinaiḥ nava nava nakṣatra yogena sapta viśati nakṣatrāṇi yāvat candrasya dvādaśa rāśi paryantam
translated: Then, by the union of the nine-day and nine-nakshatra, up to the twenty-seven nakshatras and the twelve signs of the moon.

original: eva candrakalāpañ cadaśabhedena ḍākinyādīnā herukeṇa saha sacāraḥ /
analyzed: eva candra kalā pañcadaśa bhedena herukeṇa saha sa cāraḥ
translated: And the movement of the moon's digits by the division of fifteen with the Heruka of the Dākinī and others.

analyzed: sa cāraḥ
translated: The movement of the twenty-seven nakshatras by the division of the Kākapiksi and others.

original: tataś candrasūryabhedānte dina traya pracaṇḍādīnā sacāro bhavati /
analyzed: tatas candra sūrya bheda ante dina traya pracaṇḍa ādīnām sa cāraḥ bhavati
translated: And then, at the end of the division of the moon and sun, the movement of Pracaṇḍā and others is for three days.

analyzed: tat yathā
translated: It is as follows:

original: The cittavākkāyacakrasacāra iha śuklatrayodaśyā vṛścikalagnodaye cittacakrapūrvāre pūjā kṛtvopāya tyaktvā dakṣiṇāre sacāraḥ pracaṇḍāyāḥ
analyzed: citta vāc kāya cakra sacāraḥ iha śukla trayodaśyāḥ vṛścika lagna udaye citta cakra pūrvāre pūjā tyaktvā dakṣiṇāre sacāraḥ pracaṇḍāyāḥ
translated: Here, on the thirteenth of the bright fortnight, when the sign of Scorpio rises, having performed the worship in the eastern direction of the mind wheel, having abandoned the means, in the southern direction there is the movement of Pracaṇḍā.

analyzed: caṇḍa akṣyāḥ
translated: Of Caṇḍākṣī,

analyzed: paścima are prabhāvatyāḥ uttara are mahānāsāyāḥ pūrva are
translated: in the western direction, of Prabhāvatī, in the northern direction, of Mahānāsā, in the eastern direction.

original: tataḥ sthānavaśāt pracaṇḍā caṇḍākṣī caṇḍākṣī prabhāvatī prabhāvatī mahānāsā mahānāsā pracaṇḍā bhavati /
analyzed: tatas sthāna vaśāt pracaṇḍā caṇḍākṣī caṇḍākṣī prabhāvatī prabhāvatī mahānāsā mahānāsā pracaṇḍā bhavati
translated: Then, by the power of the place, Pracaṇḍā becomes Caṇḍākṣī, Caṇḍākṣī becomes Prabhāvatī, Prabhāvatī becomes Mahānāsā, Mahānāsā becomes Pracaṇḍā.

analyzed: tatas vṛścika ardhe pūrva pracaṇḍāyāḥ paścima āre sa cāraḥ
translated: Then, in the Sagittarius half, the movement is in the west of the west of Pūrvapracanḍā.

original: pūrvacaṇḍākṣyā uttarāre pūrvaprabhāvatyāḥ pūrvāre sacāraḥ pūrvamahānāsāyā dakṣiṇāre /
analyzed: pūrva caṇḍākṣyāḥ uttara are pūrva prabhāvatyāḥ pūrva are sa cāraḥ pūrva mahā nāsāyāḥ dakṣiṇa are
translated: In the north of the north of Pūrvacandākṣī, the movement is in the east of Pūrvaprabhāvatī, and in the south of Pūrvamāhā.

original: tataḥ sthānavaśāt pracaṇḍā prabhāvatī caṇḍākṣī mahānāsā prabhāvatī pracaṇḍā mahānāsā caṇḍākṣī bhavati /
analyzed: tatas sthāna vaśāt pracaṇḍā prabhāvatī caṇḍākṣī mahānāsā prabhāvatī pracaṇḍā mahānāsā caṇḍākṣī bhavati
translated: Then, due to the position, Pracanḍā, Prabhāvatī, Caṇḍākṣī, Mahānāsā, Prabhāvatī, Pracanḍā, and Mahānāsā become Caṇḍākṣī.

analyzed: tatas dhanuḥ udaye pūrva pracaṇḍāyāḥ uttarāre sa cāraḥ
translated: Then, at the time of the bow, the movement is in the north of Pūrvapracanḍā.

original: pūrvacaṇḍākṣyāḥ pūrvāre pūrvaprabhāvatyā dakṣiṇāre pūrvamahānāsāyāḥ paścimāre /
analyzed: pūrva caṇḍa akṣyāḥ pūrva are pūrva prabhāvatyāḥ dakṣiṇa are pūrva mahā nāsāyāḥ paścima are
translated: In the east of Pūrvacandākṣī, in the east of Pūrvaprabhāvatī, in the south of Pūrvamāhā, and in the west of Pūrvamāhā.

original: tataḥ sthānavaśāt pracaṇḍā mahānāsā caṇḍākṣī pracaṇḍā prabhāvatī caṇḍākṣī mahānāsā prabhāvatī bhavati /
analyzed: tatas sthāna vaśāt pracaṇḍā mahā nāsā caṇḍākṣī pracaṇḍā prabhāvatī caṇḍākṣī mahā nāsā prabhāvatī bhavati
translated: Then, due to the position, Pracanḍā, Mahānāsā, Caṇḍākṣī, Pracanḍā, Prabhāvatī, Caṇḍākṣī, and Mahānāsā become Prabhāvatī.

analyzed: tatas dhanu ardhe pūrvapracaṇḍāyāḥ pūrva are sa cāraḥ
translated: Then, at the time of the bow, the movement is in the east of Pūrvapracanḍā.

original: caṇḍākṣyā dakṣināre prabhāvatyāḥ paścimāre mahānāsāyā uttarāre sacāro bhavati /
analyzed: caṇḍākṣyāḥ dakṣināre prabhāvatyāḥ paścināre mahānāsāyāḥ uttarāre sa cāraḥ bhavati
translated: In the south of Caṇḍākṣī, in the west of Prabhāvatī, and in the north of Mahānāsā, the movement occurs.

original: tato svasvasthā navaśāt pracaṇḍādayo dūtyaḥ svasvarūpadhāriṇyo bhavanti /
analyzed: sva svasthāḥ pracaṇḍa ādayaḥ dūtyaḥ sva sva rūpa dhāriṇyaḥ bhavanti
translated: Then, due to their own positions, the messengers Pracanḍā and others assume their own forms.

original: iti kuṇḍalādakṣiṇāvartena vṛścikodaye vṛścikārdhe dhanurudaye dhanvardhe /
analyzed: iti kuṇḍalā dakṣiṇa āvartena vṛścika udaye vṛścika ardhe dhanuḥ udaye dhanu ardhe
translated: Thus, in the rising of Scorpio, in the half of Scorpio, in the rising of Sagittarius, in the half of Sagittarius,

original: sārdhadaṇḍadvayena sārdhadaṇḍadvayena catasṛṇā sacāro gaṇaca kre kartavyaḥ /
analyzed: sārdha daṇḍa dvayena sārdha daṇḍa dvayena catasṛṇā sa cāraḥ gaṇa ca kre kartavyaḥ
translated: the four-fold movement should be made with two and a half daṇḍas and two and a half daṇḍas.

original: tato makarodaye pūjā kṛtvā vīramatyā iśasthānād vāya vyare sacāraḥ /
analyzed: tatas makara udaye pūjā kṛtvā vīramatyāḥ iśa sthānāt sa cāraḥ
translated: Then, in the rising of Capricorn, having performed the worship, the movement is in the southwest from the place of Vīramati.

original: kharvaryā nairṛtyāre laṅkeśvaryā āgneyāre drumacchā yāyā iśanāre sacāro bhavati /
analyzed: kharvaryāḥ nairṛtyāḥ are laṅkeśvaryāḥ āgneyāḥ are druma chā yāyāḥ iśanāre sa cāraḥ bhavati
translated: In the southwest of Kharvarī, in the southeast of Laṅkeśvarī, in the northeast of Drumacchāyā, the movement occurs.

analyzed: tatas sthāna vaśāt vīramatī kharvarī bhavati
translated: Then, due to the position, Vīramati becomes Kharvarī.

original: kharvarī laṅkeśvarī laṅkeśvarī drumacchāyā drumacchāyā vīramatī bhavati tato makarārdhe pūrvavīramatyā nairṛtyāre sacāraḥ /
analyzed: kharvarī laṅkeśvarī laṅkeśvarī drumacchāyā drumacchāyā vīramatī bhavati tatas makara ardhe pūrva vīramatyāḥ nairṛtya are sa cāraḥ
translated: Kharvarī becomes Laṅkeśvarī, Laṅkeśvarī becomes Drumacchāyā, Drumacchāyā becomes Vīramati. Then, in the half of Capricorn, the movement is in the southwest of the previous Vīramati.

original: pūrvakharvaryā āgneyāre pūrvalaṅkeśvaryā īśānāre pūrvadrumacchāyāyā vāyuvyāre sacāro bhavati /
analyzed: pūrva kharvaryāḥ āgneya are pūrva laṅkeśvaryāḥ īśāna are pūrva druma chāyāyāḥ vāyu vyāre sa cāraḥ bhavati
translated: In the southeast of the previous Kharvarī, in the northeast of the previous Laṅkeśvarī, in the northwest of the previous Drumacchāyā, the movement occurs.

original: tataḥ sthānavaśād vīramatī laṅkeśvarī bhavati kharvarī drumacchāyā laṅkeśvarī vīramatī drumacchāyā kharvarī bhavati /
analyzed: tatas sthāna vaśāt vīramatī laṅkeśvarī bhavati kharvarī drumacchāyā laṅkeśvarī vīramatī drumacchāyā kharvarī bhavati
translated: Then, due to the position, Vīramati becomes Laṅkeśvarī. Kharvarī becomes Drumacchāyā, Laṅkeśvarī becomes Vīramati, Drumacchāyā becomes Kharvarī.

original: tataḥ kumbhodaye pūrvavīramatyā āgneyāre sacāraḥ pūrvakharvaryā iśānāre pūrvalaṅkeśvarayā vāyavyāre pūrvadrumac chāyāyā nairṛtyāre sacāraḥ
analyzed: tatas kumbha udaye pūrva vīramatyāḥ āgneya are sa cāraḥ pūrva kharvaryāḥ iśāna are pūrva laṅkeśvarayā vāyavya are pūrva drumat chāyāyāḥ nairṛtya are sa cāraḥ
translated: Then, in the Kumbha rising, in the east, Vīramati, in the southeast, Khavarvī, in the northeast, Laṅkeśvarī, in the northwest, Drumacchāyā, in the southwest, Vīramati.

original: tataḥ sthānavaśād vīramatī dru macchāyā bhavati /
analyzed: tatas sthāna vaśāt vīramatī dru mad chāyā bhavati
translated: Then, due to the position, Drumacchāyā becomes Vīramati.

analyzed: kharvarī vīramatī bhavati  laṅkeśvarī kharvarī bhavati
translated: Khavarvī becomes Vīramati.🔽Laṅkeśvarī becomes Khavarvī.

original: drumacchāyā laṅkeśvarī bhavati /🔽tataḥ kumbhārdhe pūrvavīra matyā īśānāre sacāraḥ /
analyzed: drumacchāyā laṅkeśvarī bhavati  tatas kumbha ardhe pūrva vīra matyā īśāna are sa cāraḥ
translated: Drumacchāyā becomes Laṅkeśvarī.

original: pūrvakharvaryā vāyavyāre sacāraḥ pūrvalaṅkeśvaryā nairṛtyāre sacāraḥ pūrvadrumacchāyāyā āgneyāre sacāro bhavati /
analyzed: pūrva kharvaryāḥ vāyavya are sa cāraḥ pūrva laṅkeśvaryāḥ nairṛtya are sa cāraḥ pūrva drumacchāyāyāḥ āgneya are sa cāraḥ bhavati
translated: Then, in the half Kumbha, in the northeast, Vīramati, in the northwest, Khavarvī, in the southwest, Laṅkeśvarī, in the southeast, Drumacchāyā.

original: tataḥ svasvasthānavaśād vīramatyādayo yoginyaḥ svasvarūpadhāriṇyo bhavanti /
analyzed: tatas sva sva sthāna vaśāt vīramatī ādayaḥ yoginyaḥ sva svarūpa dhāriṇyaḥ bhavanti
translated: Then, due to their own positions, the yoginīs Vīramati and others assume their own forms.

original: iti kuṇḍalāvāmāvartena yoginīnā sacāro makarodaye makarārdhe kumbhodaye kumbhārdhe /
analyzed: iti sa cāraḥ makara udaye makara ardhe kumbha udaye kumbha ardhe
translated: Thus, the movement of the yoginīs in the clockwise and counterclockwise directions, in the Makara rising, in the half Makara, in the Kumbha rising, in the half Kumbha,

original: eva lagnārdhabhedenāṣṭayoginīnā cittacakre sacāro gaṇacakre yogibhir avagantavyaḥ /
analyzed: eva cittacakre sa cāraḥ gaṇacakre yogibhiḥ avagantavyaḥ
translated: should be understood by the yogis in the wheel of the eight yoginīs and in the wheel of the Gaṇas, according to the division of the half ascendant.

original: tataḥ pūja kṛtvā vākcakre sacāraḥ kartavyaḥ /
analyzed: tatas kṛtvā vākcakre sacāraḥ kartavyaḥ
translated: Then, having worshipped, the daily movement should be done.

analyzed: tat yathā
translated: It is as follows.

original: iha mīnalagnodaye vākcakrapūrvārād dakṣiṇāre sacāra airāvatyāḥ /
analyzed: iha mīna lagna udaye vāc cakra pūrva arāt dakṣiṇa are sa cāraḥ airāvatyāḥ
translated: Here, when the sign of Pisces ascends, the daily movement of Airavati is in the south from the beginning of the speech wheel.
Of Mahabhairava, it is in the west.

original: vāyuvegāyā uttarāre surabhākṣyāḥ pūrvāre sacāro bhavati /
analyzed: vāyuvegāyāḥ uttarāre surabhākṣyāḥ pūrvāre sa cāraḥ bhavati
translated: Of Vayuvega, it is in the north. Of Surabhakṣī, it is in the east.

analyzed: tatas sthāna vaśāt airāvatī mahābhairavā bhavati
translated: Then, due to the position, Airavati becomes Mahabhairava.

original: mahābhairavā vāyuvegā vāyuvegā surābhakṣī surābhakṣī airāvatī bhavati /
analyzed: bhavati
translated: Of Mahabhairava, it is Vayuvega. Of Vayuvega, it is Surabhakṣī. Of Surabhakṣī, it becomes Airavati.

original: tato mīnārdhe pūrvairāvatyāḥ paścimāre sacāra pūrvamahābhai ravāyā uttarāre pūrvavāyuvegāyāḥ pūrvāre pūrvasurābhakṣyā dakṣiṇāre sacāro bhavati
analyzed: tatas mīna ardhe pūrva airāvatyāḥ paścima are sa cāra pūrva mahābhai ravāyāḥ uttara are pūrva vāyuvegāyāḥ pūrva are pūrva surābhakṣyāḥ dakṣiṇa are sa cāraḥ bhavati
translated: Then, in the half sign of Pisces, the daily movement of Airavati is in the west of the west, of Pūrvamahabhairava in the north, of Pūrva Vayuvega in the east, and of Pūrva Surabhakṣī in the south.

original: tataḥ sthānavaśād airāvatī vāyuvegā bhavati ma hābhairavā surābhakṣī vāyuvegā airāvatī surābhakṣī mahābhairavā bhavati /
analyzed: tatas sthāna vaśāt airāvatī vāyuvegā bhavati ma hābhairavā surābhakṣī vāyuvegā airāvatī surābhakṣī mahābhairavā bhavati
translated: Then, due to the position, Airavati becomes Vayuvega. Of Mahabhairava, it is Surabhakṣī. Of Vayuvega, it is Airavati. Of Surabhakṣī, it becomes Mahabhairava.

original: tato meṣodaye pūrvairāvatyā uttarāre sacāraḥ pūrvamahābhai ravāyāh pūrvāre pūrvavāyuvegāyā dakṣiṇāre pūrvasurābhakṣyāḥ paścimāre sacāro
analyzed: tatas meṣa udaye pūrva airāvatyāḥ uttara are sa cāraḥ pūrva mahābhai pūrva are pūrva vāyuvegāyāḥ dakṣiṇa are pūrva surābhakṣyāḥ paścima are sa cāraḥ
translated: Then, in the ascendant of Aries, in the east of Airavati, in the north of Mahabhairava, in the east of Pūrva Vāyuvegā, in the south of Pūrva Surābhakṣī, in the west of Saccara,

original: tataḥ sthānavaśād airāvatī surābhakṣī bhavati mahābhai ravā airāvatī vāyuvegā mahābhairavā surābhakṣī vāyuvegā bhavati /
analyzed: tatas sthāna vaśāt airāvatī surā bhakṣī bhavati mahābhai ravā airāvatī vāyuvegā mahābhairavā surā bhakṣī vāyuvegā bhavati
translated: then, due to the position, Airavati becomes Surābhakṣī, Mahabhairava becomes Airavati, Vāyuvegā becomes Mahabhairava, and Surābhakṣī becomes Vāyuvegā.

original: tato meṣārdhe pūrvairāvatyāḥ pūrvāre sacāraḥ pūrvamahābhairavāyā dakṣiṇāre pūrvavāyuvegāyāḥ paścimāre pūrvasurābhakṣyā uttarāre sacāro bhavati
analyzed: tatas meṣa ardhe pūrva airāvatyāḥ pūrva are sa cāraḥ pūrva mahābhairavāyāḥ dakṣiṇa are pūrva vāyuvegāyāḥ paścima are pūrva surābhakṣyāḥ uttara are sa cāraḥ bhavati
translated: Then, in the half ascendant of Aries, in the east of Airavati, in the east of Saccara, in the south of Pūrva Mahabhairava, in the west of Pūrva Vāyuvegā, in the north of Pūrva Surābhakṣī, in the north of Saccara,

original: tataḥ svasvasthānavaśād airāvatyādayaḥ sva svarūpadhāriṇyo bhavanti /
analyzed: tatas sva sva sthāna vaśāt airāvatī ādayaḥ bhavanti
translated: then, due to their own positions, Airavati and others assume their own forms.

original: iti kuṇḍalādakṣiṇāvartena caturyoginīnā lagnārdhabhedena sacāro vākcakre /
analyzed: iti kuṇḍalā dakṣiṇa āvartena lagna ardha bhedena sa cāraḥ vākcakre
translated: Thus, in the clockwise rotation of the Kundala, the Saccara of the four Yoginis is in the Vakchakra, in the division of half ascendants.

original: tataḥ pūjā kṛtvā vṛṣalagnodaye īśānārād vāyavyāre śyāmādevyāḥ sacāraḥ subhadrāyā nairṛtyāre hayakarṇāyā āgneyāre khagānanāyā iśānāre sacāro
analyzed: tatas pūjā kṛtvā vṛṣa lagna udaye īśāna ārāt vāyavya are śyāmā devyāḥ sa cāraḥ subhadrāyāḥ nairṛtya are hayakarṇāyāḥ āgneya are khagānanāyāḥ iśāna āre sa cāraḥ
translated: Then, after worship, in the ascendant of Taurus, in the northeast of Shyamadevi, in the northwest, Saccara of Subhadra, in the southwest, Haya-karna, in the southeast, Khaganana, in the northeast, Saccara,

analyzed: bhavati
translated: exists.

original: tataḥ sthānavaśāc chyamādevī subhadrā bhavati subhadrā hayakarṇā hayakarṇā khagānanā khagānanā śyāmādevī bhavati /
analyzed: tatas sthāna vaśāt śyamā devī subhadrā bhavati subhadrā haya karṇā haya karṇā khaga ānanā khaga ānanā śyāmā devī bhavati
translated: Then, by the rule of place, Shyamadevi becomes Subhadra, Subhadra becomes Hayakarana, Hayakarana becomes Khaganana, and Khaganana becomes Shyamadevi.

original: tato vṛṣabhārdhe prāk śyāmādevyā nairṛtyāre sacāraḥ prāk subhadrāyā āgneyāre prāg ghayakarṇāyā iśānāre prāk khagānanāyā vāyavyāre sacāraḥ
analyzed: tatas vṛṣabha ardhe prāk śyāmā devyāḥ nairṛtya are sa cāraḥ prāk subhadrāyāḥ āgneya are prāk ghayakarṇāyāḥ iśāna are prāk khagānanāyāḥ vāyavya are sa cāraḥ
translated: Then, in the half-sign of Taurus, in the southwest of Shyamadevi, in the east of Subhadra, in the southeast of Hayakarana, in the northeast of Khaganana, and in the northwest of Shyamadevi, the movement is in the east.

original: tataḥ sthāna vaśāc chyāmādevī hayakarṇā bhavati subhadrā khagānanā hayakarṇā śyāmādevī khagānanā subhadrā bhavati /
analyzed: tatas sthāna vaśāt śyāmā devī haya karṇā bhavati subhadrā khaga ānanā haya karṇā śyāmā devī khaga ānanā subhadrā bhavati
translated: Then, by the rule of place, Shyamadevi becomes Hayakarana, Subhadra becomes Khaganana, Hayakarana becomes Shyamadevi, and Khaganana becomes Subhadra.

original: tato mithunodaye prākśyāmādevyā āgneyāre sacāraḥ prāk subhadrāyā īśānāre prāg ghayakarṇāyā vāyavyāre prāk khagānanāyā nairṛtyāre sacāro bhavati
analyzed: tatas mithuna udaye prāk śyāmā devyāḥ āgneya are sa cāraḥ prāk subhadrāyāḥ īśāna are prāk ghayakarṇāyāḥ vāyavya are prāk khagānanāyāḥ nairṛtya are sa cāraḥ bhavati
translated: Then, in the rising of the pair, in the southeast of Shyamadevi, the movement is in the east, in the northeast of Subhadra, in the northwest of Hayakarana, in the southwest of Khaganana, and in the east of Shyamadevi, the movement is in the east.

original: tataḥ sthānavaśāc chyāmādevī khagānanā bhavati subhadrā śyāmādevī hayakarṇā subhadrā khagānanā hayakarṇā /
analyzed: tatas sthāna vaśāt śyāmā devī khagānanā bhavati subhadrā śyāmā devī hayakarṇā subhadrā khagānanā hayakarṇā
translated: Then, by the rule of place, Shyamadevi becomes Khaganana, Subhadra becomes Shyamadevi, Hayakarana becomes Subhadra, and Khaganana becomes Hayakarana.

original: tato mithunārdhe pūrvaśyāmādevyā īśānāre sacāraḥ pūrvasubhadrāyā vāyavyāre pūrvahayakarṇāyā nairṛtyāre pūrvakhagānanāya āgneyāre sacāro bhavati
analyzed: tatas mithuna ardhe pūrva śyāmā devyāḥ īśāna are sa cāraḥ pūrva subhadrāyāḥ vāyavya are pūrva hayakarṇāyāḥ nairṛtya are pūrva khagānanāye āgneya are sa cāraḥ bhavati
translated: Then, in the northeast corner of the eastern half of the couple, the movement is for the eastern Shyamadevi, in the northwest corner for the eastern Subhadra, in the southwest corner for the eastern Hayakarni, and in the southeast corner for the eastern Khaganana.

original: tato svasvasthānavaśāc chyāmādevyādayo yoginyaḥ svasvarūpadhāriṇyo bhavanti /
analyzed: sva sva sthāna vaśāt śyāmā devī ādayaḥ yoginyaḥ sva svarūpa dhāriṇyaḥ bhavanti
translated: Then, according to their respective places, the yoginis Shyamadevi and others assume their own forms.

original: iti kuṇḍalāvāmāvartena caturyoginīnā sacāro vā kcakre /
analyzed: iti sa cāraḥ vā k cakre
translated: Thus, the movement of the four yoginis is made in the wheel by the clockwise and anticlockwise rotation.

analyzed: mīna ādi ardha lagna bhedena aṣṭa yoginīnām gaṇa cakre sa cāraḥ
translated: The movement of the eight yoginis in the ganachakra should be made according to the difference in the half-signs starting from Pisces.

original: tataḥ pūja kṛtvā kāyacakre sacāraḥ kartavyaḥ /
analyzed: tatas kṛtvā kāya cakre sa cāraḥ kartavyaḥ
translated: Then, after performing the worship, the movement in the body wheel should be made.

analyzed: tat yathā
translated: It is as follows.

original: iha karkaṭodaye kāyacakrapūrvārāc cakravegāyā dakṣiṇāre sacāraḥ khaṇḍarohāyāḥ paścimāre śauṇḍinyā uttarāre cakravarmiṇyāḥ pūrvāre /
analyzed: iha karkaṭa udaye kāya cakra pūrvārāt cakravegāyāḥ dakṣiṇa are sa cāraḥ khaṇḍarohāyāḥ paścima are śauṇḍinyāḥ uttara are cakravarmiṇyāḥ pūrvāre
translated: Here, at the rising of Cancer, the movement is in the southeast corner of the body wheel for Chakravega, in the south corner for Khandaroha, in the west corner for Shoundini, in the north corner for Chakravarmini, and in the east corner.

original: tataḥ sthānavaśāc cakravegā khaṇḍarohā bhavati khaṇḍarohā śauṇḍinī śauṇḍinī cakravarmiṇi cakravarmiṇī cakravegā bhavati /
analyzed: tatas sthāna vaśāt cakravegā khaṇḍarohā bhavati khaṇḍarohā śauṇḍinī śauṇḍinī cakravarmiṇi cakravarmiṇī cakravegā bhavati
translated: Then, according to the places, Chakravega becomes Khandaroha, Khandaroha becomes Shoundini, Shoundini becomes Chakravarmini, and Chakravarmini becomes Chakravega.

original: tataḥ kar kaṭārdhe pūrvacakravegāyāḥ paścimāre sacāraḥ pūrvakhaṇ ḍarohāyā uttarāre pūrvaśauṇḍinyāḥ pūrvāre pūrvacakravarmiṇyā dakṣiṇāre🔽tataḥ sthānavaśāt pūrvacakravegā śauṇḍinī bhavati pūrva khaṇḍarohā cakravarmiṇī pūrvaśauṇḍinī cakravegā pūrvacakravarmi ṇī khaṇḍarohā bhavati
analyzed: tatas kar kaṭa ardhe pūrva cakravegāyāḥ paścima are sa cāraḥ pūrva khaṇ ḍarohāyāḥ uttara are pūrva śauṇḍinyāḥ pūrva are pūrva cakravarmiṇyāḥ dakṣiṇa are  tatas sthāna vaśāt pūrva cakravegā śauṇḍinī bhavati khaṇḍarohā cakravarmiṇī pūrva śauṇḍinī cakravegā pūrva cakravarmi ṇī khaṇḍarohā bhavati
translated: Then, by the power of the position, the eastern wheel-speed becomes the speed, the eastern section-rise becomes the northern speed, the eastern splendor becomes the eastern speed, and the eastern wheel-armored becomes the southern speed.🔽Then, by the power of the position, the eastern wheel-speed becomes the splendor, the eastern section-rise becomes the armored, the eastern splendor becomes the speed, and the eastern wheel-armored becomes the rise.

original: tato sihalagnodaye pūrvacakravegāyā uttarā re sacāraḥ pūrvakhaṇḍarohāyāḥ pūrvāre pūrvaśauṇḍiṇyā dakṣiṇāre pūrva cakravarmiṇyāḥ paścimāre
analyzed: siha lagna udaye pūrva cakravegāyāḥ uttara are sa cāraḥ pūrva khaṇḍarohāyāḥ pūrva are pūrva śauṇḍiṇyāḥ dakṣiṇa are cakravarmiṇyāḥ paścima are
translated: Then, at the rising of the sign of Leo, the northern speed of the eastern wheel-speed becomes the speed, the eastern rise of the eastern section-rise becomes the eastern speed, the southern splendor of the eastern splendor becomes the southern speed, and the western armored of the eastern wheel-armored becomes the western speed.

analyzed: sacāraḥ
translated: The speed.

original: tataḥ sthānavaśāt pūrvacakravegā cakravarmiṇī bhavati pūrvakhaṇḍarohā cakravegā pūrvaśauṇḍinī khaṇḍarohā pūrvacakravarmiṇī śauṇḍinī bhavati
analyzed: tatas sthāna vaśāt pūrva cakravegā cakravarmiṇī bhavati pūrva khaṇḍarohā cakravegā pūrva śauṇḍinī khaṇḍarohā pūrva cakravarmiṇī śauṇḍinī bhavati
translated: Then, by the power of the position, the eastern wheel-speed becomes the armored, the eastern section-rise becomes the speed, the eastern splendor becomes the rise, and the eastern wheel-armored becomes the splendor.

original: tataḥ sihārdhe pūrvacakravegāyāḥ pūrvāre sacāraḥ pūrvakhaṇḍarohāyā dakṣiṇāre pūrvaśauṇḍiṇyāḥ paścimāre pūrvacakravarmiṇyā uttarāre sacāraḥ
analyzed: tatas sihārdhe pūrva cakravegāyāḥ pūrva are sa cāraḥ pūrva khaṇḍarohāyāḥ dakṣiṇa are pūrva śauṇḍiṇyāḥ paścima are pūrva cakravarmiṇyāḥ uttara are sa cāraḥ
translated: Then, in the clockwise direction, the speed of the previous wheel in the east quarter becomes the speed in the south quarter of the previous section-mounter, the speed in the west quarter of the previous eastern-victorious, and the speed in the north quarter of the previous wheel-armored.

original: tataḥ svasvasthānavaśāc cakravegādayo yoginyaḥ svasvarūpa dhāriṇyo bhavati /
analyzed: tatas sva sva sthāna vaśāt cakravega ādayaḥ yoginyaḥ sva svarūpa dhāriṇyaḥ bhavati
translated: Then, by the power of their own places, the yoginis such as speed of the wheel retain their own forms.

analyzed: iti kuṇḍalā dakṣiṇa āvartena sa cāraḥ kāya cakre
translated: Thus, the speed in the clockwise direction is in the body wheel, turning to the right like an earring.

original: tataḥ pūjā kṛtvā vāmāvartena sacāraḥ kartavyaḥ /
analyzed: tatas pūjā kṛtvā vāma āvartena sa cāraḥ kartavyaḥ
translated: Then, having made offerings, the speed should be made in the counterclockwise direction.

original: tad yathā /🔽iha kanyā lagnodaye īśānārāt suvīrāyā vāyavyāre sacāro bhavati mahābalāyā nairṛtyāre cakravartinyā āgneyāre mahāvīryāyā iśānāre sacāro bhavati
analyzed: tat yathā  iha kanyā lagna udaye īśāna arāt suvīrāyāḥ vāyavya are sa cāraḥ bhavati mahābalāyāḥ nairṛtya are cakravartinyāḥ āgneya are mahāvīryāyāḥ iśāna are sa cāraḥ bhavati
