translated: That is as follows.🔽Here, the maiden rising in the ascendant has speed from the northeast quarter to the northwest quarter of the greatly heroic, from the southwest quarter of the greatly powerful to the southeast quarter of the universal monarch, and from the northeast quarter of the greatly valorous to the northeast quarter.

original: tataḥ sthānavaśāt suvīrā mahābalā bhavati mahābalā cakravartinī bhavati cakravartinī mahāvīryā bhavati mahāvīryā suvīrā bhavati /
analyzed: tatas sthāna vaśāt su vīrā mahā balā bhavati mahā balā cakravartinī bhavati cakravartinī mahā vīryā bhavati mahā vīryā su vīrā bhavati
translated: Then, by the power of their places, the greatly heroic becomes the greatly powerful, the universal monarch becomes the wheel-armored, the wheel-armored becomes the greatly valorous, and the greatly valorous becomes the greatly heroic.

original: tataḥ kanyārdhe pūrvasuvīrāyā nairṛtyāre sacāraḥ pūrvamahābalāyā āgne yāre pūrvacakravartinyā iśānāre pūrvamahāvīryāyā vāyavyāre sacāraḥ
analyzed: tatas kanyā ardhe pūrva suvīrāyāḥ nairṛtya āre sa cāraḥ pūrva mahābalāyāḥ āgne yāre pūrva cakravartinyāḥ iśāna are pūrva mahāvīryāyāḥ vāyavya āre sa cāraḥ
translated: Then, in the southeast quarter of the half sign of the maiden, there is movement for the previous Suvira, in the southwest quarter for the previous Mahabala, in the southeast quarter for the previous Chakravartin, in the northeast quarter for the previous Mahavirya, and in the northwest quarter there is movement.

analyzed: tatas sthāna vaśāt suvīrā cakravartinī bhavati
translated: Then, due to the position, Suvira becomes Chakravartin.

analyzed: mahā viryā mahā balā
translated: Mahavirya, Mahabala.

analyzed: ca kravartinī su vīrā
translated: And Chakravartin, Suvira.

original: mahāvīryā mahābalā bhavati /🔽tatas tulālagnodaye pūrvasuvīrāyā agneyāre sacāraḥ /
analyzed: mahā vīryā mahā balā bhavati  tatas tulā lagna udaye pūrva suvīrāyāḥ agneyāre sa cāraḥ
translated: Mahavirya, Mahabala becomes.

analyzed: pūrva mahābalāyāḥ īśānā re
translated: Then, at the rising of the Libra ascendant, there is movement in the southeast quarter for the previous Suvira, in the northeast quarter for the previous Mahabala,

analyzed: pūrva cakravartinyāḥ vāyāvyāre  pūrva mahā vīryāyāḥ nairṛtya are sa cāraḥ bhavati
translated: in the northwest quarter for the previous Chakravartin,🔽and in the southwest quarter there is movement for the previous Mahavirya.

analyzed: tatas para sthāna vaśāt suvīrā mahā vīryā bhavati
translated: Then, due to the subsequent position, Suvira becomes Mahavirya.

analyzed: mahā balā su vīrā
translated: Mahabala, Suvira.

analyzed: cakravartinī mahā balā
translated: Chakravartin, Mahabala.

original: mahāvīryā cakravartinī bhavati /🔽tatas tulārdhe pūrvasuvīrāyā iśānāre sacāraḥ /
analyzed: mahā vīryā cakravartinī bhavati  tatas tulā ardhe pūrvasuvīrāyāḥ iśānāre sacāraḥ
translated: Mahavirya becomes Chakravartin.

analyzed: pūrva mahābalāyāḥ vāyavya are
translated: Then, in the half sign of Libra, there is movement in the northeast quarter for the previous Suvira, in the northwest quarter for the previous Mahabala,

analyzed: pūrva cakravartinyāḥ nairṛtya are
translated: in the southwest quarter for the previous Chakravartin,

analyzed: pūrva mahāvīryāyāḥ āgneya are sa cāraḥ
translated: and in the southeast quarter there is movement for the previous Mahavirya.

original: ta taḥ svasvasthānavaśāt suvīrādayaś catasro yoginyaḥ svasvarūpadhāriṇyo bhavanti /
analyzed: ta taḥ sva sva sthāna vaśāt suvīra ādayaḥ catasraḥ yoginyaḥ sva sva rūpa dhāriṇyaḥ bhavanti
translated: Then, by the power of their own places, the four yoginis Suvira and so on assume their own forms.

analyzed: iti kuṇḍala avāma āvartena sa cāraḥ
translated: Thus, the movement is clockwise and counterclockwise.

original: kanyādilagnār dhabhedena gaṇacakre yoginīnā sacāraḥ kartavyaḥ kāyacakre /
analyzed: kanyā ādi lagnāt dha bhedena gaṇacakre yoginīnā sa cāraḥ kartavyaḥ kāyacakre
translated: The movement of the yoginis should be done in the body wheel by the division of the signs beginning with Virgo in the wheel of the groups.

analyzed: eva prathama dine vṛścika ādi dvādaśa lagna ardha caturviśati bhedaiḥ yoginī sa cāraḥ trayodaśyā
translated: Thus, on the first day, the movement of the yoginis is thirteen by the division of the twelve signs beginning with Scorpio into twenty-four halves.

analyzed: iha yathā trayodaśyā citta bhedena
translated: Here, as by the division of the thirteenth day, darkness

analyzed: guṇa bhedena vā
translated: is divided by the quality of tamas.

original: tathā caturdaśyā dvitīyadine vāgbhedena rajo guṇabhedena vā /
analyzed: tathā caturdaśyāḥ dvitīya dine vāc bhedena rajaḥ guṇa bhedena vā
translated: And as by the division of the fourteenth day, the second day, speech is divided by the quality of rajas.

original: eva pūrṇimāyā tṛtīyadine kāyabhedena sat tvaguṇabhedena vā /
analyzed: eva pūrṇimāyāḥ tṛtīya dine kāya bhedena sat tva guṇa bhedena vā
translated: Thus, on the third day of the full moon, the body is divided by the quality of sattva.

original: caturviśatiyoginīnā sacāraḥ kartavyaḥ vṛśikā didvādaśārdhalagne caturviśatikālabhedair yogibhir gaṇacakre /
analyzed: caturviśati yoginīnā sa cāraḥ kartavyaḥ caturviśati kāla bhedaiḥ yogibhiḥ gaṇacakre
translated: The movement of the twenty-four yoginis should be done in the body wheel by the yogins by the twenty-four divisions of time in the twelve signs beginning with Scorpio.

original: iti caturviśatikālaviśeṣeṇa yoginīmā sacāravidhiniyamaḥ iha yā yoginī yatra sthāne sacārati tatra taducchiṣṭabhakṣaṇavaśena tatkulopāyagrahaṇena
analyzed: iti caturviśati kāla viśeṣeṇa sacāra vidhi niyamaḥ iha yā yoginī yatra sthāne sacārati tatra tad ucchiṣṭa bhakṣaṇa vaśena tad kula upāya grahaṇena
translated: Thus, by the specific time of the twenty-four, there is the rule of the conduct of the yoginīs. Here, the yoginī who moves in a certain place becomes of that family by eating the leftovers there and by taking the means of that family.

analyzed: sā tad kulinī bhavati
translated: She becomes of that family.

original: yāvat tasyāḥ svasthānāgama na na bhavati /
analyzed: yāvat tasyāḥ sva sthāna āgama na na bhavati
translated: As long as she does not return to her own place.

analyzed: tatas sva sthāna āgamanena sva kula sthitā bhavati
translated: Then, by returning to her own place, she becomes established in her own family.

original: eva herukagrahaṇena kulikocchiṣṭabhakṣaṇavaśena ḍākinyādiyoginī yamama thanīparyantā yā madhye viśati sā vajravārāhī kulikā bhavati /
analyzed: eva heruka grahaṇena kulikā ucchiṣṭa bhakṣaṇa vaśena ḍākinī ādi yoginī yā madhye viśati sā vajravārāhī kulikā bhavati
translated: In the same way, by taking Heruka and by eating the leftovers of the family, the yoginī from Ḍākinī up to Yamāntakī who enters in the middle becomes the family of Vajravārāhī.

original: yā vajravārāhī kulikā sā parocchiṣṭabhakṣaṇavaśena tatkulinī bhavati /
analyzed: yā vajravārāhī kulikā sā para ucchiṣṭa bhakṣaṇa vaśena tad kulinī bhavati
translated: The Vajravārāhī family, by eating the leftovers of others, becomes of that family.

analyzed: eva ṣaṭtriśat kula yoginyaḥ akulīnāḥ kulīnāḥ bhavanti
translated: In this way, the thirty-six families of yoginīs, though not of a family, become of a family.

analyzed: kulīnāḥ akulīnāḥ bhavanti
translated: Those of a family become not of a family.

analyzed: sthāna vaśāt
translated: By the power of the place.

original: yathā laukikasamvṛtyā akulīnā api cakravarti ratnacchatratale snāpitāḥ santyāḥ kulīnā bhavanti brāhmanādīnā /
analyzed: yathā laukika samvṛtyāḥ akulīnāḥ api cakravarti ratna chatra tale snāpitāḥ santyāḥ kulīnāḥ bhavanti
translated: Just as, by worldly convention, even those not of a family, when bathed under the jeweled parasol of a universal monarch, become of a family, such as brahmins and so on.

original: yathā eva viśvāmitrādayaḥ śvapacyādigarbhasabhūtā akulīnā mantradhyā natapobalena brāhmaṇā babhūvus tathā kulināpi brāhmaṇā gomāsādika
analyzed: yathā eva viśvāmitra ādayaḥ akulīnāḥ brāhmaṇāḥ babhūvuḥ tathā brāhmaṇāḥ
translated: Just as Viśvāmitra and others, born in the womb of a Śvapacī and being of low caste, became Brahmins by the power of mantra, meditation and austerity, so also Brahmins of high caste, by eating beef and other forbidden food,

original: bhuktvā caṇḍālādyakulīnā ca gṛhe bhuktvā akulīnā bhavanti /
analyzed: bhuktvā caṇḍāla ādi akulīnā ca gṛhe bhuktvā akulīnāḥ bhavanti
translated: and by eating in the house of a Cāṇḍāla and other low castes, become of low caste.

original: tathā yoginīsacāre parasthānabhojanopāyabhakṣaṇagrahaṇava śena laukikasavṛtyā yoginyo yogibhir jñātavyāḥ pūrvoktāḥ saptatriśaḍḍombyādyāḥ
analyzed: tathā yoginī sacāre para sthāna bhojana upāya bhakṣaṇa grahaṇa va śena laukika savṛtyāḥ yoginyaḥ yogibhiḥ jñātavyāḥ pūrva uktāḥ sapta tri śaṭḍombī ādyāḥ  /
translated: Similarly, the Yoginīs and Yogins should be known by worldly means, as mentioned before, by the method of eating in the abode of others, by the acceptance of food and drink, as mentioned in the Yoginī Saccāra, the thirty-seven, Oṃbī and others.

analyzed: kula dūtyāḥ gaṇa cakre sa cāra artham
translated: For the purpose of moving in the circle of the Gaṇa, as the messenger of the Kula.

original: eva trivarṣa yāvat pūjāmantrajāpadhyāna kṛtvā mantrajāpāvasāne homam /
analyzed: eva tri varṣa yāvat pūjā mantra jāpa dhyāna kṛtvā mantra jāpa avasāne homam
translated: Thus, having performed worship, mantra recitation and meditation for three years, at the end of the mantra recitation, one should perform the homa.

original: tataḥ pakṣatraya yāvad gaṇacakre yoginīsacāra kūryat /
analyzed: tatas yāvat gaṇa cakre yoginī sacāra kūryat
translated: Then, for three fortnights, one should perform the Yoginī Saccāra in the circle of the Gaṇa.

original: tataḥ pūrvokta laukikasiddhisādhana tantrokta sarva sarvadā sarvaprakāreṇa sādhakasya siddhayati /
analyzed: tatas sarva sarvadā sarva prakāreṇa sādhakasya
translated: Then, by the means of accomplishing worldly attainments as mentioned before, and by all the means mentioned in the Tantra, the adept always attains success in all ways.

original: anyaprakāreṇa punar ekakarmaṇā ekasiddhiḥ siddhyati mantra jāpadhyānena homeneti /
analyzed: anya prakāreṇa punar eka karmaṇā eka siddhiḥ siddhi ati mantra jāpa dhyānena homena iti
translated: By another method, by a single rite, a single attainment is accomplished by the recitation and meditation of the mantra and by the homa.

original: na ca yogī pradhānasiddhisiddho bhavati ekakarmaṇā siddhena ekayā khaḍgādisiddhyā siddhayā vā /
analyzed: na ca yogī pradhāna siddhi siddhaḥ bhavati eka karmaṇā siddhena ekayā khaḍga ādi siddhyā siddhayā vā
translated: And the yogi does not become accomplished by the accomplishment of prakriti, by the accomplishment of one action, by one accomplishment such as the sword, etc., or by the accomplishment of one.

original: tenāya yoginīsacāraḥ kālaviśeṣeṇa yogibhir avagantavyo mūlatantre lakṣābhidhāne /
analyzed: yoginī sacāraḥ kāla viśeṣeṇa yogibhiḥ avagantavyaḥ mūla tantre lakṣa abhidhāne
translated: Therefore, this conduct of the yoginis should be understood by the yogis at a particular time in the root tantra called Lakshabhidhana.

analyzed: athavā anayā ṭīkayā tasmāt uktaḥ
translated: Or, it is stated from that by this commentary.

analyzed: iti niyamaḥ laukika sarva karma prasara sarva siddhi sākṣātkaraṇāya mahāsiddha tva sādhanāya ca
translated: Thus, this rule is for the realization of all worldly actions, all accomplishments, and for the attainment of great accomplishment.

analyzed: iti yoginī sacāra vidhiḥ
translated: Thus, the method of the conduct of the yoginis.

original: Chapter IX The Development of Location idānī sthānanāmādibījapariṇatāny āsanāny adhyātmani bāhye gaṇaca kre 'pi ucyante /🔽tatra bāhye meror adha ākāśamaṇḍala hakārapariṇa tam adhyātmany uṣṇīṣakamalakarṇikā /🔽bāhye taduparī yakārapariṇata vāyumaṇḍalam adhyātmani lalāṭakamalakarṇikā /
analyzed: chapter ix the develpment of location idānī sthāna nāma ādi bīja pariṇatāni āsanāni adhyātmani bāhye ucyante  tatra bāhye meroḥ adhas ākāśa maṇḍala hakāra pariṇa tam adhyātmani uṣṇīṣa kamala karṇikā  bāhye tad uparī vāyu maṇḍalam adhyātmani lalāṭa kamala karṇikā
translated: Chapter IX: The Development of Location Now, the seats that have transformed from the seed syllables of the names of the directions, etc., are mentioned in the inner, outer, and in the group of eight.🔽There, in the outer, below Meru, the circle of space has transformed from the syllable ha, and in the inner, it is the pericarp of the lotus of the ushnisha.🔽In the outer, above that, the circle of air has transformed from the syllable ya, and in the inner, it is the pericarp of the lotus of the forehead.

original: bāhye taduparī rakārapariṇata agnimaṇḍalam adhyātmani kaṇṭhakamalakarṇikā /
analyzed: bāhye tad upari agni maṇḍalam adhyātmani kaṇṭha kamala karṇikā
translated: In the outer, above that, the circle of fire has transformed from the syllable ra, and in the inner, it is the pericarp of the lotus of the throat.

original: bāhye tadupari vakārapariṇata toyamaṇḍalam adhyātmani hṛdayakamalakarṇikā /🔽bāhye tadupari lakārapariṇata pṛthvīmaṇḍalam adhyātmani nābhikamalakarṇikā /
analyzed: bāhye tad upari vakāra pariṇata toya maṇḍalam adhyātmani hṛdaya kamala karṇikā  bāhye tad upari pṛthvī maṇḍalam adhyātmani nābhi kamala karṇikā
translated: Externally, above that, the water circle transformed from the letter Va, internally, the pericarp of the heart lotus.🔽Externally, above that, the earth circle transformed from the letter La, internally, the pericarp of the navel lotus.

original: bāhye tadupari makārapariṇata merur adhyātmani guhyakamalakarṇikā /
analyzed: bāhye tad upari makāra pariṇata meruḥ adhyātmani guhya kamala karṇikā
translated: Externally, above that, Mount Meru transformed from the letter Ma, internally, the pericarp of the secret lotus.

original: bāhye tadupari kṣakārapariṇa ta viśvakamalam adhyātmani vajramaṇyantargatā 'ṣṭau nāḍyaḥ sakarṇikāḥ /
analyzed: bāhye tad upari viśva kamalam adhyātmani vajramaṇi antargatā ṣṭau nāḍyaḥ sa karṇikāḥ
translated: Externally, above that, the universe lotus transformed from the letter Kṣa, internally, the eight channels with the pericarp, located within the vajra gem.

analyzed: bāhye sūrya maṇḍalam adhyātmani kālāgniḥ
translated: Externally, in the pericarp, the sun circle, internally, the fire of time.

original: bāhye ta dupari umāmaheśvarāv adhyātmani rajaḥ śukara tatragatam /
analyzed: bāhye umā maheśvarau adhyātmani rajaḥ
translated: Externally, above that, Umā and Maheśvara, internally, the rajas and the peacock located there.

original: bāhye tadupa ri heruko 'dhyātmani sahajānandas tayor niruddhayor yo bhavati bāhyācyava neneti /
analyzed: bāhye tat upa ri herukaḥ dhī ātmani sahaja ānandaḥ tayoḥ niruddhayoḥ yaḥ bhavati nena iti
translated: Externally, above that, Heruka, internally, the innate bliss that arises when those two are blocked by the external and internal.

analyzed: vajra vārāhī tad raśmi prabhā sarvajñātā candrasya candrikā iva bhedya dharmiṇī
translated: The Vajra Sow is the nature of the light rays and the innate bliss of the moon, which is like the moonlight of omniscience.

original: eva nābhau guhye vajramaṇau kāyavākcittadharmeṇa sa hajānando heruko bhagavān ucyate /
analyzed: eva nābhau guhye vajramaṇau kāya vāc citta dharmeṇa sa hajānandaḥ herukaḥ bhagavān ucyate
translated: Thus, in the navel, secret, and vajra gem, the innate bliss of the body, speech, and mind is called the Blessed One Heruka.

original: atra sahajānando jñānavajraś caturthaḥ eva bhagavān herukaś caturmukhaḥ kāyavākcittajñānavaktrātma kaḥ /
analyzed: atra sahajānandaḥ jñāna vajraḥ caturthaḥ eva bhagavān herukaḥ caturmukhaḥ kāya vāc citta jñāna vaktra ātma kaḥ
translated: Here, the innate bliss and the wisdom-vajra are the very fourth Blessed Heruka with four faces, the nature of body, speech, mind, and wisdom.

original: teṣā caturvaktrānā svabhāvenottaradakṣiṇapūrvāparacakrāreṣu sthi tāḥ ṣaṭtriśaḍḍākinyaḥ /
analyzed: teṣām svabhāvena uttara dakṣiṇa pūrva apara cakra āreṣu sthi tāḥ ṣaṭtriśat ḍākinyaḥ
translated: And by their very nature, the thirty-six ḍākinīs are established in the northern, southern, eastern, and western wheels of those four-faced ones.

analyzed: tāsā sva sthāna nāma ādi akṣareṇa pariṇatāni śavāsanāni bhavanti
translated: Their own places are transformed by the first syllable of the names into corpse seats.

original: bāhye jñānacakre pūrvāropary ākārapariṇata preta ḍākinyā adhyātmani nābhikamale yāḥ ṣaṣṭināḍyo maṇḍalavāhinyaś catasraḥ sadhyānāḍyaḥ /
analyzed: bāhye jñānacakre pūrvāra upari ākāra pariṇata preta ḍākinyāḥ adhyātmani nābhi kamale yāḥ ṣaṣṭi nāḍyaḥ maṇḍala vāhinyaḥ catasraḥ sadhyā nāḍyaḥ
translated: In the external wisdom wheel, above the east, the ḍākinī transformed into the shape of a preta, and in the internal navel lotus, the sixty nāḍīs that carry the maṇḍala, the four main nāḍīs,

original: tāsu pūrvādināḍyā niruddhaḥ prāṇavāyuḥ śavāsanam ucyate /
analyzed: tāsu pūrvādi nāḍyā niruddhaḥ prāṇa vāyuḥ śavāsanam ucyate
translated: in those, the prāṇa wind blocked in the eastern nāḍī is said to be the corpse seat.

original: eva bāhye pakārapariṇata dakṣiṇāre lāmāyāḥ paścimāre makārapariṇata khaṇḍarohāyā uttare takārapariṇata rūpiṇyāḥ /
analyzed: eva bāhye pakāra pariṇata dakṣiṇa are lāmāyāḥ paścima are makāra pariṇata khaṇḍarohāyāḥ uttare takāra pariṇata rūpiṇyāḥ
translated: In the same way, externally, in the southern wheel transformed into the letter pa, of Lāmā, in the western wheel transformed into the letter ma, of Khaṇḍarohā, in the northern wheel transformed into the letter ta, of Rūpiṇī.

analyzed: iti jñānacakre vidikṣu viṣ mūtra asṛj māsa karoṭakāni iti
translated: Thus, in the wisdom wheel, in the intermediate directions, feces, urine, blood, and menstrual blood are the skull cups.

original: bāhye 'ṣṭasu mahāśmaśāneṣu pūrvaśmaśāne śūkārapariṇata śavā sana kākāsyāyā adhyātmani mukhanāḍyā prāṇavāyor nirodha it /
analyzed: bāhye ṣṭasu mahā śmaśāneṣu pūrva śmaśāne adhyātmani mukha nāḍyā prāṇa vāyoḥ nirodhe
translated: In the external eight great cremation grounds, in the eastern cremation ground, the corpse transformed into a pig, with the face of a crow, internally in the nostril of the mouth, the obstruction of the life-wind.

original: tathā bāhye śakārapariṇata dakṣiṇa ulūkāsyāyā adhyātmani dakṣiṇanāsāpu ṭanāḍyā prāṇakṣaya iti /🔽bāhye pūkārapariṇatam paścime śvānāsyāyā adhyātmani gudanāḍyām apānavāyor nirodhaḥ /🔽bāhye klekārapariṇatam uttarāre śūkarāsyāyā adhyātmani vāmanāsā puṭanāḍyā prāṇanirodhaḥ /
analyzed: tathā bāhye ulūka āsyāyāḥ adhyātmani dakṣiṇa nāsāpu prāṇa kṣayaḥ iti  bāhye pūkāra pariṇatam paścime śvānāsyāyāḥ adhyātmani guda nāḍyām apāna vāyoḥ nirodhaḥ  bāhye klekāra pariṇatam uttarāre śūkara āsyāyāḥ adhyātmani vāma nāsā puṭa nāḍyā prāṇa nirodhaḥ
translated: Similarly, in the external, the corpse transformed into a hawk in the south, with the face of an owl, internally in the nostril of the right nostril, the exhaustion of the life-wind.🔽In the external, the corpse transformed into a dog in the west, with the face of a dog, internally in the anus, the obstruction of the downward-moving wind.🔽In the external, the corpse transformed into a boar in the north, with the face of a boar, internally in the nostril of the left nostril, the obstruction of the life-wind.

original: bāhye bākārapariṇatam īśāne śav āsana yamadāḍhyā adhyātmani vāmakarṇanāḍyā prāṇanirodhaḥ /🔽bāhye sakārapariṇata śava vāyavye yamadūtyā adhyātmani dakṣiṇakarṇanāḍyā prāṇanirodhaḥ /
analyzed: bāhye bākāra pariṇatam īśāne adhyātmani vāma karṇa nāḍyā prāṇa nirodhaḥ  bāhye vāyavye yamadūtyā adhyātmani dakṣiṇa karṇa nāḍyā prāṇa nirodhaḥ
translated: In the external, the corpse transformed into a crow in the northeast, with the face of a crow, internally in the nostril of the left ear, the obstruction of the life-wind.🔽In the external, the corpse transformed into a jackal in the northwest, with the face of a jackal, internally in the nostril of the right ear, the obstruction of the life-wind.

original: bāhye ghokārapariṇata nairṛtye yamadaṣṭriṇyā adhyātmani dakṣiṇanetranāḍyā prāṇanirodhaḥ /
analyzed: bāhye nairṛtye yama daṣṭriṇyā adhyātmani dakṣiṇa netra nāḍyā prāṇa nirodhaḥ
translated: In the external, the corpse transformed into a vulture in the southwest, with the face of a vulture, internally in the nostril of the right eye, the obstruction of the life-wind.🔽In the external, the corpse transformed into a crow in the northeast, with the face of a crow, internally in the nostril of the left ear, the obstruction of the life-wind.

original: bāhye ukārapariṇatam āgneye yamamathanyā adhyātmani vāmanetranāḍyā prāṇavāyor nirodhaḥ /
analyzed: bāhye ukāra pariṇatam āgneye yamamathanyā adhyātmani vāmanetra nāḍyā prāṇa vāyoḥ nirodhaḥ
translated: Externally, the seat of the cremation ground is transformed into the letter U, in the southeast, the seat of Yama's slayer, and internally, the cessation of the life-force wind in the channel of the left eye.

original: ity aṣṭamahāśmaśānāsanāni kākāsyādīnā veditavyāni bāhye gaṇacakre //
analyzed: iti aṣṭa mahā śmaśāna āsanāni veditavyāni bāhye gaṇa cakre
translated: Thus, the seats of the eight great cremation grounds, beginning with the crow-faced one, should be known in the external wheel of the assembly.

original: idānī pracaṇḍādīnā sthānanāmādibījapariṇatāny āsanāny ucyante cittavākkāyacakre iha bāhye cittacakre pūrvāropari pūkārapari ṇata śavam
analyzed: idānī sthāna nāma ādi bīja pariṇatāni āsanāni ucyante citta vāc kāya cakre iha bāhye citta cakre
translated: Now, the seats that are transformed from the seed syllables of the names of the places of Pracanda and others are mentioned in the wheel of mind, speech, and body here, both externally and internally. In the external wheel of mind, on the seat of the east, the corpse transformed into the letter P

original: āsana pracaṇḍāyā adhyātmani dharmacakre pūrvaṇāḍyā prāṇanirodho nītārthena /
analyzed: adhyātmani dharmacakre pūrva nāḍyā prāṇa nirodhaḥ nīta arthena
translated: is the seat of Pracanda. Internally, in the wheel of Dharma, the cessation of the life-force wind in the eastern channel is the definitive meaning.

analyzed: neyārthena bāhye śirasi pūkāra nyāsaḥ iti
translated: The provisional meaning is the deposition of the letter P on the head externally.🔽Similarly, in the external wheel of the south, the corpse transformed into the letter J

original: eva bāhye dakṣiṇāre jākārapariṇata śavam caṇḍākṣyā adhyātmani dakṣiṇanāḍyā nirodhaḥ prāṇasyeti nītārthena /
analyzed: eva bāhye dakṣiṇa are caṇḍa akṣyā adhyātmani dakṣiṇa nāḍyā nirodhaḥ prāṇasya iti nīta arthena
translated: is the seat of Chandakshi. Internally, the cessation of the life-force wind in the southern channel is the definitive meaning.

analyzed: neya arthena śikhāyāḥ jākāra nyāsaḥ
translated: The provisional meaning is the deposition of the letter J in the tuft.

original: bāhye paścimāre okārapariṇata śava prabhāvatyā adhyātmani paścimanāḍyā prāṇanirodhaḥ /
analyzed: bāhye paścima are okāra pariṇata śava prabhāvatyā adhyātmani paścimanāḍyā prāṇa nirodhaḥ
translated: In the external wheel of the west, the corpse transformed into the letter O is the seat of Prabhava. Internally, the cessation of the life-force wind in the western channel.

analyzed: neya arthena dakṣiṇa karṇa ūrdhve okāra nyāsaḥ
translated: The provisional meaning is the deposition of the letter O above the right ear.

original: bāhye uttarāre akārapariṇata śava mahānāsāyā adhyātmani uttaraṇāḍyā prāṇanirodho hṛdaye dharmacakre neyārthena grīvāpṛṣṭhe akāranyāsaḥ
analyzed: bāhye uttarāre akāra pariṇata mahānāsāyāḥ adhyātmani uttaraṇāḍyā prāṇa nirodhaḥ hṛdaye dharmacakre neya arthena grīvā pṛṣṭhe akāra nyāsaḥ
translated: Externally, in the northern direction, the corpse transformed from the letter a is the great nose, internally, in the upward nāḍī, the restraint of breath is in the heart, in the dharmacakra, with the interpretable meaning, the placement of the letter a is on the neck and back.

analyzed: iti pīṭha bījanyāsaḥ
translated: Thus is the placement of the seed syllables of the seat.

original: tathā bāhye cittacakre īśānāre gokārapariṇata śava vīramatyā āsanam adhyātmani dharmacakre īśananāḍyā prāṇanirodhaḥ /
analyzed: tathā bāhye citta cakre īśānāre gokāra pariṇata āsanam adhyātmani dharma cakre īśananāḍyā prāṇa nirodhaḥ
translated: Similarly, externally, in the mind-cakra, in the Īśāna direction, the seat of the goddess Vīramati, the corpse transformed from the letter g, internally, in the dharmacakra, the restraint of breath is in the Īśaṇā nāḍī.

analyzed: neyārthena vāma karṇa ūrdhve gokāra nyāsaḥ
translated: With the interpretable meaning, the placement of the letter g is above the left ear.

original: bāhye vāyavyāre rākārapariṇata śava kharvaryā adhyātmani vāya vyanāḍyā prāṇanirodhaḥ /
analyzed: bāhye kharvaryā adhyātmani prāṇa nirodhaḥ
translated: Externally, in the Vāyu direction, the corpse transformed from the letter rā, internally, in the Vāyu nāḍī, the restraint of breath is in the Vāyu direction.

analyzed: neyārthena bhrū madhye rākāra nyāsaḥ
translated: With the interpretable meaning, the placement of the letter rā is between the eyebrows.

original: bāhye nairṛtyāre dekārapariṇata śava laṅkeśvaryā adhyātmani nairṛtyanāḍyā prāṇanirodhaḥ /
analyzed: bāhye nairṛtya are laṅkeśvaryā adhyātmani nairṛtyanāḍyā prāṇa nirodhaḥ
translated: Externally, in the Nairṛta direction, the corpse transformed from the letter de, internally, in the Nairṛta nāḍī, the restraint of breath is in the Nairṛta direction.

analyzed: neya arthena netra dvaye da ekāra nyāsaḥ
translated: With the interpretable meaning, the placement of the letter de is in the two eyes.

original: bāhye āgneyāre mākārapariṇata śava dru macchāyāyā adhyātmany āgneyanāḍyā prāṇanirodho dharmacakre /
analyzed: bāhye āgneya are mākāra pariṇata adhyātmani āgneya nāḍyā prāṇa nirodhaḥ dharmacakre
translated: Externally, in the Agni direction, the corpse transformed from the letter mā, internally, in the Agni nāḍī, the restraint of breath is in the dharmacakra, in the shade of the tree.

analyzed: ne ya arthena bāhumūle ma ākāra nyāsaḥ
translated: With the interpretable meaning, the placement of the letter mā is at the base of the arm.

analyzed: iti citta cakre upapīṭha devīnām āsa na niyamaḥ
translated: Thus, there is no fixed rule for the seat goddesses in the wheel of the mind.

original: tato bāhye vākcakre 'dhyātmani sabhogacakre bāhyaparimaṇ ḍale dvātriśannāḍyo 'bhyantaraparimaṇḍale 'ṣṭanāḍyo yathā dharmacakre tathātraivāsanāny 🔽ucyante /
analyzed: tatas bāhye vākcakre dhī ātmani sa bhogacakre bāhya parimaṇ ḍale dvātriśat nāḍyaḥ bhyantara parimaṇḍale ṣṭa nāḍyaḥ yathā dharmacakre tathā atra eva āsanāni  ucyante
translated: Then, in the external speech wheel, in the enjoyment wheel internally, in the external circle there are thirty-two channels, in the internal circle eight channels, as in the Dharma wheel, here the seats are mentioned.

original: bāhye vākcakre pūrvāre kākārapariṇata śavam āsanam airāvatyā adhyātmani sabho gacakre 'bhyantaraparimaṇḍale pūrvanāḍyā prāṇanirodhaḥ /
analyzed: bāhye vāc cakre pūrvāre ka ākāra pariṇata śavam āsanam airāvatyāḥ adhyātmani sabhaḥ ga cakre bhyantara parimaṇḍale pūrva nāḍyā prāṇa nirodhaḥ
translated: In the external speech wheel, in the eastern quarter, the seat transformed from the letter ka is the corpse, the seat of Airavatī. Internally, in the enjoyment wheel, in the eastern channel, the breath is restrained.

analyzed: neyārthena kakṣa dvaye ka akāra nyāsaḥ
translated: By the interpretable meaning, the placement of the letter ka is in the two armpits.

original: bāhye dakṣiṇāre okāraparinata śava mahābhairavāyā adhyātmani dakṣiṇanāḍyā prāṇanirodhaḥ /
analyzed: bāhye dakṣiṇa are okāra parinata mahābhairavāyāḥ adhyātmani dakṣiṇa nāḍyā prāṇa nirodhaḥ
translated: In the external speech wheel, in the southern quarter, the seat transformed from the letter o is the corpse, the seat of Mahābhairava. Internally, in the southern channel, the breath is restrained.

analyzed: neyārthena stana yugalayoḥ okāra nyāsaḥ
translated: By the interpretable meaning, the placement of the letter o is in the two breasts.

original: bāhye paścimāre trikārapariṇata śava vāyuvegāyā adhyātmani paścimanāḍyā prāṇanirodhaḥ /
analyzed: bāhye adhyātmani paścima nāḍyā prāṇa nirodhaḥ
translated: In the external speech wheel, in the western quarter, the seat transformed from the letter tri is the corpse, the seat of Vāyuvegā. Internally, in the western channel, the breath is restrained.

analyzed: neyārthe na nābhyā tri kāra nyāsaḥ
translated: By the interpretable meaning, the placement of the letter tri is in the navel.

original: bāhye uttarāre kokārapariṇata śava surābhakṣyāyā adhyātmany uttaranāḍyā prāṇanirodhaḥ /
analyzed: bāhye uttarāre surā bhakṣyāyāḥ adhyātmani uttaranāḍyā prāṇa nirodhaḥ
translated: Externally, in the northern quarter, the corpse transformed from the letter ko is the seat of Surabhakṣyā. Internally, the cessation of the vital breath in the northern channel.

original: neyārthena nāsikāgre kokāranyāsaḥ iti kṣetropakṣetradevīnām āsana bījanyāso vākcakre /
analyzed: neyārthena nāsikā agre kokāra nyāsaḥ iti kṣetra upakṣetra devīnām āsana bīja nyāsaḥ vākcakre
translated: According to the interpretable meaning, the deposition of the letter ko at the tip of the nose. The seat deposition of the goddesses of the field and the subsidiary field is in the wheel of speech.

original: eva bāhye īśānāre kakārapariṇata śavam āsana śyāmādevyā adhyātmani kaṇṭacakre iśānanāḍyā prā ṇanirodhaḥ /
analyzed: eva bāhye īśāna are kakāra pariṇata śyāmā devyāḥ adhyātmani kaṇṭa cakre iśāna nāḍyā prāṇa nirodhaḥ
translated: Thus, externally, in the northeastern quarter, the corpse transformed from the letter ka is the seat of the goddess Śyāmā. Internally, the cessation of the vital breath in the northeastern channel in the wheel of the throat.

analyzed: neyārthena mukhe kakāra nyāsaḥ
translated: According to the interpretable meaning, the deposition of the letter ka in the mouth.

original: bāhye vāyavyāre lakā rapariṇata śava subhadrāyā adhyātmani vāyavyānāḍyā prāṇanirodhaḥ /
analyzed: bāhye vāyavya are subhadrāyāḥ adhyātmani vāyavyānāḍyā prāṇa nirodhaḥ
translated: Externally, in the northwestern quarter, the corpse transformed from the letter la is the seat of Subhadrā. Internally, the cessation of the vital breath in the northwestern channel.

analyzed: neyārthena kaṇṭhe lakāra nyāsaḥ
translated: According to the interpretable meaning, the deposition of the letter la in the throat.

original: bāhye nairṛtyāre kākāra pariṇata śava hayakarṇāyā adhyātmani nairṛtyanāḍyā prāṇanirodhaḥ /
analyzed: bāhye nairṛtya are kākāra pariṇata śava hayakarṇāyāḥ adhyātmani nairṛtyanāḍyā prāṇa nirodhaḥ
translated: Externally, in the southwestern quarter, the corpse transformed from the letter ka is the seat of Hayakarṇā. Internally, the cessation of the vital breath in the southwestern channel.

analyzed: neyārthena hṛdaye ka akāra nyāsaḥ
translated: According to the interpretable meaning, the deposition of the letter ka in the heart.

original: bāhye āgneyāre hikārapariṇata śavam āsana khagānanāyā adhyātmany āgneyanāḍyā prāṇavāyor nirodhaḥ /
analyzed: bāhye āgneya are hikāra pariṇata adhyātmani āgneya nāḍyā prāṇa vāyoḥ nirodhaḥ
translated: Externally, in the southeastern quarter, the corpse transformed from the letter hi is the seat of Khaganānā. Internally, the cessation of the vital breath in the southeastern channel.

analyzed: neyārthena meḍhre hikāra nyāsaḥ
translated: According to the interpretable meaning, the deposition of the letter hi in the genitals.

analyzed: iti chandohopachan doha ḍākinīnām āsana bījanyāsaḥ sabhoga vākcakre
translated: Thus is the seat, seed, and assignment of the goddesses of the outer and inner mandalas of the Bhaga, in the Bhaga-cakra with enjoyment.🔽Thus is the rule of the seat of the goddesses of the outer and inner mandalas of the Kshetra and Upaksetra, in the Kshetra-cakra with enjoyment.

original: eva kṣetropakṣetrachandohopachandohadevīnām āsananiyamaḥ tataḥ kāyacakre bāhye 'dhyātmani lalāṭe sahajacakre bāhye parimaṇḍale ṣoḍaśanāḍyo
analyzed: eva kṣetra upakṣetra chandoha upachandoha devīnām āsana niyamaḥ tatas kāya cakre bāhye dhī ātmani lalāṭe sahaja cakre bāhye parimaṇḍale ṣoḍaśa nāḍyaḥ
translated: Then, in the outer and inner body-cakra, in the forehead, in the innate-cakra, in the outer circle, there are sixteen channels,

analyzed: bhyantara parimaṇḍale ṣṭa nāḍyaḥ yathā sa bhoga cakre tathā atra eva āsanāni ucyante
translated: in the inner circle, there are eight channels. As in the Bhaga-cakra with enjoyment, here the seats are mentioned.

original: iha bāhye kāyacakre pūrvāropari prekā rapariṇata śavam āsana cakravegāyā adhyātmani sahajacakre 'bhyanta raparimaṇḍale pūrvanāḍyā prāṇavāyor
analyzed: iha bāhye kāya cakre pūrva āra upari adhyātmani sahaja cakre bhyanta ra parimaṇḍale pūrva nāḍyā prāṇa vāyoḥ
translated: Here, in the outer body-cakra, on the eastern petal, the corpse transformed into Pre is the seat of Chakravega. In the inner innate-cakra, in the inner circle, by stopping the life-wind in the eastern channel,

analyzed: nirodhaḥ
translated: the life-wind is stopped.

original: neyārthena liṅge prekāranyāsaḥ /🔽bāhye dakṣiṇāre gṛkārapariṇata śava khaṇḍarohāyā adhyātmani dakṣiṇanāḍyā prāṇanirodhaḥ ne yārthena gude gṛkāranyāsaḥ /
analyzed: neyārthena liṅge prekāra nyāsaḥ  bāhye dakṣiṇāre adhyātmani dakṣiṇa nāḍyā prāṇa nirodhaḥ gude gṛkāra nyāsaḥ
translated: By the interpretable meaning, the Pre-syllable is assigned to the genitals.🔽In the outer southern petal, the piece of the corpse transformed into Gri is the seat of Khandaroha. In the inner southern channel, the life-wind is stopped. By the interpretable meaning, the Gri-syllable is assigned to the anus.

original: bāhye paścimāre saukārapariṇata śava śauṇḍinyā adhyātmani paścimanāḍyā prāṇavāyor nirodhaḥ /
analyzed: bāhye paścima are adhyātmani paścima nāḍyā prāṇa vāyoḥ nirodhaḥ
translated: In the outer western petal, the corpse transformed into Sau is the seat of Shoundini. In the inner western channel, the life-wind is stopped.

analyzed: neyārthena ūru yugale saukāra nyāsaḥ
translated: The deposition of the syllable SAU is on the two thighs with the interpretable meaning.

original: bāhye uttarāre sukārapari ṇata śava cakravarmiṇyā adhyātmany uttaranāḍyā prāṇanirodhaḥ /
analyzed: bāhye uttarāre cakravarmiṇyā adhyātmani uttaranāḍyā prāṇa nirodhaḥ
translated: The restraint of the vital breath in the northern channel internally, and the syllable SU transformed into a circular armor externally in the northern direction,

analyzed: neyārthena jaṅghā dvaye sukāra nyāsaḥ
translated: The deposition of the syllable SU is on the two shanks with the interpretable meaning.

analyzed: iti melāpaka upamelāpaka dūtinām āsana bījanyāsaḥ kāyacakre
translated: Thus, the deposition of the seed syllables of the seats in the body mandala of the messengers who are the companions and non-companions.

original: tata iha bāhye iśānāre nakārapa riṇata śavam āsana suvīrāyā adhyātmanīśānanāḍyā prāṇani rodho nītārthena /
analyzed: tatas iha bāhye iśānāre śavam suvīrāyāḥ adhyātmani īśāna nāḍyā prāṇani rodhaḥ nīta arthena
translated: Then, externally in the northeastern direction, the restraint of the vital breath in the northeastern channel internally, and the syllable NA transformed into a circular seat of the great heroine, with the definitive meaning.

analyzed: neyārthena pāda aṅgulīṣu nakāra nyāsaḥ
translated: The deposition of the syllable NA is on the toes with the interpretable meaning.

original: bāhye vāyavyāre sikārapariṇata śava mahābalāyā adhyātmani vyāyavya ṇāḍyā prāṇanirodhaḥ /
analyzed: bāhye vāyavyāre sikāra pariṇata adhyātmani prāṇa nirodhaḥ
translated: The restraint of the vital breath in the northwestern channel internally, and the syllable SI transformed into a circular seat of the greatly powerful one externally in the northwestern direction,

analyzed: neyārthena pāda pṛṣṭhayoḥ sikāra nyāsaḥ
translated: The deposition of the syllable SI is on the soles of the feet with the interpretable meaning.

original: bā hye nairṛtyāre makārapariṇata śava cakravartinyā adhyātmani nair ṛtyanāḍyām prāṇavāyor nirodhaḥ /
analyzed: cakravartinyāḥ adhyātmani naiḥ ṛtyanāḍyām prāṇa vāyoḥ nirodhaḥ
translated: The restraint of the vital breath in the southern channel internally, and the syllable MA transformed into a circular seat of the universal monarch externally in the southern direction,

analyzed: neyārthena pādāṅguṣṭhayoḥ makāḥ ra nyāsaḥ
translated: The deposition of the syllable MA is on the big toes with the interpretable meaning.

original: bāhye āgneyāre kukārapariṇata śavam āsana mahāviryāyā adhyātmany āgneyanāḍyā prāṇanirodhaḥ /
analyzed: bāhye āgneya are kukāra pariṇata śavam adhyātmani āgneya nāḍyā prāṇa nirodhaḥ
translated: Externally, in the southeast quarter, the seat of the cremation ground is the transformation of the syllable KU, and internally, in the southeast channel, the suspension of the breath.

original: neyārthena jānudvaye kukārabījanyāsaḥ /🔽iti śmaśānopaśmaśānadevīnām āsanabī janyāsaḥ kāyacakre /
analyzed: neyārthena jānu dvaye kukāra bīja nyāsaḥ  iti śmaśāna upaśmaśāna devīnām janyāsaḥ kāya cakre
translated: The meaning of the text is that the syllable KU should be placed on the two knees.🔽Thus, the placement of the seed syllables for the seats of the goddesses of the cremation grounds and neighboring cremation grounds is in the body mandala.

original: eva melāpakopamelāpakaśmaśānopaśmaśā navāsinīnām āsananiyamaḥ kāyacakre /🔽iha yathā bāhya pretavāhanāni ḍākinīnā pīṭhādigamanārtha tathādhyātmani sarvadhātūnā prāṇavāyuvāhanam iti /
analyzed: eva melāpaka upamelāpaka śmaśāna upaśmaśā na vāsinīnām āsana niyamaḥ kāya cakre  iha yathā bāhya preta vāhanāni ḍākinīnā pīṭha ādi gamana artha tathā adhyātmani sarva dhātūnā prāṇa vāyu vāhanam iti
translated: This is the rule for the seats of the goddesses who dwell in the cremation grounds and neighboring cremation grounds, which are like a gathering and a partial gathering, in the body mandala.🔽Just as externally the corpses are the mounts for the female spirits in order to go to the sacred seats and so on, in the same way internally all the elements are the mounts for the life wind.

original: yathā bāhye gaṇamelāpake svasvacakrāreṣu śavāsanānā sthitis tathādhyātmani prāṇavāyūnā svasvacakranāḍyā sthitiḥ kumbhakayogeneti nītārthaḥ
analyzed: yathā bāhye gaṇa melāpake sva sva cakra āreṣu sthitiḥ tathā adhyātmani prāṇa vāyūnā sva sva cakranāḍyā sthitiḥ kumbhaka yogena iti nīta arthaḥ
translated: Just as in the external gathering of the assembly the corpses are situated in their own wheel quarters, in the same way internally the life winds are situated in their own wheel channels through the yoga of breath retention. This is the explicit meaning.

original: iha bāhye gaṇacakre ṣaṭtriśaddūtīnā naracarmaśavaviśuddhyā uktabī jākṣaraiḥ saptavārān abhimantrayitvā svasvasthāṇesu deyam āsa nam /
analyzed: iha bāhye gaṇa cakre ṣaṭtriśat dūtīnām nara carma śava viśuddhyā ukta bī ja akṣaraiḥ sapta vārān abhimantrayitvā sva sva sthāṇesu deyam
translated: Here, in the external assembly wheel, the thirty-six messengers should be given their seats in their own places, having been empowered seven times with the syllables of the seed syllables spoken of by the purification of the human skin corpse.

original: eva āsanavidhiḥ prabhoḥ prajñāyāś ca gocaramavyāghrājina madhye /
analyzed: eva āsana vidhiḥ prabhoḥ prajñāyāḥ ca madhye
translated: Such is the rule for the seat of the Lord and the sphere of wisdom, in the middle of the tiger-skin.

original: iha pracaṇḍādīnā ḍākinyādīnā ca svanāmādibījenotpādo gaṇacakre /
analyzed: iha pracaṇḍa ādīnām ḍākinī ādīnām ca sva nāma ādi bījena utpādaḥ gaṇa cakre
translated: Here, in the circle of the assembly, the Prachandas and others, and the Dakinis and others, are produced from their own seed syllables beginning with their names.

original: tena tenaiva bījenābhimantrya sthānāt sthānasacāraḥ karta vya iti sarvatantreṣu niyamaḥ //
analyzed: tena tena eva bījena abhimantrya sthānāt sthāna sacāraḥ karta vyaḥ iti sarva tantreṣu niyamaḥ
translated: By that very seed syllable, the movement from place to place should be done, consecrated. This is the rule in all the Tantras.

original: Chapter X The Pills of Secret Elements idānī mukhādiśuddhyartha samayaguḍikocyate /
analyzed: chapter xc the pills of secret elements idānīm mukha ādi śuddhi artha samayaguḍikā ucyate
translated: Now, the time-pill is told for the purification of the mouth and so on.

original: ihākāśādyekaikaguṇavṛddhibhedena pañcāmṛtāni pañcapradīpā grāhyā yadā candrārkayor ekamāse grahaṇa bhavati /
analyzed: iha ākāśa ādi eka eka guṇa vṛddhi bhedena pañca amṛtāni pañca pradīpāḥ grāhyāḥ yadā candra arkayoḥ eka māse bhavati
translated: Here, the five nectars and the five lamps should be taken in the distinction of the increase of each quality beginning with space, when there is an eclipse of the moon and sun in one month.

original: prathama candrasya paścāt sūryasya tasmin māse na prathama sūryasya paścāc can drasya tatra māse /
analyzed: prathama candrasya paścāt sūryasya tasmin māse na prathama sūryasya paścāt can drasya tatra māse
translated: And when it is first of the moon and then of the sun in that month, not first of the sun and then of the moon, then in that month.

original: iha candragrahaṇe pratipatpraveśakāle 'prasūtā dvā daśavarṣakanyā śoḍaśavārṣikā vā gaurī sarvopakaraṇaiḥ pūjayitvā devatālambana kṛtvā
analyzed: iha candra grahaṇe pratipad praveśa kāle prasūtā dvā daśa varṣa kanyā vā gaurī sarva upakaraṇaiḥ pūjayitvā kṛtvā
translated: And here, in the lunar eclipse, at the time of the entry of the first lunar day, an unmarried girl of twelve years or a sixteen-year-old girl, worshipped with all the requisites as Gauri, having made the deity the support,

original: padme vajra prakṣipya huphaṭkāreṇa bodhicittam utsṛjet /
analyzed: padme vajra prakṣipya huphaṭkāreṇa bodhi cittam utsṛjet
translated: Having placed the lotus in the vajra, one should emit the bodhicitta with the syllable hūṃ.

original: utsṛjya cādhaḥ padmabhājana dattvā vajreṇākaṭya tatra padmabhāṇḍe kṣipet /
analyzed: utsṛjya ca adhas dattvā vajreṇa ākaṭya tatra padma bhāṇḍe kṣipet
translated: Having emitted it, having given the lotus vessel below, having struck it with the vajra, one should throw it into the lotus vessel.

original: dvitīyāyā mṛtakasya pūjā kṛtvā majjā grāhyā /
analyzed: dvitīyāyāḥ mṛtakasya pūjā kṛtvā majjā grāhyā
translated: Having made an offering to the second corpse, one should take the marrow.

original: tṛtīyāyā gauranāryāḥ pūjā kṛtvā rajasvalāyā ratnasabhavo grāhyaḥ /
analyzed: tṛtīyāyāḥ gauḥ anāryāḥ pūjā kṛtvā rajasvalāyāḥ ratna sabhavaḥ grāhyaḥ
translated: Having made an offering to the third, a white woman, one should take the menstrual blood of a menstruating woman.

analyzed: caturthyā svakīya vajrodaka grāhyam
translated: On the fourth day, one should take one's own vajra water.

analyzed: pañcayā viś grāhyam
translated: On the fifth day, one should take the urine.

original: eva māṣakam eka śukrasya māṣakadvaya majjāyā māṣa katraya ratnasabhavasya māṣakacatuṣṭaya vajrodakasya māṣa kapañcaka vairocanasya
analyzed: eva māṣakam eka śukrasya māṣaka dvaya majjāyāḥ māṣa ka traya ratnasabhavasya māṣaka catuṣṭaya vajrodakasya māṣa ka pañcaka vairocanasya
translated: Thus, one part of semen, two parts of marrow, three parts of menstrual blood, four parts of vajra water, and five parts of Vairocana

original: evam ākāśavāyutejaudakapṛthvīnām ekadvitricatuṣpañcaguṇavṛddhibhedena pañcadinaiḥ pañcadravyāṇi grāhyānīti /
analyzed: evam ākāśa vāyu teja audaka pṛthvīnām eka dvi tri catuṣpañca guṇa vṛddhi bhedena pañca dinaiḥ pañca dravyāṇi grāhyāni iti
translated: should be taken in five days by the distinction of the increase of five, ten, fifteen, twenty, and twenty-five parts for space, air, fire, water, and earth.

original: tataḥ ṣaṣṭhyā mṛtakasya pūjā kṛtvā naramāsa grāhyam /
analyzed: tatas ṣaṣṭhyā mṛtakasya pūjā kṛtvā nara māsa grāhyam
translated: Then, on the sixth day, having made an offering to the corpse, one should take human flesh.

original: saptamyā hayamāsam aṣṭamyā dantimāsa navamyā kukkuramāsa daśamyā gomāsam /
analyzed: saptamyā haya māsam aṣṭamyā danti māsa navamyā kukkura māsa daśamyā go māsam
translated: On the seventh day, horse flesh, on the eighth day, elephant flesh, on the ninth day, dog flesh, and on the tenth day, cow flesh.

analyzed: eka akṣa mātra dvi akṣa mātra tri akṣā mātra catur akṣa mātra pañca akṣa mātram
translated: One eye measure, two eye measures, three eye measures, four eye measures, five eye measures.

original: yathānukrameṇa pradīpa gṛhītvā pañcāmṛtenaikīkṛtya pañcasapta timāṣakān /
analyzed: yathā anukrameṇa pradīpa gṛhītvā pañcāmṛtena ekīkṛtya pañca sapta ti māṣakān
translated: As in the sequence, taking the lamp, making it one with the five nectars, with five and seventy māṣas.

original: tato 'mṛtamakṣikābhiḥ pañcadaśabhiḥ sārdham abhuktenai kādaśyā yatheṣṭa mādhvī gauḍī drākṣī vā tālādivṛkṣajā vā
analyzed: tatas mṛta makṣikābhiḥ pañcadaśabhiḥ sārdham abhuktena e kādaśyā yathā iṣṭa mādhvī gauḍī drākṣī vā tāla ādi vṛkṣa jā vā
translated: Then, with fifteen nectar flies, on the eleventh day without eating, drinking as desired honey wine, cane wine, grape wine, or wine from palm trees,

original: dhānayajā vā paiṣṭhim vā madirā pītvā 🔽chardayet /
analyzed: dhānayajā vā paiṣṭhim vā madirā pītvā  chardayet
translated: or from rice, or madhīra wine, one should vomit.

original: tayā chardyā kapālagṛhītayā tāni pañcasaptatimāṣakātmakāni daśadravyāṇi pīṣayet /
analyzed: tayā chardyā kapāla gṛhītayā tāni pañca saptati māṣaka ātmakāni daśa dravyāṇi pīṣayet
translated: With that vomit, taken in a skull, one should grind those ten substances consisting of five and seventy māṣas.

original: tataḥ sṛgālakhallā gṛhītvā tanmadhye nikṣipet /🔽tataḥ kapā la sapuṭa kṛtvā tasminn eva rātrisamaye śmaśānabhūmyā mṛtana reṇa sārdha yā nārī vahni praviṣṭā taddagdhabhūmitale hastam
analyzed: tatas sṛgāla khallāḥ gṛhītvā tad madhye nikṣipet  tatas kṛtvā tasmin eva rātri samaye śmaśāna bhūmyā sārdha yā nārī vahni praviṣṭā tad dagdha bhūmi tale hastam
translated: Then, taking a jackal's testicles, one should place them in the middle.

original: eka khanitvā trikoṇa tatra gandhadhūpādibhiḥ prapūjayitvā mahodārā bali datvā 'nena mantravidhānena /
analyzed: eka khanitvā trikoṇa tatra gandha dhūpa ādibhiḥ prapūjayitvā nena mantra vidhānena
translated: Then, having made a skull-case, on that very night, on the cremation ground, with a woman who has entered the fire together with a dead man, having dug a hand-span into that burnt ground, having worshipped there with perfumes, incense, and so on, having offered a very generous bali with this mantra method,

original: o vajrakrodheśvari sarvadravyāṇi viśodhaya hū phaṭ /
analyzed: o vajrakrodheśvari sarva dravyāṇi viśodhaya hū phaṭ
translated: O Vajra Goddess of Wrath, purify all substances, Hūṃ Phaṭ.

analyzed: iti bali śodhana mantraḥ
translated: This is the mantra for purifying the bali offering.

original: āyāntu buddhāḥ pitaraḥ samātaraḥ saputrabhṛtyaiḥ saha bandhuvargaiḥ /
analyzed: āyāntu buddhāḥ pitaraḥ sa mātaraḥ sa putra bhṛtyaiḥ saha bandhu vargaiḥ
translated: May the Buddhas, Fathers, Mothers, Sons, Servants, and groups of relatives come,🔽Surrounded by the complete assemblies of gods and divine beings,

analyzed: vṛtāḥ samagrāḥ sura devatā gaṇaiḥ santoṣyamāṇāḥ vara vajra sattvam
translated: Being satisfied by the excellent Vajra Being.

analyzed: iti sarva tathāgata āvāhanam
translated: This is the invocation of all Tathagatas.

original: o śrīheruka ākaṭṭaya ākaṭṭaya praveśaya praveśaya bandhaya bandhaya toṣaya toṣaya sarvaḍākinīnā hṛdaya jaḥ hū va hoḥ hū phaṭ /
analyzed: o śrī heruka ākaṭṭaya ākaṭṭaya praveśaya praveśaya bandhaya bandhaya toṣaya toṣaya sarva ḍākinīnām hṛdaya jaḥ hū va hoḥ hū phaṭ
translated: O Śrī Heruka, strike, strike, bring in, bring in, bind, bind, satisfy, satisfy, the hearts of all ḍākinīs, Jaḥ Hūṃ Vaṃ Hoḥ Hūṃ Phaṭ.

analyzed: iti ḍākinī ākarṣaṇa mantraḥ
translated: This is the mantra for attracting the ḍākinīs.

original: o sumbha nisumbha hu hū phaṭ /
analyzed: o sumbha nisumbha hu hū phaṭ
translated: O Sumbha Nisumbha Hu Hūṃ Phaṭ.

original: o gṛhṇa gṛhṇa hu hū phaṭ /
analyzed: o gṛhṇa gṛhṇa hu hū phaṭ
translated: O Grasp Grasp Hu Hūṃ Phaṭ.

original: o gṛhṇāpaya gṛhṇāpaya hu hū phaṭ o ānaya ho bhagavān vajravidyā rāja hu hū phaṭ /
analyzed: o gṛhṇāpaya gṛhṇāpaya hu hū phaṭ o ānaya ho bhagavān vajravidyā rāja hu hū phaṭ
translated: O Make Them Grasp Make Them Grasp Hu Hūṃ Phaṭ O Bring Him Ho Blessed One Vajravidyārāja Hu Hūṃ Phaṭ.

analyzed: iti bali dāna matraḥ
translated: This is the mantra for offering the bali.

analyzed: tatas ṛgha pādya ādika da tvā
translated: Then, having given the argha, pādya, and so forth,

original: o śrīvajra he he ru ru ka hu hū phaḍ ḍākinījālasavara svāhā /
analyzed: o śrī vajra he he ru ru ka hu hū phaṭ ḍākinī jāla sa vara svāhā
translated: O Śrī Vajra He He Ru Ru Ka Hu Hūṃ Phaṭ Ḍākinī Jāla Svara Svāhā.

original: anena mantreṇāṣṭottaraśatavāram abhimantrya tasyā gartāyā nikṣipet /
analyzed: anena mantreṇa aṣṭottaraśata vāram tasyāḥ gartāyāḥ nikṣipet
translated: Having enchanted with this mantra one hundred and eight times, one should throw it into that pit.

analyzed: citi bhasmānā gartā pūrayet mūrddhni
translated: One should fill the pit with the ashes of the funeral pyre on the head.

analyzed: mahā asi dadyāt
translated: One should give a great gift.

analyzed: o vajravairocanīye svāhā
translated: O Vajra Vairochani, svāhā.

original: ity anena mantreṇa raksā kṛtvā svagṛham āgatya catuḥsadhyāsu caturvaktramantra japed dvāda śyām /
analyzed: iti anena mantreṇa raksā kṛtvā sva gṛham āgatya catur sadhyāsu caturvaktra mantra japet dvādaśyām
translated: Having done protection with this mantra, having come to one's own house, one should recite the four-faced mantra in the four periods, twelve times.

analyzed: aṣṭapadika trayodaśyām
translated: On the thirteenth, the eight-line.

analyzed: caturviśati padika caturda śyā ca
translated: On the fourteenth, the twenty-four-line.

original: tato 'māvāsyāyā sūryagrahaṇe uddhṛtya naravasayā mudgapramāṇāḥ gulikāḥ kuryāt /
analyzed: tatas māvāsyāyāḥ sūrya grahaṇe uddhṛtya nara vasayā mudga pramāṇāḥ gulikāḥ kuryāt
translated: Then, on the new moon day, at the time of the solar eclipse, one should make pills the size of kidney beans from human fat.

original: tayā gulikayā khānapānādi ka kuṇḍagolakobhavena sārdha prokṣita viśuddha bhavati /
analyzed: tayā gulikayā sārdha prokṣita viśuddha bhavati
translated: By that pill, food, drink, etc. become pure, as if offered by a pure person.

analyzed: mukhe prakṣiptayā mukha viśuddhiḥ bhavati
translated: By inserting it into the mouth, the mouth becomes pure.

analyzed: gaṇacakre bhāvanā kāle pi sarva rakṣā bhavati
translated: At the time of meditation in the circle of the assembly, all protection is accomplished.

analyzed: iti gulikā vidhi niyamaḥ
translated: Thus ends the rule of the pill method.

original: Chapter XI Food and Drink in the gaṇacakra idānī mahāgaṇacakre pūrvoktānā ḍombyādiśūdrādīnā ṣaṭtrisatkuladūtīnā khānapānavidhir ucyate
analyzed: chapter xi food and drink in the gaṇacakra idānīm mahāgaṇacakre pūrva uktānā ḍombī ādi śūdra ādīnā ṣaṣ tri sat kula dūtīnā khāna pāna vidhiḥ ucyate
translated: Chapter 11: Food and Drink in the Gaṇa Cakra Now, in the Great Gaṇa Cakra, the method of eating and drinking for the six, thirty, and twenty-four female messengers of the low castes such as Dombī and the Śūdra castes is described.

original: iha vijane gṛhe suguptasthāne sarvāḥ kuladūtyo vivastrāś caturviśati sādhakāś ca pañcamudrāvibhūṣitāḥ svasvasthāne muktakeśāyoginyaḥ /
analyzed: iha vijane gṛhe su gupta sthāne sarvāḥ kula dūtyaḥ vivastrāḥ caturviśati sādhakāḥ ca pañcamudrā vibhūṣitāḥ sva sva sthāne muktakeśā yoginyaḥ
translated: Here, in an isolated house in a well-hidden place, all the female messengers should be naked, and the twenty-four practitioners should be adorned with the five mudrās, the yoginīs with loose hair in their respective places.

analyzed: sādhakāḥ baddha jūṭakāḥ
translated: The practitioners should have their hair tied up.

analyzed: nara carma upari niṣaṇṇāḥ
translated: They should be seated on human skin.

analyzed: gaṇa adhipatiḥ gaḥ vyāghra carma upari madhye cakrasya
translated: The Lord of the Gaṇa is in the middle of the circle on the skin of a cow and a tiger.

original: tato naracarmaṇā hastamātrapattali kā kṛtvā gaṇanāyakasya dadyāt /
analyzed: tatas nara carmaṇā hasta mātra pattali kā kṛtvā gaṇanāyakasya dadyāt
translated: Then, having made a human skin fan measuring one handspan, it should be given to the Lord of the Gaṇa.

original: pūrvayoginīnā hayacarmapattalikā dakṣiṇayoginīnā kukkuracarmapattalikā paścimayoginīnā hasticarma pattalikām uttarayoginīnā gocarmapattalikā
analyzed: pūrva yoginīnām haya carma pattalikā dakṣiṇa yoginīnām kukkura carma pattalikā paścima yoginīnām hasti carma pattalikā uttara yoginīnām go carma pattalikā
translated: For the yoginīs of the east, a horse skin fan should be given, for the yoginīs of the south, a dog skin fan, for the yoginīs of the west, an elephant skin fan, and for the yoginīs of the north, a cow skin fan.

analyzed: dadyāt
translated: It should be given.

original: iśānayogi nīnā gavalacarmapattalikā vāyavyayoginīnā kharacarmapattalikā nairṛtyayoginīnā sṛgālacarmapattalikām āgneyayaginīnām uṣṭracarmapat 🔽talikā datvā /
analyzed: iśāna yogi gavala carma pattalikā vāyavya yoginīnām khara carma pattalikā nairṛtya yoginīnām sṛgāla carma pattalikām āgneya yaginīnām uṣṭra carma pat  talikāḥ da tvā
translated: and the Varuna Yoginis a mat of elephant hide.

original: tataḥ svakulamṛtakānā kapālam ekakhaṇḍa dvikhaṇḍa trikhaṇḍa vā yathālabdha yoginīnā dadyāt pānārtham /
analyzed: tatas sva kula mṛtakānā kapālam eka khaṇḍa dvi khaṇḍa tri khaṇḍa vā yathālabdha yoginīnā dadyāt pāna artham
translated: Then, for the Yoginis, he should give a skull bowl, either one-piece, two-piece, or three-piece, as obtained, for drinking.

original: tataḥ khāna pattalikāyā datvā pāna padmabhājane datvā sādha kas triḥ pradakṣiṇa kṛtvā gandhapuṣpadhūpādibhiḥ pūjayitvā adhyeṣayet /
analyzed: tatas kaḥ tris pradakṣiṇa kṛtvā gandha puṣpa dhūpa ādibhiḥ pūjayitvā adhyeṣayet
translated: Then, having given the mat, having given the drinking lotus vessel, the practitioner should circumambulate three times, having worshipped with incense, flowers, incense, and so on, he should request.

analyzed: tatas pariṇāmayet
translated: Then he should dedicate.

original: anena puṇyena sarvasattvā ma hāmudrājñānalābhino bhavantv iti /
analyzed: anena puṇyena sarva sattvāḥ ma hāmudrā jñāna lābhinaḥ bhavantu iti
translated: By this merit, may all beings attain the knowledge of the great seal.

analyzed: idam gaṇacakra rājñā kartavyam
translated: This ganachakra should be performed by the king.

analyzed: sāmānyaiḥ mantra balena devatā niyamena vā
translated: Either by the power of the general mantras or by the restriction of the deity.

analyzed: bhavati sādhakānām
translated: Otherwise, there is a fault for the practitioners.

original: sāmāya gaṇacakra deśakulavyavahāreṇa kartavyam puṇyasabhārārtha svagṛhe paripācitābhiḥ kulavadhūbhiḥ /
analyzed: deśa kula vyavahāreṇa kartavyam puṇya sabhā rārtha sva gṛhe paripācitābhiḥ kula vadhūbhiḥ
translated: The ganachakra should be performed by the women of good families who have been ripened in one's own home for the sake of accumulating merit.

analyzed: anyathā gaṇacakra na bhavati
translated: Otherwise, it is not the gaṇacakra.

analyzed: prajñā upāya sukhena vinā
translated: Without the bliss of wisdom and means,

original: maithunabodhicittāsvādanena rahita khānapānena kevalena vīrabhojyam ucyate na gaṇacakram /
analyzed: maithuna bodhi citta āsvādanena vīra bhojyam ucyate na gaṇa cakram
translated: without the enjoyment of sexual union and bodhicitta, the hero's feast is said to be without the gaṇacakra.

analyzed: tat eva ācārya pramukha kartavyam upāsakaiḥ
translated: That very thing should be done by the preceptor and the lay followers.

original: ācāryo 'pi mantranaye trividhaḥ gṛhasthaś cellako bhikṣur adhamamadhyamottamaḥ //
analyzed: ācāryaḥ pi mantra naye trividhaḥ gṛhasthaḥ cellakaḥ bhikṣuḥ adhama madhyama uttamaḥ
translated: The preceptor is also of three kinds in the mantra system: if a householder, a celibate, or a monk, he is inferior, middling, or superior.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

original: gṛhastho daśatattvaparijñātāpy abhiṣikto 'nujñāto 'pi tulyo na bha vati /
analyzed: gṛhasthaḥ abhiṣiktaḥ tulyaḥ na bha vati
translated: Even though a householder knows the ten principles, even though he is consecrated, he is not equal to one who is permitted.

original: tantre bhagavatoktavacanāt /🔽tayor dvayor gṛhasthacellakayor vyā khyānakāle gurukṛtayor api vratadharair bhikṣubhiḥ saddharmādīn puraskṛtya vandanā kartavyā nānyasmin
analyzed: tantre bhagavatā ukta vacanāt  tayoḥ dvayoḥ gṛhastha cellakayoḥ khyāna kāle gurukṛtayoḥ api vrata dharaiḥ bhikṣubhiḥ saddharma ādīn puraskṛtya vandanā kartavyā na anyasmin  /
translated: Because it is said by the Blessed One in the tantra.

analyzed: kāle vyākhyāna rahite
translated: For those two, the householder and the celibate, even when they are acting as preceptors at the time of explanation, the vow-holders, the monks, should pay homage to them, placing the true Dharma first, but not at another time, when there is no explanation.

original: anyasmin kāle abhyāgatasyāsanadānādika sarva gaurava kartavyam /
analyzed: anyasmin kāle sarva gaurava kartavyam
translated: At another time, when a guest has arrived, all respect should be shown, such as offering a seat and so on.

analyzed: asat karma vandanā tyaktvā iti
translated: Except for paying homage to bad actions.

original: asatkarmapādaprakṣālanādi ka tyaktvā kāyavākcittavandanā tyaktvā arthādigaurava karta vya gṛhasthacellakayor bhikṣubhir iti /
analyzed: asat karma pāda prakṣālana ādi tyaktvā kāya vāc citta vandanā tyaktvā artha ādi gaurava gṛhastha cellakayoḥ bhikṣubhiḥ iti
translated: Having abandoned the performance of improper acts such as washing the feet of the lower caste, having abandoned the worship of body, speech, and mind, having abandoned the respect for wealth etc., the monks should not pay homage to the householder and celibate Vajra Master.

original: prāgbhikṣoḥ punaḥ prāgbhikṣu vajrācāryeṇābhiṣiktasya vajradharakṛtasya sarvakāla guror vanda nā kartavyā bhikṣubhir iti niyamaḥ /
analyzed: prāk bhikṣoḥ punar prāk bhikṣu vajra ācāryeṇa abhiṣiktasya vajradhara kṛtasya sarvakāla guroḥ vanda nā kartavyā bhikṣubhiḥ iti niyamaḥ
translated: The rule is that the monks should not pay homage to the Guru who is always a Vajra Holder and has been consecrated as a Vajra Master, before the monk, and before the monk who has been consecrated as a Vajra Master.

original: gṛhasthacellakayor abhi jñāprāptayor api bhikṣubhir narādhipenāpi vandanā kartavyā /
analyzed: gṛhastha cellakayoḥ abhi jñā prāptayoḥ api bhikṣubhiḥ narādhipena api vandanā kartavyā
translated: Even to the householder and celibate who have attained the state of Vajra Master, the monks should pay homage, even the king.

original: ato gṛhasthacellakabhikṣūṇām abhiṣiktānā sakaro na bhavati jyeṣṭhakaniṣṭhalakṣaṇena /
analyzed: atas gṛhastha cellaka bhikṣūṇām abhiṣiktānām sa karaḥ na bhavati jyeṣṭha kaniṣṭha lakṣaṇena
translated: Therefore, the consecrated householder, celibate, and monk do not have the characteristic of elder and younger by seniority.

analyzed: atra gṛhasthayoḥ prāc abhiṣiktaḥ jyeṣṭhaḥ
translated: Here, the householder who has been consecrated earlier is elder.

analyzed: eva cellakayoḥ madhye
translated: And so among the celibates.

original: tathā dvayor bhikṣvor madhye prāgabhiṣikto jyeṣṭhaḥ pūrvasthānavaśāt /
analyzed: tathā dvayoḥ bhikṣvoḥ madhye prāc abhiṣiktaḥ jyeṣṭhaḥ pūrva sthāna vaśāt
translated: And likewise among the two monks, the one who has been consecrated earlier is elder by virtue of his prior position.

original: yathā cakravartiputro 'bhiṣiktaś cakravartī bhavati rājaputro 'bhiṣikto rājā bhavati amātyaputro 'bhiṣikto 'mātyo bhavati /
analyzed: yathā cakravarti putraḥ bhiṣiktaḥ cakravartī bhavati rāja putraḥ bhiṣiktaḥ rājā bhavati amātya putraḥ bhiṣiktaḥ mātyaḥ bhavati
translated: And just as the son of a world conqueror becomes a world conqueror when consecrated, the son of a king becomes a king when consecrated, and the son of a minister becomes a minister when consecrated.

original: tathā bhikṣur abhiṣiktaḥ pradhānācāryo bhavati cellako madhyamācāryo bhavati gṛhastho 'dhamācāryo bhavati /
analyzed: tathā bhikṣuḥ abhiṣiktaḥ pradhāna ācāryaḥ bhavati cellakaḥ madhyama ācāryaḥ bhavati gṛhasthaḥ dhama ācāryaḥ bhavati
translated: Similarly, a monk is the principal preceptor, a celibate is the middle preceptor, and a householder is the lowest preceptor.

original: atas trayāṇā prāgbhikṣuḥ paścād vajradharaḥ kṛto gaṇacakre pratiṣṭhādau gaṇanāyakaḥ /
analyzed: atas trayāṇā prāk bhikṣuḥ paścāt vajradharaḥ kṛtaḥ gaṇacakre pratiṣṭhā ādau gaṇanāyakaḥ
translated: Therefore, of the three, the monk is first, then the Vajradhara, in the wheel of the assembly, the leader in the consecration and so on.

analyzed: tasya abhāve cellakaḥ tasya api abhāve gṛhastaḥ
translated: If he is not available, the celibate, and if he is not available, the householder.

original: yadā bhikṣur ācāryo vidyamāno 'pi gaṇanāyako na kriyate dānapatinā tadā pūjyapūjā
analyzed: yadā bhikṣuḥ ācāryaḥ vidyamānaḥ pi gaṇanāyakaḥ na kriyate dānapatinā tadā pūjya pūjā
translated: When a monk preceptor is available but is not made the leader by the donor, then due to the transgression of the worship of the venerable,

original: vyatikrameṇa puṇyaviparyāso bhavati dānapatīnā kāṣāyaliṅga dūṣaṇeneti eva sarvaguṇopetaḥ sarvajñadhvajadhāra ko daśākuśalaparityaktaḥ /
analyzed: vyatikrameṇa puṇya viparyāsaḥ bhavati dānapatīnā dūṣaṇena iti eva sarva guṇa upetaḥ sarvajña dhvaja dhāra kaḥ daśā kuśala parityaktaḥ
translated: there is a perversion of merit for the donors, by defiling the mark of the saffron robe. Thus, one endowed with all good qualities, bearing the banner of omniscience, abandoning the ten non-virtues,

analyzed: kartavyaḥ gaṇanāyakaḥ
translated: should be made the leader.

analyzed: niṣkṛpaḥ krodhanaḥ krūraḥ stabdhaḥ sa yataḥ
translated: One who is merciless, angry, cruel, obstinate, greedy, untruthful,

analyzed: sva utkarṣaṇaḥ
translated: self-aggrandizing,

analyzed: na kartavyaḥ dātrā buddha sukha arthinā
translated: should not be made the leader by a donor who seeks the happiness of the Buddha.

original: yo gṛhī maṭhikābhoktā sevako lāṅgalī vaṇik /
analyzed: yaḥ gṛhī maṭhikā bhoktā sevakaḥ lāṅgalī vaṇij
translated: A householder who enjoys a monastery, a servant, a plowman, a merchant,

analyzed: saddharma vikrayī mūrkhaḥ na cakre gaṇanāyakaḥ
translated: a fool who sells the true Dharma, is not the leader in the wheel.

original: ity eva vajracāryaḥ sarvajñadhvajadhārī vīrabhojye pūrvābhimuko dānapatinā kartavyaḥ /
analyzed: iti eva vajra cāryaḥ sarvajña dhvaja dhārī vīra bhojye pūrva abhimukaḥ dānapatinā kartavyaḥ
translated: Thus, the Vajra Master, the bearer of the banner of omniscience, should be seated facing east by the patron in the Vīrabhojya.

original: tasya dakṣiṇāṅge 'nukrameṇa jyeṣṭhakaniṣṭha bhikṣuvajradharācāryapaṅktiḥ kartavyā pūrvābhimukhī /🔽tato jyeṣṭhaka niṣṭhabhedena uttarābhimukhī cellakācāryapaṅktir nairṛtyād ārabhya yāvad agniparyantam /
analyzed: tasya dakṣiṇa aṅge nukrameṇa jyeṣṭha kaniṣṭha bhikṣu vajradhara ācārya paṅktiḥ kartavyā pūrva abhimukhī  tatas jyeṣṭhaka niṣṭha bhedena uttara abhimukhī cellaka ācārya paṅktiḥ nairṛtyāt ārabhya yāvat agni paryantam
translated: On his right side, in order, the row of elder and younger bhikṣu Vajra Master Ācāryas should be made facing east.🔽Then, if the row of householder Ācāryas is facing north, starting from the southwest up to the southeast, in order of seniority and juniority.

original: īśānād ārabhya vāyuparyanta dakṣiṇābhimukhī jyeṣṭhakaniṣṭhabhedena gṛhasthācāryapaṅktiḥ /
analyzed: īśānāt ārabhya vāyu paryanta dakṣiṇa abhimukhī jyeṣṭha kaniṣṭha bhedena gṛhastha ācārya paṅktiḥ
translated: Starting from the northeast up to the northwest, the row of householder Ācāryas facing south, in order of seniority and juniority.

original: gaṇādhipādi kṛtvā vāyavyād ārabhya nairṛtyaparyanta bhikṣvācāryapaṅktiḥ kartavyā /
analyzed: gaṇādhipa ādi kṛtvā vāyavyāt ārabhya nairṛtya paryanta bhikṣu ācārya paṅktiḥ kartavyā
translated: Starting from the northwest up to the southwest, the row of bhikṣu Ācāryas should be made, with Gaṇādhipa at the head.

original: khānapānādika pūrve kartavyam madhye rajomaṇḍalābhāve go mayatoyena catursra kartavyam tatra gandhapuṣpā dibhiḥ pūjā kṛtvā gaṇādhipavāmapārśve
analyzed: khāna pāna ādika pūrve kartavyam madhye rajas maṇḍala abhāve go maya toyena kartavyam tatra gandha puṣpa ādibhiḥ pūjā kṛtvā gaṇādhipa vāma pārśve
translated: In the east, the offerings of food and drink etc. should be made. In the middle, if there is no dust mandala, it should be made with cow dung water. There, having made offerings with incense, flowers etc., having made the Gaṇādhipa's left side mudrā,

analyzed: karma mudrā ekā sthāpayet gaṇādhipa mudrā kṛtvā
translated: one should place the Karma Mudrā. Having made the Gaṇādhipa's mudrā,

original: anyathā yoginyā vinā gaṇādhipateḥ pāna avi hita vīrabhojye 'pi /
analyzed: anyathā yoginyā vinā gaṇādhipateḥ pāna avi hita vīrabhojye
translated: Otherwise, even in a hero's feast where the Lord of the Assembly drinks without a yoginī,

original: tenāvaśya dānapatinā gaṇādhipasya mudrā ḍhaukanīyā puṇyavṛddhyartham /
analyzed: tena avaśya dānapatinā gaṇādhipasya mudrā ḍhaukanīyā puṇya vṛddhi artham
translated: the patron should necessarily offer the seal of the Lord of the Assembly for the sake of increasing merit.

original: yatra tu bhikṣuvajradharayor madhye jyeṣṭho mūrkhaḥ kaniṣṭho deśakas tatra kaniṣṭho gaṇādhipatiḥ /
analyzed: yatra tu bhikṣu vajradharayoḥ madhye jyeṣṭhaḥ mūrkhaḥ kaniṣṭhaḥ deśakaḥ tatra kaniṣṭhaḥ gaṇa adhipatiḥ
translated: But where the elder is foolish and the younger is the teacher between a monk and a Vajra Holder, there the younger is the Lord of the Assembly.

analyzed: jyeṣṭhaḥ tarpaṇīyaḥ mūrkhaḥ
translated: The elder, the foolish one, should be satisfied in another's house.

analyzed: tathā anya tantra antare yoginaḥ vīra bhojye pṛthak gṛhe pūjanīyāḥ
translated: Similarly, even those consecrated in another tantra are to be worshipped separately in a hero's feast of the yogins.

original: prāgbhikṣuṇyo 'bhiṣiktāḥ pūrvābhimukhā jyeṣṭhakaniṣṭhabhedena cellikyo 'bhiṣiktā uttarābhimukhā upāsikā
analyzed: prāc bhikṣuṇyaḥ bhiṣiktāḥ pūrva abhimukhāḥ jyeṣṭha kaniṣṭha bhedena cellikyaḥ bhiṣiktāḥ uttara abhimukhāḥ upāsikā
translated: If the consecrated nuns are in the east, the younger and elder ones are to be worshipped in the north, and the consecrated laywomen

analyzed: abhiṣiktāḥ dakṣiṇa abhimukhāḥ
translated: in the south.

analyzed: gaṇa nāyikā vāme ācāryaḥ dānapatinā
translated: The leader of the assembly is to be worshipped in the west by the patron.

original: anyathā upāyena vinā gaṇādhipatyā māsabhakṣaṇam avihita vīrabhojye /
analyzed: anyathā upāyena vinā gaṇādhipatyā māsabhakṣaṇam avihita vīra bhojye
translated: Otherwise, without the means, the Lord of the Assembly's monthly feast is not prescribed in a hero's feast.

analyzed: tena avaśya dānapatinā gaṇa ādhipatyai upāyaḥ ḍhaukanīyaḥ
translated: Therefore, the patron should necessarily offer the means to the Lord of the Assembly.

original: śeṣamaṇḍalādika pūrvavan madhye khāna pānādika pūrve /
analyzed: śeṣa maṇḍala ādika pūrvavat madhye khāna pāna ādika pūrve
translated: The rest, such as the mandala, is as before. Wine and so on are in the east,

analyzed: tatas gaṇādhipa ādi vāma āvartena bhakṣya bhojya pradeyam
translated: Then, the food and drink should be offered by the lord of the Ganas and others, in a clockwise direction.

analyzed: pāna śarāve nārikela ādi karoṭake vā deyam
translated: The drink should be offered in a wine cup or a coconut shell.

original: tato madyādika śodhayitvā bodhayitvā pradīpayitvā amṛtīkṛtya balyādika datvā pūrvoktagulikayā prokṣayitvā /
analyzed: tatas madya ādika śodhayitvā bodhayitvā pradīpayitvā amṛtīkṛtya bali ādika datvā pūrva ukta gulikayā prokṣayitvā
translated: Then, having purified the wine and other [substances], having awakened them, having illuminated them, having made them nectar, having given the oblation and other [offerings], having sprinkled them with the previously mentioned pill,

original: tato vāmahastena śodhayed okāreṇa dakṣiṇahaste na bodhayed ākāreṇa /
analyzed: tatas vāma hastena śodhayet okāreṇa dakṣiṇa haste na bodhayet ākāreṇa
translated: then one should purify with the left hand with the syllable Oṃ, one should awaken with the right hand with the syllable Āṃ.

analyzed: añjalyā pihitvā prajvālayet hūkārena
translated: Having covered with the añjali mudrā, one should ignite with the syllable Hūṃ.

original: garuḍamudrayā hoḥkāreṇāmṛtīkṛtya madyabindunā vāmānāmikā greṇa bhūmyā trikoṇa dharmodaya kṛtvā madhye vartula bindum /
analyzed: garuḍa mudrayā hoḥkāreṇa amṛtīkṛtya madyabindunā vāma anāmikā greṇa bhūmyā trikoṇa dharma udaya kṛtvā madhye vartula bindum
translated: Having made the nectar with the Garuḍa mudrā and the syllable Hoḥ, or with a drop of wine and the tip of the left ring finger, having made the triangle of the Dharma realm on the ground, in the middle a circle.

original: tanmadhye jñānacakra saptatriśaddevatātmaka svaccha pratisenātulya tasya tarpaṇa kuryād vakṣyamāṇavidhinā /
analyzed: tad madhye jñānacakra saptatriśat devatā ātmaka svaccha prati senā tulya tasya tarpaṇa kuryāt vakṣyamāṇa vidhinā
translated: In the middle of that, the wheel of wisdom, consisting of the thirty-seven deities, clear like a reflection, one should offer libation to it with the method to be described.

original: kṣetra pālādīnā nagaragrāmasya nā a a
analyzed: kṣetra pāla ādīnām nagara grāmasya nā a a
translated: For the field guardians and others, the city and village, with the syllables A and A,

original: kṣaraiḥ samaiḥ samanām a ā🔽dy antākṣarābhyā nām a ā
analyzed: kṣaraiḥ samaiḥ sama nām a ā  di anta akṣarābhyām nām a ā
translated: with the equal number of syllables, the equal one, with the syllables A and A,

analyzed: di anta dvi akṣaram
translated: the first and last, the two syllables at the beginning and end.

original: viṣamākṣarair nāma ādimadhyāvasānais tryakṣara nāma bhavati /
analyzed: viṣama akṣaraiḥ nāma ādi madhya avasānaiḥ tri akṣara nāma bhavati
translated: With uneven syllables, the name has three syllables at the beginning, middle, and end.

original: okāra ādau madhye nāmānte āḥ hūm /
analyzed: okāra ādau madhye nāmānte āḥ hūm
translated: The letter O at the beginning, in the middle of the name, and at the end, Aḥ Hūṃ.

analyzed: yathā o
translated: As O

analyzed: amuka āḥ hū
translated: such-and-such Aḥ Hūṃ.

original: bali gṛhṇa gṛhṇa sarvasattvāṇā śāntacitta kuru kuru svāhā /
analyzed: bali gṛhṇa gṛhṇa sarva sattvāṇā śānta citta kuru kuru svāhā
translated: Accept the offering, accept, of all beings, make the mind peaceful, make, svāhā.

analyzed: tathā o
translated: Likewise, O

analyzed: hārīti piṇḍake kṣī pratīccha svāhā
translated: Hāritikapinda, accept, svāhā.

analyzed: hārityai piṇḍake dve
translated: There are two Hāritikapindas.

original: o dū tike agragrāsa pratīccha svāhā o ā hū iti /
analyzed: o dū tike agra grāsa pratīccha svāhā o ā hū iti
translated: O Dū Tike, accept the foremost morsel, svāhā, O Ā Hū.

original: mantreṇābhimantrya bhūmyā sthāpayed yāvad bhojanānta bhavati /
analyzed: mantreṇa abhimantrya bhūmyā sthāpayet yāvat bhojana anta bhavati
translated: Having enchanted with the mantra, one should place it on the ground until the end of the meal.

original: o khakhakhāhikhāhi ucchiṣṭabalim ucchi ṣṭabhakṣaka svāhā ucchiṣṭabalimantraḥ /
analyzed: o ucchiṣṭa balim ucchiṣṭa bhakṣaka svāhā ucchiṣṭa bali mantraḥ
translated: O Kha Kha Kha Axi Khi Ucchiṣṭabali, eater of leftovers, svāhā, the mantra of the leftover offering.

analyzed: yathā anurūpa kāle sarva pratyeka kartavyam
translated: At the appropriate time, all should do it individually.

original: tataḥ khānapāna sarvair ācāryaiḥ saśiṣyaiḥ kartavyam /
analyzed: tatas khānapāna sarvaiḥ ācāryaiḥ sa śiṣyaiḥ kartavyam
translated: Then, all the teachers with their disciples should do it with all the food and drink.

original: yadā kaścid vivāda kalaha karotī sa nirddhāranīyaḥ /
analyzed: yadā kaścid vivāda kalaha karoti sa nirddhāranīyaḥ
translated: If someone creates disputes and quarrels, he should be expelled.

original: athāhakāra karoti cellako gṛhastho vā tadā sāmarthya pṛcchet /
analyzed: atha ahakāra karoti cellakaḥ gṛhasthaḥ vā tadā sāmarthya pṛcchet
translated: If he makes a loud noise, then the householder should ask about his ability.

original: yadi darśayati pañcābhijñādika sāmarthya tadā sa gaṇanāyakaḥ sarvatra sarveṣām /
analyzed: yadi darśayati pañcābhijñā ādika sāmarthya tadā sa gaṇanāyakaḥ sarvatra sarveṣām
translated: If he displays the ability of the five higher knowledges and so on, then he is the leader of the assembly everywhere for all.

original: anyathā śrutābhimānena sekajyeṣṭhābhimānena cellako gṛhastho gaṇanāyako na bhavati /
analyzed: anyathā śruta abhimānena seka jyeṣṭha abhimānena cellakaḥ gṛhasthaḥ gaṇanāyakaḥ na bhavati
translated: Otherwise, if he is a householder monk with pride in what he has heard and pride in being the eldest, he is not the leader of the assembly.

analyzed: yaḥ prāc bhikṣuḥ sa gaṇanāyakaḥ sarvatra
translated: The one who was a monk before is the leader of the assembly everywhere.

original: atha vīrabhojye nirddhārito daṇḍa yācate tadā khānapānādike daṇḍo dātavyas tasya gaṇādhipena /
analyzed: atha vīra bhojye nirddhāritaḥ daṇḍa yācate tadā khāna pāna ādike daṇḍaḥ dātavyaḥ tasya gaṇādhipena
translated: Or, if he is determined in the hero's meal and asks for punishment, then the leader of the assembly should give him punishment in the form of digging, drinking, and so on.

original: eva gaṇcakre vīrabhojye cāya vidhiḥ kartavyaḥ sarvatra dānapatineti //🔽Chapter XII Practice of Mantras idānī mantrasādhanavidhir ucyate /
analyzed: eva gaṇcakre vīrabhojye vidhiḥ kartavyaḥ sarvatra dānapatinā iti  chapter xii practice of mantras idānīm mantra sādhana vidhiḥ ucyate
translated: This is the procedure that should be done in the hero's meal and in the assembly everywhere by the patron.🔽Now the method of accomplishing mantras is being stated.

analyzed: iha vakṣyamāṇā gāthā maṇḍala vartanāya mudrā mantra sādhanāya uktā
translated: Here, the verses that will be stated are said to be for the sake of drawing the maṇḍala and accomplishing the mudrās and mantras.

analyzed: tat yathā
translated: It is as follows.

analyzed: giri gahvara kuñjeṣu mahā udadhi taṭeṣu ca
translated: In the caves and thickets of mountains, and on the shores of the great ocean,

analyzed: ādi siddhi śmaśāneṣu tatra maṇḍalam ālikhet
translated: And in the charnel grounds of the primordial siddhas, one should draw the maṇḍala there.

analyzed: iti sthāna nirdeśaḥ karma prasara laukika siddhi sādhana artha bhagavatā uktaḥ
translated: This is the instruction on the place, stated by the Blessed One for the sake of accomplishing the worldly siddhis that flow from the rites.

original: tatroktasthāne vakṣyamāṇamaṇḍala vartayitvā parvato pari stambhana mohana kīlana sādhayet /
analyzed: tatra ukta sthāne vakṣyamāṇa maṇḍala vartayitvā sādhayet
translated: There, having drawn the mandala as will be described in the mentioned place, one should accomplish the subjugation, enthrallment, and immobilization of mountains.

original: gahvare vṛkṣasakīrṇe maṇḍala vartayitvā vaśyākarṣaṇa sādhayet /
analyzed: gahvare vṛkṣa sakīrṇe maṇḍala vartayitvā vaśyā ākarṣaṇa sādhayet
translated: Having drawn the mandala in a deep, tree-filled place, one should accomplish the enthrallment and attraction.

original: kuñje svacchajalāśayataṭe maṇḍala vartayitvā śāntika pauṣṭika sādhayet /
analyzed: kuñje svaccha jalāśaya taṭe maṇḍala vartayitvā śāntika pauṣṭika sādhayet
translated: Having drawn the mandala in a grove on the bank of a clear water-body, one should accomplish the pacifying and nourishing.

original: mahodadhitaṭe maṇḍala vartayitvā vidveṣocchāṭana māraṇa sādhayet /
analyzed: mahodadhi taṭe maṇḍala vartayitvā vidveṣa ucchāṭana māraṇa sādhayet
translated: Having drawn the mandala on the shore of the great ocean, one should accomplish the enmity, disclosure, and killing.

original: śmaśāne maṇdala vartayitvā ādisiddhir iti ḍākinīmantroddhāra sādhayen mantrī /
analyzed: śmaśāne maṇdala vartayitvā ādi siddhiḥ iti ḍākinī mantra uddhāra sādhayet mantrī
translated: Having drawn the mandala in a cremation ground, the reciter should accomplish the initial accomplishment, the extraction of the Dākinī mantra,

original: tathā laukikā siddhayaḥ /🔽iha parvate nidhānasiddhi sādhayet /🔽gahvare ratnasiddhi sādhayet /
analyzed: tathā laukikā siddhayaḥ  iha parvate sādhayet
translated: and likewise, the worldly accomplishments.🔽Here, on this mountain, one should accomplish the treasure accomplishment.🔽In a deep place, one should accomplish the jewel accomplishment.

analyzed: kuñje sādhayet
translated: In a grove, one should accomplish the elixir accomplishment.🔽On the shore of the great ocean, one should accomplish the sword accomplishment.

analyzed: śmaśāne sādhayet
translated: In a cremation ground, one should accomplish the collyrium accomplishment.

analyzed: aparāḥ api tantra ukta vidhinā sādhayet mantrī iti
translated: The reciter should also accomplish other [accomplishments] according to the method described in the tantra.

original: atra prathama tāvac chmaśāne maṇḍala vartayitvā mahatī pūjā kṛtvā prathamasavatsare caitrapaurṇamāsyā mūlamantrasyār gha datvā naradantākṣasūtreṇa
analyzed: atra tāvat śmaśāne maṇḍala vartayitvā mahatī pūjā kṛtvā prathama sa vatsare caitra paurṇamāsyāḥ naradanta akṣa sūtreṇa
translated: Here, first of all, having made a maṇḍala in the cremation ground and performed great worship, having offered argha to the root mantra on the full moon of Caitra in the first year, one should recite the root mantra with a rosary of human bone.

analyzed: japet
translated: One should recite the root mantra.

original: pratimāsa lakṣatraya pañcamyādipratyekapūrṇāyā daśāśena ho ma kuryāt karmaprasaroktadravyaiḥ /
analyzed: kuryāt karma prasara ukta dravyaiḥ
translated: Every month, on the fifth and other full moon days, one should perform homa with the substances mentioned in the Karma Prasara.

original: eva varṣaikena ṣaṭtriśal lakṣa japel lakṣatraya ṣaḍayuta homayet /
analyzed: eva varṣa ekena ṣaṭtriśat lakṣa japet lakṣa traya ṣaṣ ayuta homayet
translated: In this way, in one year, one should recite the root mantra 360,000 times and perform homa 36,000 times.

original: o śrīvajra he he ru ru ka hu hū phaṭ ḍākinījālasavara svāhā iti mūlamantraḥ /
analyzed: o śrī vajra he he ru ru ka hu hū phaṭ ḍākinī jāla sa vara svāhā iti mūlamantraḥ
