translated: The root mantra is: O Vajra, He He, Ru Ru, Ku Hu Hu, Phat, Dakini Jala Sava, Svāhā.

original: tato dvitīye varṣe tenaiva vidhinā varṣam eka
analyzed: tatas dvitīye varṣe tena eva vidhinā varṣam
translated: Then, in the second year, by that very method, for one year

original: hṛdayamantra japed dhomayet /🔽o hrā hrī hre hū phaṭ /
analyzed: japet homayet  o hrā hrī hre hū phaṭ
translated: one should recite the heart mantra and perform homa.

analyzed: iti ṣaṣ akṣaraḥ hṛdaya mantraḥ
translated: The six-syllable heart mantra is: O Hrā Hrī Hre Hu Hu Phat.

original: tenaiva vidhinā tṛtīye varṣe upahṛdaya japed dhomayet /🔽o hrīḥ haḥ haḥ hu hū phaṭ /
analyzed: tena eva vidhinā tṛtīye varṣe japet dhomayet  o hrīḥ haḥ haḥ hu hū phaṭ
translated: By that very method, in the third year, one should recite the secondary heart mantra and perform homa.

analyzed: iti sapta akṣaraḥ upahṛdaya mantraḥ
translated: The seven-syllable secondary heart mantra is: O Hrīḥ Ha Ha Hu Hu Phat.

original: tatas tenaiva vidhinā caturthe varṣe kavacamantra japed dhomayet /
analyzed: tatas tena eva vidhinā caturthe varṣe japet homayet
translated: Then, according to that very method, in the fourth year, one should recite and offer oblations to the armor mantra.

original: o hū hū hū hi ha hu phaṭ /
analyzed: o hū hū hū hi ha hu phaṭ
translated: O HŪ HŪ HŪ HI HA HU PHAṬ.

analyzed: iti aṣṭa akṣara kavaca mantraḥ
translated: This is the eight-syllabled armor mantra.

original: tatas pañcame varṣe tanaiva vidhinā vajravārāhyā hṛdayamantra japed dhomayet /
analyzed: tatas pañcame varṣe tanā eva vidhinā vajravārāhyāḥ hṛdaya mantra japet homayet
translated: Then, in the fifth year, according to that very method, one should recite and offer oblations to the heart mantra of Vajravarahi.

analyzed: o vajra vairocanīye svāhā
translated: O Vajra Vairochaniye Svaha.

analyzed: iti
translated: This is the ten-syllabled heart mantra, purified by the ten perfections.

original: tataḥ ṣaṣṭe varṣe tenaiva vidhinā devīkavaca mantra japed dhomayet /
analyzed: tatas ṣaṣṭe varṣe tena eva vidhinā devīkavaca mantra japet homayet
translated: Then, in the sixth year, according to that very method, one should recite and offer oblations to the goddess's armor mantra.

original: o va yo mo hṛi hre hū phaṭ /
analyzed: o va yaḥ mo hṛi hre hū phaṭ
translated: O VA YO MO HRI HRE HŪ PHAṬ.

analyzed: iti aṣṭa akṣaraḥ mahā kavaca mantraḥ
translated: This is the eight-syllabled great armor mantra.

original: eva ṣaṇmantrāṇā ṣaḍvarṣaiḥ koṭidvaya ṣoḍaśalakṣāṇi mantrajāpaḥ /
analyzed: eva ṣaṣ mantrāṇā ṣaṣ varṣaiḥ koṭi dvaya ṣoḍaśa lakṣāṇi mantra jāpaḥ
translated: Thus, the recitation of the six mantras is two million and sixteen hundred thousand times over six years.

original: ekaviśatilakṣā ṇi ṣaḍayutāni homaḥ kartavyas tadā kāyaśuddhir bhavati yoginām //
analyzed: ekaviśati lakṣāḥ ṣaṣ ayutāni homaḥ kartavyaḥ tadā kāya śuddhiḥ bhavati yoginām
translated: The oblation should be done twenty-one hundred thousand times. Then the purification of the body of the yogis occurs.

original: The Purification of the Four Faces idānī caturvaktraviśuddhyartha caturvaktramantrajāpa ucyate /
analyzed: the purification of the four faces idānīm caturvaktra viśuddhi artha caturvaktra mantra jāpaḥ ucyate
translated: Now, for the purification of the four faces, the recitation of the four-faced mantra is stated.

original: atra makarasakrāntau mahodadhitaṭe maṇḍala vartayitvā ḍākinyā argha datvā pratyeke māse lakṣatraya jāpa kuryād dhoma daśaśena pratyekaikapūrṇāyā
analyzed: atra makara sakrāntau mahodadhi taṭe maṇḍala vartayitvā ḍākinyāḥ argha da tvā pratyeke māse lakṣa traya jāpa kuryāt homa daśaśena pratyeka eka pūrṇāyāḥ
translated: Here, at the entrance of Makara, having drawn a circle on the shore of the great ocean, having offered a libation to Ḍākinī, one should recite the mantra three hundred thousand times each month, and make ten thousand oblations each time the month is completed.

analyzed: pūrva vaktra mantrasya vajra ḍākinīnā ma sahitasya huhū phaṭkāra antasya
translated: For the mantra of the eastern face, Vajraḍākinī, accompanied by Huhuphṭkāra,

original: o sumbha nisumbha vajraḍākini hu hū phaṭ /
analyzed: o sumbha nisumbha vajra ḍākini hu hū phaṭ
translated: O Sumbha Nisumbha Vajraḍākinī Hu Hu Phṭ.

analyzed: iti caturdaśa akṣara pūrva vaktra mantraḥ
translated: This is the mantra of the eastern face with fourteen syllables.

original: trimāsair navalakṣāṇi japen navāyutāni homayet karmaprasarasādhanoktākṣasūtreṇa narākṣasūtreṇa prathamamāse dvi tīye uṣṭrākṣasūtreṇa tṛtīye
analyzed: tri māsaiḥ nava lakṣāṇi japet nava ayutāni homayet karma prasara sādhana ukta akṣa sūtreṇa nara akṣa sūtreṇa prathama māse dvi tīye uṣṭra akṣa sūtreṇa tṛtīye
translated: For three months, one should recite nine hundred thousand times and make ninety thousand oblations with the rosary mentioned in the Karma Prasara Sādhana, with a human rosary in the first month, with a camel rosary in the second, and with a donkey rosary in the third.

analyzed: khara akṣa sūtreṇa japet
translated: One should recite with the substances mentioned in the Karma Prasara.

analyzed: dravyaiḥ homayet
translated: One should make oblations.

original: tato meṣasakrāntau gahvare maṇḍala vartayitvā lāmāyā argha datvā pratyekamāse dakṣiṇavaktramantra lakṣatraya japed dhoma daśāśena kārayet
analyzed: tatas meṣa sakrāntau gahvare maṇḍala vartayitvā lāmāyāḥ argha da tvā pratyeka māse dakṣiṇa vaktra mantra lakṣa traya japet homa daśa āśena kārayet  /
translated: Then, at the entrance of Aries, having drawn a circle in a cave, having offered a libation to Lāmā, one should recite the mantra of the southern face three hundred thousand times each month, and make ten thousand oblations each time the month is completed.

analyzed: pratyeka pūrṇāyām
translated: For each completion,

original: pratha mamāse padmākṣasūtreṇa dvitīye raktacandanabījākṣasūtreṇa tṛtīye raktaguñjākṣasūtreṇeti /
analyzed: padma akṣa sūtreṇa dvitīye raktacandana bīja akṣa sūtreṇa tṛtīye raktaguñjā akṣa sūtreṇa iti
translated: In the first month with a rosary of lotus seeds, in the second with a rosary of red sandalwood seeds, and in the third with a rosary of red Gunja seeds.

original: eva navalakṣāṇi navāyutāni jāpo homaś ca kartavyaḥ /
analyzed: eva nava lakṣāṇi nava ayutāni jāpaḥ homaḥ ca kartavyaḥ
translated: Thus, one should do the recitation and homa for nine hundred thousand times.

original: o gṛḥṇa gṛhṇa vajralāme hu hū phaṭ /
analyzed: o gṛḥṇa gṛhṇa vajralāme hu hū phaṭ
translated: O Gṛhṇa gṛhṇa vajra-lāmā hu hū phaṭ.

original: iti dvādaśākṣaro dakṣiṇavaktramantro navalakṣa japen navāyuta homa yet /
analyzed: iti dvādaśa akṣaraḥ dakṣiṇa vaktra mantraḥ japet
translated: This twelve-syllable mantra of the right face should be recited nine hundred thousand times and offered in the homa nine thousand times.

original: tataḥ karkaṭasakrāntau girau maṇḍala vartayitvā khaṇḍarohāyā argha datvā pratyekamāse /
analyzed: tatas karkaṭasakrāntau girau maṇḍala vartayitvā khaṇḍarohāyāḥ argha da tvā
translated: Then, at the time of the Cancer solstice, having drawn a maṇḍala on a mountain, having offered a respectful offering to Khaṇḍarohā, in each month,

original: paścimāsya mantra lakṣatraya japed daśāśena homayet /
analyzed: paścimāsya mantra lakṣa traya japet daśa āśena homayet
translated: one should recite the mantra of the western face three hundred thousand times and offer the homa ten times.

original: prathamamāse putrajīvākṣasūtreṇa dvitīye rudrākṣasūtreṇa tṛtīye riṣṭikākṣasūtreṇa japed dhoma karmaprasaro ktadravyaiḥ kuryān mantrīti o
analyzed: prathama māse putrajīva akṣa sūtreṇa dvitīye rudrākṣa sūtreṇa tṛtīye riṣṭikākṣa sūtreṇa japet
translated: In the first month with a rosary of Putrajīva seeds, in the second with a rosary of Rudra seeds, and in the third with a rosary of Riṣṭikā seeds, one should recite and perform the homa ritual with the appropriate substances, so says the mantra-holder. O

original: gṛhṇāpaya gṛhṇāpaya vajrakhaṇḍarohe hu hū phaṭ /
analyzed: gṛhṇāpaya gṛhṇāpaya vajrakhaṇḍa rohe hu hū phaṭ
translated: Gṛhṇāpaya gṛhṇāpaya vajra-khaṇḍarohā hu hū phaṭ.

original: iti paścimava ktramantram aṣṭādaśākṣara navalakṣa japen navāyuta homayed iti /
analyzed: iti
translated: This mantra of the western face, consisting of eighteen syllables, should be recited nine hundred thousand times and offered in the homa nine thousand times.

original: tatas tulāsakrāntau kuñje maṇḍala vartayitvā rūpiṇyā argha datvā pratyeke māse uttaravaktramantra lakṣatraya japed ayutatraya homayet
analyzed: tatas tulā sakrāntau kuñje maṇḍala vartayitvā rūpiṇyāḥ argha da tvā pratyeke māse uttaravaktra mantra lakṣa traya japet ayuta traya homayet  /
translated: Then, when the balance has shifted, having drawn a circle in a bower, having offered a respectful offering to Rūpiṇī, one should recite the mantra of the northern face three hundred thousand times each month and make thirty thousand oblations.

analyzed: karma prasara dravyaiḥ
translated: With the substances that flow from the ritual.

original: prathamamāse sphaṭikākṣasūtreṇa dvitīye muktāphalākṣasūtreṇa tṛtīye śaṅkākṣasūtreṇa eva māsatrayeṇa navalakṣāṇi japen nāvāyutāni homayet /
analyzed: prathama māse sphaṭika akṣa sūtreṇa dvitīye muktāphala akṣa sūtreṇa tṛtīye śaṅkākṣa sūtreṇa eva māsa trayeṇa nava lakṣāṇi japet nāvā ayutāni homayet
translated: In the first month with a rosary of crystal beads, in the second with a rosary of pearl beads, in the third with a rosary of conch shell beads, in these three months one should recite nine hundred thousand times, not one hundred thousand times.

original: o ānaya ho bhagavan vajravajrarūpiṇi hu hū phaṭ /
analyzed: o ānaya ho bhagavan vajra vajra rūpiṇi hu hū phaṭ
translated: O bring! Ho! Blessed one! Vajra-vajra-formed! Hu! Hu! Phaṭ!

original: ity aṣṭādaśākṣaram uttaravaktramantra japed dhomayed iti /
analyzed: iti aṣṭādaśa akṣaram uttara vaktra mantra japet homayet iti
translated: Thus one should recite the eighteen-syllable mantra of the northern face and make oblations.

original: evam ekavarṣeṇa ṣaṭtrimśallakṣāṇi japet trilakṣāṇi ṣaḍayutāni homayet tato vaktraśuddhir bhavati //
analyzed: evam eka varṣeṇa ṣaṭtrimśat lakṣāṇi japet tri lakṣāṇi ṣaṣ ayutāni homayet tatas vaktra śuddhiḥ bhavati
translated: In this way, in one year, one should recite thirty-six hundred thousand times, and make three hundred and sixty thousand oblations. Then the purification of the face occurs.

original: The Purification of the Eight Doors idānī mukhādiśrotraviśuddhyartha mantrajāpa ucyate /
analyzed: the purification of the eight doors idānīm mukha ādi śrotra viśuddhi artha mantra jāpaḥ ucyate
translated: Now the recitation of the mantra for the purification of the ears and so on of the face is stated.

original: atra dvitīye varṣe makarasakrāntau mahodadhitaṭe maṇḍala vartayitvā kā kāsyāyā argha datvā naradantākṣasūtreṇa prathame pakṣe pañca daśadinaiḥ 🔽pañcadaśayuta japed aṣṭapadika dvitīyapakṣe uṣṭrada
analyzed: atra dvitīye varṣe makara sakrāntau mahodadhi taṭe maṇḍala vartayitvā naradanta akṣa sūtreṇa prathame pakṣe pañca daśa dinaiḥ  pañcadaśa yuta japet aṣṭa padika dvitīya pakṣe uṣṭra da
translated: Here, in the second year, on the Makara Sankranti, having drawn a mandala on the shore of the great ocean, having offered oblations to the goddess Kāsyā, with a rosary of human teeth, in the first fortnight, in fifteen days,

analyzed: tṛtīye kharadanta akṣa sūtreṇa
translated: one should recite the mantra fifteen thousand times. In the second fortnight, with a rosary of camel teeth, in the third [fortnight], with a rosary of donkey teeth.

original: eva sārdhamāsena sārdhacatvāri lakṣāṇi japet sārdha catvāry ayutāni homayet /
analyzed: eva sa ardha māsena sa ardha catvāri lakṣāṇi japet sa ardha catvāri ayutāni homayet
translated: Thus, in one and a half months, one should recite the mantra four hundred and fifty thousand times, and make forty thousand oblations.

analyzed: iti pūrva vaktra karma prasara ukta dravyaiḥ
translated: With the substances mentioned in the Prasara of the rites of the eastern face.

original: o namo bhagavate vīreśāya vajrakākāsye hu hū phaṭ /
analyzed: o namaḥ bhagavate vīreśāya vajrakāka āsye hu hū phaṭ
translated: O, homage to the Blessed One, Lord of Heroes, with a vajra crow face, hu hu phat.

analyzed: iti ekonaviśati akṣaraḥ prathama pada mantraḥ
translated: This is the mantra of the first pada, consisting of nineteen syllables.

original: tataḥ kumbhārdhe gahvare maṇḍala vartayitvā ulūkāsyāyā argha datvā pakṣatraya lāmoktākṣasūtreṇa sārdha catvāri lakṣāṇi mantrajāpa kuryād
analyzed: tatas kumbha ardhe gahvare maṇḍala vartayitvā ulūka āsyāyāḥ argha da tvā pakṣa traya lāma ukta akṣa sūtreṇa sārdha catvāri lakṣāṇi mantra jāpa kuryāt
translated: Then, in the middle of a pot, having drawn a mandala in a cave, having offered oblations to the goddess with a crow face, one should recite the mantra four hundred and fifty thousand times with a rosary mentioned in the three fortnights,

analyzed: daśa aśena homam
translated: and make oblations with ten parts.

original: o mahākalpāgnisanibhāya vajrolūkāsye hu hū phaṭ /
analyzed: o mahākalpa agni sanibhāya vajra ulūka āsye hu hū phaṭ
translated: O, to the one resembling the fire of the great kalpa, with a vajra crow face, hu hu phat.

analyzed: iti aṣṭādaśa akṣaraḥ dvitīya pada mantraḥ
translated: This is the mantra of the second pada, consisting of eighteen syllables.

original: tato meṣasakrāntau parvate maṇḍala vartayitvā śvānāsyāyā argha datvā sārdhamāsa khaṇḍarohākṣasūtroktakrameṇa sārdhacatvāri lakṣāṇi japed
analyzed: tatas meṣa sakrāntau parvate maṇḍala vartayitvā śvānāsyāyai sa ardha māsa khaṇḍaroha akṣasūtra ukta krameṇa sārdha catvāri lakṣāṇi japet  /
translated: Then, at the Aries ingress, having drawn a maṇḍala on a mountain, having offered a libation to the sow-faced one, one should recite 4.5 lakhs according to the method stated in the rosary of the half-month Khanda Rohini.

analyzed: daśa āśena homayet
translated: One should offer oblations with the ten-syllable [mantra].

original: o jaṭāmakuṭotkaṭāya vajraśvā nāsye hu hū phaṭ /
analyzed: o jaṭā makuṭa utkaṭāya vajraśvā nāsye hu hū phaṭ
translated: Oṃ to the one with the topknot and crown, the fierce vajra sow-faced one, hu hu phaṭ.

analyzed: iti saptadaśa akṣaraḥ tṛtīya pada mantraḥ
translated: This is the third-part mantra with seventeen syllables.

original: tato vṛṣabhārdhadine kuñje manḍala vartayitvā śūkarāsyāyā argha datvā sārdhamāsa rūpiṇyā akṣasūtroktavidhinā sārdha ca tvāri lakṣāṇi japet
analyzed: tatas vṛṣabha ardha dine kuñje vartayitvā śūkara āsyāyāḥ sārdha māsa rūpiṇyāḥ akṣasūtra ukta vidhinā sārdha ca tvāri lakṣāṇi japet  /
translated: Then, on the day of the half-bull, having drawn a maṇḍala in a grove, having offered a libation to the pig-faced one, one should recite 4.5 lakhs according to the method stated in the rosary of the half-month Rupiṇī.

analyzed: sārdha catvāri ayutāni homayet
translated: One should offer 45 thousand oblations.

original: o daṣṭrākākarālograbhīṣaṇamukhāya vajrasūka rāsye hu hū phaṭ /
analyzed: o daṣṭra kā karāla ugra bhīṣaṇa mukhāya vajrasūka rāsye hu hū phaṭ
translated: Oṃ to the one with fangs, a terrifying and fierce face, the vajra pig-faced one, hu hu phaṭ.

analyzed: iti dvāviśati akṣaraḥ caturtha pada man traḥ
translated: This is the fourth-part mantra with twenty-two syllables.

original: tataḥ karkaṭodaye padmasare kuñjavan maṇḍala vartayitvā yamadāḍhyā argha datvā rūpiṇyoktākṣasūtravidhinā sārdhamāsena sārdhacatvāri lakṣāni
analyzed: tatas karkaṭa udaye padma sare kuñja vat vartayitvā rūpiṇyā ukta akṣasūtra vidhinā sārdha māsena sārdhacatvāri lakṣāni
translated: Then, at the Cancer ingress, having drawn a maṇḍala in a lotus lake like a grove, having offered a libation to the one with the face of Yama's wife, one should recite 4.5 lakhs in half a month according to the method stated in the rosary of Rupiṇī.

analyzed: japet daśa āśena homayet
translated: One should offer oblations with the ten-syllable [mantra].

original: o sahasrabhu jabhāsurāya vajrayamadāḍhi hu hū phaṭ /
analyzed: o sahasrabhu jabhāsurāya vajra yama dāḍhi hu hū phaṭ
translated: O Sahasrabhu, for the sake of the Asura, give the thunderbolt, be firm, hu hu phat.

analyzed: iti ekaḥ naviśati akṣaraḥ pañcama pada mantraḥ
translated: Thus, the fifth pada mantra has one, nine, and twenty syllables.

original: tataḥ sihārdhadine parvate maṇḍala vartayitvā yamadūtyā argha datvā khaṇḍarohoktākṣasūtravidhinā pakṣatrayena sārdhacatvāri lakṣāṇi japed
analyzed: tatas siha ardha dine parvate maṇḍala vartayitvā yamadūtyāḥ khaṇḍaroha ukta akṣasūtra vidhinā pakṣa trayena sārdhacatvāri lakṣāṇi japet  /
translated: Then, in the afternoon on a mountain, having drawn a maṇḍala, having offered argha to Yamadūtī, according to the method of the rosary mentioned by Khaṇḍaroha, one should recite four and a half lakhs in three fortnights.

analyzed: dhoma daśa āśena kṛtvā visarjayet
translated: Having performed the homa with ten parts, one should dismiss.

original: o paraśupāśodyataśūlakhaṭvāṅga dhāriṇe vajrayamadūti hu hū phaṭ /
analyzed: o paraśu pāśa udyata śūla khaṭvāṅga dhāriṇe vajra yamadūti hu hū phaṭ
translated: O bearer of the raised axe, noose, trident, and khaṭvāṅga, to Vajrayamadūtī, hu hu phat.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus, the sixth pada mantra has five hundred and twenty syllables.

original: tatas tulāsakrāntāv udyāne maṇḍa la vartayitvā yamadaṣṭriṇyā argha datvā lāmoktākṣa sutrakrameṇa sārdhamāsena sārdhacatvāri lakṣāṇi japet
analyzed: tatas tulāsakrāntau udyāne vartayitvā sutra krameṇa sārdha māsena sārdhacatvāri lakṣāṇi japet
translated: Then, in the garden of Tulāsakrāntā, having drawn a maṇḍala, having offered argha to Yamadāṣṭrī, according to the method of the rosary mentioned by Lāmā, one should recite four and a half lakhs in a fortnight and a half.

analyzed: sārdha ca tvāri ayutāni homayet
translated: One should offer twenty-four thousand oblations.

original: o vyāgrājināmbaradharāya vajradaṣṭriṇi hu hū phaṭ /
analyzed: o vyāgra ajina ambara dharāya vajradaṣṭriṇi hu hū phaṭ
translated: O wearer of tiger skin and cloth, to Vajradaṣṭrī, hu hu phat.

analyzed: iti viśati akṣaraḥ
translated: Thus, the seventh pada mantra has twenty syllables.

original: tato vṛścikārdhadine samudrataṭe maṇḍala vartayitvā samudrābhāve kṣārodake vāpītaṭe maṇḍala vartayitvā yamamathanyā
analyzed: tatas vṛścika ardha dine samudra taṭe maṇḍala vartayitvā samudra abhāve kṣārodake vāpī taṭe maṇḍala vartayitvā yamamathanyā
translated: Then, at the end of the first half of the day, having drawn a maṇḍala on the seashore, or in the absence of the ocean, on the bank of a salt lake, having offered a libation to Yama-mathaṇī,

original: argha datvā vajraḍākiṇyoktākṣasūtravidhinā pakṣatraya mantra japet sārdhacatvāri lakṣāṇi pratyekaikapūrṇāyā homayed yāvat sārdhacatvāryayutāni
analyzed: argha da tvā vajra ḍākiṇya ukta akṣasūtra vidhinā pakṣa traya mantra japet sārdhacatvāri lakṣāṇi pratyeka eka pūrṇāyāḥ homayet yāvat sārdhacatvāri ayutāni
translated: one should recite the mantra for three fortnights according to the method of the rosary stated by Vajraḍākinī, one lakh and a half times each. One should perform a homa until one has offered four lakh and a half.

analyzed: bhavanti
translated: This is what happens.

original: o mahādhūmāndha kāravapuṣāya vajrayamamathani hu hū phaṭ /
analyzed: o mahā dhūma andha kāra vapuṣāya vajra yama mathani hu hū phaṭ
translated: O great one with a body blinded by smoke, to Vajra-Yama-mathaṇī, hu hu phaṭ.

analyzed: iti dvāviśati akṣaraḥ ṣṭama pada mantraḥ
translated: This is the mantra of the eighth stage with twenty-two syllables.

original: eva varṣaikena ṣaṭtriśallakṣāṇi japet ṣaṭtriśatayutāni homayet /
analyzed: eva varṣa ekena ṣaṭtriśat lakṣāṇi japet ṣaṭtriśata yutāni homayet
translated: In this way, one should recite thirty-six lakh and thirty-six thousand times in one year and perform a homa.

analyzed: tatas mukha guda nāsā śrotra netra nāḍī śuddhiḥ bhavati
translated: Then there is purification of the channels of the mouth, anus, nose, ears, and eyes.

original: The Purification of the TwentyFour Secondary Members idānī caturviśatipratyaṅgapadamantrajāpa ucyate /
analyzed: the purification of the caturviśati pratyaṅga pada mantra jāpaḥ ucyate
translated: Now the recitation of the mantra of the twenty-four secondary stages is stated.

original: iha samudrataṭe'lābhe kṣārodakavāpītaṭe maṇḍala vartayitvā mārgaśīrṣāmā vāsyā pracaṇḍayā argha datvā pañcatithibhiḥ pañcāyuta jāpa kuryāt
analyzed: iha samudra taṭe lābhe kṣārodaka vāpī taṭe maṇḍala vartayitvā mārgaśīrṣa amā vāsyā pracaṇḍayā argha da tvā pañca tithibhiḥ pañca ayuta jāpa kuryāt  /
translated: Here, on the shore of the ocean, in the absence of salt water, on the shore of a salt water pond, having drawn a mandala, in the month of Agrahayana, having offered a libation to Prachandaya, one should recite the mantra five thousand times with the five dates.

analyzed: pañcasahasra homa kuryāt
translated: One should perform a five thousand oblation.

original: eva pañcadaśadinaiḥ sārdhalakṣa mantrajāpa kṛtvā sārdhāyutahoma kṛtvā vajraḍākinyuktāpratyekai kākṣasūtreṇa pañcāyuta mantrajāpaḥ /
analyzed: eva pañcadaśa dinaiḥ sārdha lakṣa mantra jāpa kṛtvā sārdha ayuta homa kṛtvā
translated: Thus, having recited the mantra one and a half lakhs in fifteen days and having performed a fifteen thousand oblation, as stated by Vajra Dakini, with each rosary of beads, one should recite the mantra five thousand times.

original: o kara kara vajra pracaṇḍe vajrakaṇḍakapālin hu hū phaṭ /
analyzed: o kara kara vajra pracaṇḍe vajra kaṇḍa kapālin hu hū phaṭ
translated: O Kar Kar Vajra Prachanda, Vajra Khandaka Pali, Hu Hu Phat.

analyzed: iti viśati akṣaraḥ pratyaṅga prathama pada mantraḥ
translated: Thus, the first part mantra has twenty-one syllables.

original: tato mārgaśīrṣapūrṇi māyā gahvare udyāne vane vā maṇḍala vartayitvā caṇḍakṣyā argha datvā lāmoktākṣasūtraiḥ pūrvaktavidhinā pakṣaikena
analyzed: tatas mārgaśīrṣa pūrṇi māyā gahvare udyāne vane vā maṇḍala vartayitvā argha da tvā lāma ukta akṣasūtraiḥ pūrva kta vidhinā pakṣa ekena
translated: Then, on the full moon of Agrahayana, in a cave, garden, or forest, having drawn a mandala, having offered a libation to Chandakshi, with the rosaries of beads stated by Lama, according to the previously stated method, in one fortnight,

analyzed: sārdha lakṣa japet sārdha ayuta homayet
translated: one should recite the mantra one and a half lakhs and perform a fifteen thousand oblation.

original: o kuru kuru vajracaṇḍākṣi vajrāmahākakāla hu hū phaṭ /
analyzed: o kuru kuru vajracaṇḍā akṣe vajrā mahākakāla hu hū phaṭ
translated: O Kuru Kuru Vajra Chanda Kshi, Vajra Maha Khakala, Hu Hu Phat.

analyzed: iti viśati akṣaraḥ dvitīya pada mantraḥ
translated: Thus, the second part mantra has twenty-one syllables.

original: tataḥ pauṣāmāvāsyāyā parvate maṇḍala varta yitvā prabhāvatyā argha datvā khaṇḍarohoktākṣasutraiḥ pañcadaśa tithibhiḥ sārdhalakṣa japet
analyzed: tatas pauṣa amāvāsyāyā parvate maṇḍala varta yitvā prabhāvatyāḥ argha da tvā khaṇḍaroha ukta akṣasutraiḥ pañcadaśa tithibhiḥ sārdha lakṣa japet  /
translated: Then, on the new moon day of Pauṣa, having drawn a maṇḍala on a mountain, offered a respectful offering to Prabhāvatī, and recited the rosary of Khaṇḍaroha, he should recite the mantra fifteen times a day for a hundred thousand times.

analyzed: sārdha ayuta homayet
translated: He should offer twenty thousand oblations.

original: o bandha bandha vajraprabhāvati vajrakakāla hu hū phaṭ /
analyzed: o bandha bandha vajra prabhāvati vajraka kāla hu hū phaṭ
translated: O bind, bind, O Vajra-Prabhāvatī, O Vajra-Kāla, hu hu phaṭ.

analyzed: iti ekonaviśati akṣaraḥ tṛtīya pada mantraḥ
translated: This is the mantra of the third pada, consisting of nineteen syllables.

original: tataḥ pauṣa pūrṇimāyā kuñje maṇḍala vartayitvā padmasarastaṭe vā mahānasāyā argha dātvā rūpiṇyuktākṣasūtraiḥ pañcadaśadinaiḥ sārdhalakṣa
analyzed: tatas pauṣa pūrṇimāyāḥ kuñje maṇḍala vartayitvā padma saraḥ taṭe vā mahānasāyāḥ argha dātvā rūpiṇī ukta akṣa sūtraiḥ pañcadaśa dinaiḥ sārdha lakṣa
translated: Then, on the full moon day of Pauṣa, having drawn a maṇḍala in a garden or on the bank of a lotus lake, having offered a respectful offering to Mahānāsā, and recited the rosary of Rūpiṇī, he should recite the mantra fifteen times a day for a hundred thousand times.

analyzed: japet sārdhāyuta homayet
translated: He should offer twenty thousand oblations.

original: o trāsaya trāsaya vajrama hānāse vajravikaṭadaṣṭrin hu hū phaṭ /
analyzed: o trāsaya trāsaya vajrama hā nāse vajra vikaṭa daṣṭrin hu hū phaṭ
translated: O frighten, frighten, O Vajra, O Mahānāsā, O Vajra-Vikata-Dhasti, hu hu phaṭ.

analyzed: iti trayoviśati akṣaraḥ caturtha pada mantraḥ
